author: {'steamid': '76561198066109691', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2388, 'last_played': 1483315335}
review:
Having played the previous iterations of the Neptunia series, trying out the latest entry was something I looked forward to a good deal. The franchise returns yet again at full power. Detailed and very polished art, a pleasing and relatively varied soundtrack as well as cute and funny characters. These are things that Neptunia has always had in spades and the bar was raised even further here.

This time around some changes were made to the series' gameplay. Now the amount and type of attacks you can use in a combo will depend on your equipped weapon. There was also an even bigger emphasis placed on the difference in the attack types. Rush attacks will generate by far the most energy for your special attacks bar, while power attacks produce very little energy but inflict more damage. 

Unfortunately, these differences do not play out very well in practice. Although not as quickly apparent as in previous games, the best strategy in combat is still to have one or two characters constantly use rush combos to generate energy for the remainder of the party to exhaust on special attacks. Another mechanics change that Compile Heart most likely introduced to combat this was to let the player score guaranteed critical hits on their enemies if they used combo skills in a certain order, often mixing in all three types of basic attacks. The issue is that the special attack gauge is far more important than the small amount of damage you do with combos, thus making the change largely irrelevant in important fights. 

The above being said, those negatives are not necessarily very detrimental to the game. The combat is still fun, if mostly a stat check. I do however want to talk about two issues that I firmly believe are more of a problem.

Firstly, the story's way of intertwining with the gameplay is too predictable. When you complete the first part of the game, you are given a choice of which goddess' story arc you would like to play next. Eventually you must go through all four of the main characters stories before being able to proceed to the story's final stage. The first goddess' story arc, whichever one you choose based on your personal preference, will most likely be enjoyable. But it is when you must play through the other three stories that predictability hampers the enjoyment. The gameplay setup is similar each time: You play with two or three characters through a number of dungeons before fighting a different variation of the same boss that showed up in the other story arcs. You inevitably end somewhere around the same level each time. 

The reason it's not particularly fun to play through is that you realize the game is asking you to do the same thing four times in a row, except with slightly different characters. If you enjoy the story this might be fine, but gameplay wise I think this is something that should be strongly avoided.

As a final negative point I want to tackle in this review I would like to mention costume variety. The game's primary characters have a number of equippable costumes. But the actual amount of different clothing designs are staggeringly few. On display are simple recolours and copies of outfits that appeared many times already previously in the series. There's very little new content in this area which is a big disappointment. The potential for wacky, cute or interesting costumes is a good fit with the Neptunia universe and it is a shame to not see that realized as well as it could be.

I understand that I have mostly focused on what I find negative as that is my tendency. However I still very much recommend the game, perhaps especially so to newcomers. In terms of graphics, soundtrack, dungeon variety and gameplay no other game in the series has managed better than this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054350862', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 2493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2442, 'last_played': 1478858436}
review:
Toe be completely honest, as much as I love NepNep, I can't be bothered to really appreciate what is quintessentially another Victory Re:Make.

I'll admit, I never got through the original HDN back on the PS3 because of it's myriad of both optimization issues, and will agree on at least one factoid: It's come far, in terms of technical polish.

Sure, it's better than Re;Birth 3, 2, and 1 combined and it definitely feels "polished" for what it's worth, but it still doesn't account for the fact that it's literally like looking at a photograph of it's past self, smiling a bit at the fond memories, and then watching something you used to really enjoy suddenly fill you an odd feeling of disappointment, because it didn't live up to your expectations.

But anyways, onto the game features:

What can I say: It's Nep at it's...finest?

Featuring the same combat system you've seen over...
And over...
And over...
And over... again.

Now with sparklier forms, flashier moves, same-ish meta moeshit humor, and a new cast of characters that you can add to your ever growing arsenal of Nep crew: 

It's the perfect game for people who don't mind shilling out endless dollars at devs who lack any sort of creative direction, and will probably ride this series's concept to the very dirt it started from because they couldn't be bothered to try something experimentally different for their mainstay series. 

We have spin-off games whose production value range from Shitty - Semi-Shitty, whom only die-hard fans of the series could really appreciate.

In short. Megadimension was a chance for the Devs to bring something fresh and new to the main-series table... yet they failed miserably.

My hope is that Four Goddesses Online will be willing to brave in a new direction. 

I'm sorry Nep, I've failed you.
But you failed me harder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102117788', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 5033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4354, 'last_played': 1491922243}
review:
比较前作，在很多方便进行了革新，给人眼前一亮的感觉，比如更加大的迷宫，连携攻击系统，道路创建甚至次世代女神化都给人一种极大的新鲜感，本作的CG绝对精美。
在故事方面海王星第一次用了多线叙事，甚至在结局时还有分支选项，当我玩到那里时的确被惊讶到了。
在战斗方面，角色不同的胜利姿势，使用技能时若隐若现的小胖次，还增加了攻击特性这些都给本作加了不少分，但是比起重生，本作的ＥＸＥ技能真的弱的可以，不如重击。
本作的画面比起前作来讲精美了不少，地雷社越来越注重细节，比如在大地图上的人物会根据你的装扮的改变而改变。

再说说缺点，本作零次元篇绝对是亮点，不仅是在剧情还是怪物难度上面，但是不知道为什么，超次元和心次元的故事不是那么精彩，在投资方面也是无脑的刷刷刷，虽然刷刷刷也是ＲＰＧ游戏的要素，但是你总要标清楚，哪些道具是哪类怪物掉落了吧，所以在开发方面，受到很大阻力。

总体来讲我很喜欢这款作品，现在正在努力的刷白金，我觉得这款游戏对于不是很了解海王星的人来说，是一款出色的游戏，对于海王星的老粉丝来说也许不是那么让人满意，毕竟虽然进步不少，但是和理想中的还是有差距。但是看着涅普的故事，听着她无厘头的对话，还能偷看妹子们的胖次，还不是美滋滋，毕竟你可以在海王星里面找到你的老婆。
所以为什么不买一份呢。

author: {'steamid': '76561198084638847', 'num_games_owned': 330, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 2945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2899, 'last_played': 1487263274}
review:
สุดยอดเกม JRPG สาวน้อยที่คุณจะหาได้ใน steam
ภาคที่ดีที่สุดของซีรี่ย์ neptunia อยู่นี่แล้ว!

ข้อดี
-ภาพรวมเกมภาคนี้ดีขึ้นจากภาคก่อนๆ มาก จะอธิบายในข้อต่อๆ ไป

-การนำเสนอในภาคนี้ทำออกมาได้ดี โดยมันจะแบ่งเป็น 3 chapter ใหญ่ๆ โดยแต่ละ chapter จะมีกลิ่นอายเฉพาะตัวแบ่งได้ชัดเจนมากๆ ลูกเล่นในฉากบทสนทนาก็มีมากขึ้นด้วย

-เนื้อเรื่องเป็นหัวใจหลักของภาคนี้ เนื้อเรื่องค่อนข้างเข้มข้น มีปริศนาและค่อยๆ คล้ายปมไปเรื่อยๆ ตัวละครหน้าใหม่เพียบ และข้อข้างน่ารักมาก โดยเฉพาะ Orange Heart ♥ (และอีกตัวที่ทำเอาแปลกใจไม่น้อย แต่ขออุบไว้ละกัน)

-ระบบดันเจี้ยน และ แผนที่ที่ทำออกมาดีขึ้นเล็กน้อย 

-เพลงประกอบสุดดี ที่มีบางเพลงตามมาจากภาคก่อน แต่ก็มีหลายเพลงมากๆ ที่แต่งใหม่ และติดหูติดใจมาก ถึงกับต้องซื้อ soundtrack มาฟังเลย เพลง OP ของแต่ละ chapter เองก็ดีงามสุดๆ

-ความยาวในการเล่นค่อนข้างสูง 40 ชม.+ แน่นอน แล้วไหนจะฉากจบ 3 แบบที่ต้องไปตามเก็บอีก ยาวๆ

ข้อเสีย
-ของบางอย่างจะต้อง grinding เพื่อจะได้มา ซึ่งมันงี่เง่าสุดๆ

พูดได้ว่านี่คือ neptunia ภาคหลักที่ดีที่สุดในตอนนี้แล้วครับ
ถึงมันจะไม่ได้ฉีกภาคก่อนจนเป็นคนละเกม แต่ด้วยอะไรเล็กๆ น้อยๆ ที่มีการพัฒนาขึ้น และเนื้อเรื่องที่เข้มข้นผิดจากภาคก่อนๆ 
ทำให้เหล่าสาวก neptunia ทั้งหลาย ห้ามพลาด!!

9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068026936', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1483630355}
review:
Un J-RPG très sympathique qui permet à la fois d'être dans l'action tout en permettant une approche tactique très agréable puisque les combats se déroulent en tour par tour. Le dernier RPG a m'avoir fait autant apprécié son gameplay était FFX c'est pour dire !
Et puis quelle bande son messieurs dames, très bien réalisées avec des petites vidéos de scénarios attractive ! Parfois on se croirait dans un anime.
L'histoire est drôle et sympathique, on rigole souvent lors des (longues, très longues même des fois) conversations entre les personnages, l'univers est super et original.
Les graphismes ne sont pas fantastiques mais je trouve que l'univers du jeu fait qu'on peut se concentrer sur l'histoire et fermer les yeux sur les graphismes, bien que la 3D soit assez bien faite dans l'ensemble.

Pour donner une petite note après 5h de jeu, ce qui veut dire que je ne l'ai pas encore fini :

Gameplay : 9/10
Scénario : 9/10
Graphismes : 7/10
Bande Son : 10/10
Note globale : 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198036718143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2805, 'last_played': 1483469739}
review:
[i]*From someone who's played Re;Birth 1-3, played w/ the controller, and completed the true ending on NG+[/i]

This might be [b]the best Nep game I've played so far.[/b] If you're already familiar with the franchise, I'll take you through what's so different about this one that I like so much;

More characters! About 10 of them, of which all are likeable, perfectly realized, and relevant to the story. Uzume quickly became one of my favorite characters in the franchise and she's just awesome. Both new and returning characters are given lots of time to (exclusively) interact with one other and the relationships between them are clearly defined aside from ones I made up myself via Lily Rank. All characters are humanized past their stereotypes just enough and nobody takes a backseat to the main plot. Voice acting is great on everyone's part (especially Uzume), and they're all cute in their own ways, [strike]which is half the reason you're playing this anyway right?[/strike]

The story takes place throughout 3 dimensions and is divided into segments with an underlying plot that ultimately connects everything together. The story also maintains a good sense of urgency whenever it's relevant and does something pretty awesome (twice) into the game where it branches out as multiple events occur at the same time, and you get to see everyone doing their own thing i.e. contributing in their own ways. It keeps things current, interesting, and doesn't allow for as much downtime as the previous games.

Another thing about the story is that it feels more personal, and I can't get into that without spoiling the underlying plot. A lot of people may disagree with me on this, but the main villain is well developed as a character (especially compared to previous games) and makes way for a few touching and appropriately hilarious moments towards the story's last act. It's still severely flawed in the way that it's cheesy with many very arbitrary plot conveniences and seemingly too crazy ideas, but [b]I still like it[/b]. Sue me.

Speaking of previous games, this is pretty disconnected apart from the many returning characters, but the game expects you know them already so it still doesn't really make for a good entry point to the series. There's no mention of the Ultradimension, nor the remains of both ASIC and the Seven Sages, so don't expect to see Peashy, Rei, Pururu or CFW Magic here. The game has better sprites (and backgrounds) and visual fidelity in dungeons, though I did experience framerate drops in world maps. It has better balance between random/irrelevant and contextual humor, and is still endlessly garnished with 4th wall breaking, [b]fanservice[/b], and pop culture references as well as subtle commentary about the gaming industry, [i]or maybe I'm just looking too much into it.[/i]

Gameplay is a bit better I guess(?), I never really liked the dungeon crawling in the first place. I like the new investment system, the Sharing Field battles, formation skills, scouting system and the especially [i]glorious[/i] fast-forward button for battles (and almost everything else really). Grinding in a Nep game has never been easier (still very tedious though). Anyway, they're awesome [i]for a while,[/i] but these mechanics feel very underutilized and I ended up not using a lot of them in the end, much like the previous games. Development is mostly unnecessary, Sharing Field is just spamming skills, disc development doesn't have enough impact, so on and so forth, and these things seem to cater to hardcore gamers--which I am not--and offers little to no incentive otherwise aside from prolonging playtime via micromanagement.

Megadimension Neptunia is a Neptunia game on every level, rest assured if you've played any of the previous ones then you know what's coming. That said, I find this one to have the most interesting story and characters, and that kept me engaged for longer in comparison. Production quality in general seems much improved but gameplay is still lacking for a filthy casual like me. Game's not revolutionary, it still cheesy, cliche'd, and very lighthearted, [b]but it's still pretty damn fun.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198065753122', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 9760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9760, 'last_played': 1483422585}
review:
Nothing has changed much. It’s still the same JRPG that got the same game systems working in the background as the Re;Birth branded titles. But there are enough changes here that seem to rebalance those systems, so much that the game as a whole resulted in being a more refined, more tactical and once again enjoyable gaming experience.

For the 4rd time you play as teenage girls having an adventure by progressing the story trough reading VN-Events, by visiting dungeons, fighting monsters and collecting items. With story being a big focus of the game again, the writers finally found the middleground between the too serious written Re;Birth2 and the over the top hilarious humour of Re;Birth3. The girls act surprisingly close to their characters this time which works in favour of story progression. Dialogs no longer sidetrack into what seemed like endlessly going on walls of texts with bad jokes.

What are the most interesting additions to the gameplay now? Stella’s Dungeon is no more. Scouts are now implemented into the maingame and can add certain bonuses to the dungeons you visit. Higher Droprate, Monster Change, more EXP, less Credits, etc. You also no longer just warp between Nations on the overworld map. Instead you have to walk along a path with random encounters between Dungeons and Points of Interest. The Investment system is a great addition too: You can upgrade each nation thus adding more items to the shops, to find additional scouts or to increase the nation’s shares.

Combat is tighter than ever! Bye bye 9999 damage! The Guard Break System got removed. Combos now consist of Standard, Power and Rush attacks that activate combo bonuses when specific criteria are met, like “didn’t used power”, “last attack was rush” and so on. Each weapon starts out with one of those three attack types and combos need to be set up according to their combo bonuses for maximum damage effect. There is also a higher priority on items now because status effects occur more frequently.

What’s not so good about the game? No NewGame+ or Endgame content! Re;Birth3 had up to 2 hours more VN-events to watch and more dungeons with worthwhile loot to offer. Victory II does not. You can level up your characters to level 999 again but with only a single mob available to you that gives 10million EXP. To reach the golden 999 the game requires you to fight this single mob over 5000 times or more. Not an elegant solution.

The character DLCs are great because they add new characters with their very own VN-Events and story. The downside is that those characters are so overpowered that they break the tight balance of the game. My advice, use them in NewGame+. Weapon and Item DLCs include even more content to break the balance while Nightwear and Bikini DLC just add cosmetic changes.

Victory II is a tight game, even more so without the use of DLCs. The characters are loveable and the humour marvelous. Expect lots of anime tropes and popculture references. Don’t regret buying if you love anime, JRPG’s or cute girls doing cute things.

Award Update

author: {'steamid': '76561198144083692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3767, 'last_played': 1575170652}
review:
Im a big fan of this series from since it came out on ps3 and i love all of them.I got this one for free as a gift from a friend to replay it after i finished it on my ps4 already.Except the game being exceptional x se i cannot really stand how much buggy it is on the FPS rate.Fps drops costantly making the game stuttering badly when it goes down.The game start at 60 fps but then the fps start dropping to 15 fps or even lower sometime and this really need a patch.

Another thing that need seriously to be patched is the damages that the exe drives deal.Exe drives are supposed to be the finisher move of each character and its just ridicolous that in the game we get to deal more damages with normal combos of how much we deal with a finisher considering that the Exe drives have a big delay as well.The Japanese version of the game received a patch for it on ps4 to set back exe drives to be more powerful of normal combos attacks and i really hope to see a patch for that as well here on steam cause that kills the game variability to use each combos to fill exe drives and exe drives to deal damages.

Aside that,i will give the review a positive feedback and i suggest it to all the fans of this series but those problems seriously NEED a patch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032583154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1528327154}
review:
If you liked the first 3 Neptunia games but are kinda tired of seeing the same old formula, models and maps applied to each iteration, do not despair!
This sequel is exactly the breath of fresh air the series needed imo: Awesome new graphics and UI, a lot of changes to combat mechanics and other systems, great new characters and (for me) most important of all - tons of new enemies and maps!.

Recommend this to anyone who likes the series and is looking for another great game in the series that actually takes some risks and makes some changes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080075205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1484024847}
review:
I found the Neptunia games by accident while browsing the Steam Store earlier this week. Seeing that it was on sale and had such a sheer amount of positive reviews, I took the plunge on this one. Needless to say, I became an instant fan within minutes of playing. Gameplay wise, the battle system is fun, easy to learn, and much better with a controller. Neptune and the gang are funny, loveable, and have made an artform of fourth wall breaking. It's basically an over the top visual novel in game form and it works on every level. The best part is that Idea Factory made it so the characters and game world are explained in detail so people that haven't played the series can start with the latest and greatest.

My experience thus far? 10/10

On a side note, I would take the negative reviews about crashing and stability with a grain of salt. I'm using an older NVidia GeForce GTX 750 ti on Windows 10 with the most recent drivers and haven't experienced any of the issues people have posted thus far up to the second story. I've also seen people complaining about controller issues, but again, zero issues using a wired Xbox 360 controller. From what I've read, the stability/crashing seems to happen at random points in the game with no warning so I'll be on the look out. However, for the sale price and hours of entertainment I've had with it so far, it's worth the gamble.

author: {'steamid': '76561198278494712', 'num_games_owned': 382, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4736, 'last_played': 1483065728}
review:
重要：电源选项要选高性能，不然游戏会经常黑屏和闪退，并且建议在二周目前不要用DLC的武器和防具。
接近100小时白金封盘+3个结局全通+莎木迷宫刷到100级+击杀八百祸津日神，谈一下感想。
如果是玩过前作的老司机，一定会对本作各方面的革新感到不适应，比如前作升级后回满血回满蓝，本作还要你自己走回据点才能回血，尤其是零次元篇等级低脆皮，又只有涅普子、鸡鸭、涡芽三人组的时候，要不停的靠磕800药才能过图，鸡鸭和涡芽双人洞穴打大妈那关，我都不知道磕了多少瓶药才打过去。又比如EXE大招的伤害大幅降低，本作EXE系统回归后，EXE大招除了后期的次世代模式以外，居然还没平砍和SP技能的伤害高，对比重生2一个EXE大招随便上9999上限，真不知道这个EXE系统的意义何在？而且等级压制的情况依然存在，后期刷到100级后主线怪物都是秒死，主线BOSS四个人一套平砍暴击带走，也就巨大战还有点意思，不过巨大战无限SP其实也是随便打。
除去JRPG部分的偷工减料，AVG部分还是挺令人感动的，涡芽的命运就像是10多年前那个失道寡助的DC主机，缺乏RPG大作支撑外加莎木天价暴死使得涡芽被封印成黑历史（体现在剧情里，涡芽和S-SHA没有任何互动，后期象征着世嘉黑历史的莎木迷宫）。讲真如果涡芽出生在这个大作频出的年代，第一第二方有大量优质的沙盒游戏，外加不输给巨硬大法地狱的第三方支持，游戏业界大概就不会有涅普子的出生了吧（笑）。戏份上就只要紫国3人组+大涅普比较足，其他3国除了一小段分支线路外和路人就没什么差别，存在感甚至还不如黄金四人组，不过梦境的剧情倒是把我逗乐了。梗也听出来挺多的，像K-SHA的诺瓦露姐姐让开，我杀不了那家伙，还有白国革命家的你竟然打我两次，白国死宅的幼女女神真是太棒了等等。
三个结局只有涡芽便当才是呼应了心次元篇梦要醒来这个主旨的真结局，涡芽独白的那段CV演技我给满分，继承了涡芽思念的涅普子和鸡鸭也比较符合现实，然而另外的涡芽复活是个什么鬼？强行解除机器封印就能复活，黑芽表示我做个反派累死累坏仇视和忍受了这个游戏业界几十年，最后因为众人嘴炮就强行和涡芽融合，连复活的机会都不给也是日了狗了，甚至涡芽还碰到了个记得她的老爷爷，人家都从小屁孩变老了，涡芽还是个小女生这个时间BUG地雷社你们不知道的吗？所有的一切就像名为真结局的一场梦，在我看来和坏结局并没有什么两样。
最后让我评分的话，JRPG部分我给6分勉强及格，AVG部分给8分，两个坏结局扣2分。
期待一年后地雷社的四女神OL上架能给我带来惊喜。

author: {'steamid': '76561198283106124', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 6314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5308, 'last_played': 1471064593}
review:
从系统细节上就能让人感觉到诚意满满！早就买了ps4上的限定版可惜没主机玩不了，等好久了呢！！
等玩通后再细评！2016 7/7
♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥
这是可爱的分割线
在通了这么久之后，翻开评论，终于打起精神来把这个评论的坑填了。
本人算是刚接触海王星1年多，虽然没有ps4，但是在去年就买了ps4的限定版V2。然而在今年暑假登上steam上才吃到了这口冷饭。
总体来说，对于非核心向的海王星粉丝来说V2值得一玩，对于核心向海王星粉丝来说是令人感到有些失望的。
而我是属于后者。
画面什么的我就不谈了，说的人太多了。对于已经成型的固定海王星系统，V2在继承的基础上也做出了不少的创新；比如大地图路线图，多角色连携攻击等等。在继承基础上，怪物的配音反馈，不同的战斗胜利姿势等等。
这些在刚接触的时候会使海王星的玩家明显感觉到进步，从而在心情上进入一种期待期和兴奋期。
然而在零次元章节结束之后，剧情质量迅速下滑，玩家对系统的创新和继承在每个“无关紧要”的支线和主线的刷刷刷面前被磨损至平。
“那我们就来个次世代女神化吧！”地雷社的脚本如是说道。
然后玩家的感情再一次被带动，后来女神的梦，恶堕等等也起到了缓和剧情智商下限的影响，最终普通结局在一派和气中还不算违和地完结了。
我差评的主要原因是打了90多个小时二周目之后的真结局。
剧情强制发展，强制复活，强制克服心魔，强制贬低反派智商，脚本已死。
后来在吴子梅在飞船上心悸了以下，我以为地雷社原来是想搞一搞大新闻！结果也不是，就是智商不足。
既然真结局跟普通结局的连贯性这么烂，为什么我还要肝那么多个小时去打二周目为了看一个掉智商的真结局？
信仰
有人说，全成就都没有！白金都没有！还谈信仰？
我的回答是：我之所以喜欢海王星是因为游戏业界的向往和对主机业界各种梗的欣赏，海王星游戏性方面就不谈了，都知道很.....
又有人说，作为一款废萌游戏，对剧情就少点要求，够萌和治愈不就行了吗？
我的回答是：海王星作为一款废萌之前更是一款RPG游戏，RPG游戏剧情质量是重中之重,然而V2在这方面有硬伤。（其实我的要求也不高，至少要达到RB1的程度啊！）
我PSV上海王星游戏也几乎全套了，店特也有两三套，比某些精神股东不知道高到哪里去了，所以这时候我还是要说，我肝到100小时就是因为。
信仰
然而最后给我带来的是
↓
失望
♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥
这是可爱的分割线
接下来总评
考虑到之前的海王星系统,V2系统革故鼎新
9/10
剧情脚本爆炸，编剧划水。
6/10

总体
7.5/10
好评
××××××××××××××××××××××××××××××××××××
这是不可爱的分割线
后记
我现在给好评的原因是期待四女神ONLINE的系统真正创新和对海王星最后一丝的期待。
如果四女神也炸了，那本喵就真正弃坑了。
二柄上还有评论说非粉误入防止sb评论的，我只想说一款真正的好游戏要敢于接受全方面的评论才可能变得更好，做人也是如此。
说非粉误入的那个？阁下才是真正的sb吧。

author: {'steamid': '76561198202258050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482888502}
review:
Warning: Mega Rant Here.

I've faced an endless amount of glitches, lag, errors, controller mapping difficulties, camera disfunctions, quality issues and the lot. This game has so far been virutally unplayable. I have close to two hours registered "playing" the game, and its all been dedicated to trying to fix this garbage. Its a shame that this game can't even play its opening video cutscene, or get a line of dialogue in the visual novel aspect without a five second long pause. 

Controls:
The amount of buttons on this game is insane as its obviously a direct port from PS Vita. Except unlike good ports, it doesn't even tell you what the buttons are supposed to really do, in other words, it doesn't translate a ps vita keyboard to a pc keyboard. Furthermore, they decided to not let you use the mouse to rotate the camera, but you are forced to use the keyboard, using 4 extra buttons. I found its easier to play with a contorller than the keyboard, since it has more buttons to use than fucking warcraft. But even the camera, no matter what I do, no matter what button I assign to the controller, will not stop the camera from rotating. When I plugged in my controller from my PS4, I still had to rework out the buttons as the one assigned either went directly to a button that made no sense (i.e. What would be used as the L2 Button was assigned as left x axis down or something like that). Then I would have problems where I would want to assign one button to a control that was already being used. So instead of the game reverting that previously used button to blank, it would just share it. So at one time, both Yes and No responses were on the same button, and would have the same effect. I had to rework around this, going back to my pc keyboard, thne going back to controller, then reworking (somehow) the default option so that I had to restart the entire mapping process. Kill me.

Video:
The video cutscene look really cool, its a shame that they work for ten seconds before scratching and lagging out, also, the audio follow that too. Toi fix it, I tried to dimish the quality of the game, disable V-Sync and other buttons, switch from window to fullscreen to boarderless - all to see if I could actually play the videos. Eventually, I gave up. It wasn't going to work. Whenever the game has its VN aspect, no matter what setting you put it on, the character will just wait ten seconds before making another line of dialogue. They just stare at you with their weird slowly blinking cartoon faces.

Audio:
The audio doesn't seem to be too bad, whenever it fails, its still in sync with the video since thats lagging too.

Story:
Ha! If I could even experience the story, I would let you know how it went. But the idea of having the different arcs as different games or something sounds interesting. I just wish I could actually play it.

Overall:
This was depressing, I am a huge fan of the series, I own the original three games, not the rebirth remakes. They're all on PS3. I do own MegaTagmensional Blanc + NepNep vs Zombie on PC. It has similiar control problems, espcially the pathetic conversion from PSVita to PC. But the video and gameplay worked fine. I assume that maybe a more powerful computer could handle the problems I faced with my game, but I own a Surface Pro 3, and it handled the Zombies game fine, so why shouldn't this?

At this time I am still reseaching how to fix the 10 trillion problems I faced in this game, but no article or help guide seems to fix the problems. I'm currently considering just returning the game and refunding my money. As a player, I deserve to be able to play the game as it should be intended, and not have to rewire my whole hard drive to accomidate for the kusoge game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157331905', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1516027546}
review: Il faut dire ce qui est. Megadimension Neptunia est fait pour les fans de mangas ou bien de japanimation. Ou bien du Japon tout court ! J'ai decouvert ce jeu car il me titillait l'esprit depuis un certains temps. Les soldes de noël en vue, je fonce ! Je lance le jeu et la premiere chose que je constate c'est que les musiques sont geniales, le gameplay assez particulier, plus orienté niveau RPG, des graphismes en HD, et surtout, des jolies filles. Le jeu est en anglais certes, mais on comprend trés vite les menus et j'en passe. Bref, je ne peux que vous recommander ce superbe jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166459160', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1499268310}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia VII (V-2, not 7) is the sequel to Hyperdimension Neptunia Victory/Re;birth3, the plot is as follows:
One day, Neptune was taking a nap, when she woke up and was heading back to the basillicom, she found a strange broken game console, upon her arrival, her and Nepgear attempted to fix up, but the power buttons opens up a portal to a new dimension, after travelling in said dimension, Neptune and Nepgear find Uzume Tennouboshi, the two then learn that like themselves, Uzume is a CPU, named Orange Heart, the two also learn that they're in the Zero dimension, and that Uzume fights against the 4 dark CPUs, giants the size of a skyscraper, Nep and Gear then swear to help Uzume while finding a way back home to their dimension.

VII follows the core Neptunia battle system with some minor variations, your weapons now affect what attacks you can pull off, in addition, some attacks have combo potential, meaning that if executed in the proper order, you will be guaraunteed to pull of serious damage rather than spamming the same buttons, the EXE bar also fills up faster but is not stored after battles, some enemies and bosses have parts that must be broken to deal more damage, when said part is broken, you gain more EXP and credits
VII also introduces random encounters on a grid-styled map system, these can be turned off after completing the game once should you decide to do a NG+

The main cast of the Neptunia franchise is still here and in full force, Uzume is a right-round blast of a character, showing off her cool side while occasionally becoming her valley girl self, there's also Umio, the most gentlemanly fish-man you will ever see, and Adult Neptune, The Neptune that didn't become a CPU in the Ultradimension, replacing the maker characters of the past games is the new "Gold Third", consisting of K-sha: a yandere soldier, C-sha, a hunter who wants to do the people good, B-sha who likes credits but also uses her Presto mask persona to fight crimes, and S-sha, who has a severe case of the "not interested"

Overall: VII is a great addition to Neptunia, but in order to understand some of the plot points, you must have some knowledge of Re;birth2 and Re;birth3, else some plot points may leave you questioning it

author: {'steamid': '76561198082892662', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1065, 'last_played': 1483368161}
review:
讲道理，作为PS4版预定，主机也是V2限定版，为什么我还要到G胖这里再买一遍？？
...因为......我TM也不知道啊....只是看见：诶？V2打折了啊！！
....然后。。眼睛突然一黑！！支付宝突然被扣了钱，库里突然多了一款游戏！！！
WTF！！！？？？

好吧_(:з」∠)_....再买一遍主要肯定是信仰...
第二，PS4版我的是日版所以剧情没怎么看，打上汉化特地看看剧情，而且我也没打出真结局
不过讲道理，V2画面明显有了很大的变化，还是不错的
不过....我觉得操作方面有点小小的别扭？？总感觉没前几部那么顺畅了
剧情方面依然很欢乐，中途时不时还会正经一会儿（帅不过一分钟_(:з」∠)_）....

嘛....海王星系列主要靠的还是信仰啊。我很期待这次的新
以上

                                                我的本子全特效带竟然会时不时掉下帧！！简直吃了一惊好么！！
======================================================================

_(:з」∠)_。。。19个小时，我特么喵的终于把真结局打出来了_(:з」∠)_。。
没看完真结局之前还准备说“卧槽！这什么鬼，和升天结局有什么区别“然后官方玩了一波套路_(:з」∠)_

author: {'steamid': '76561197960863310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1482908482}
review:
I'd probably give this game a neutral rating if I could, but as it stands it's hard to recommend it based on performance alone.

The game is severely unstable in the sense that crashes are frequent and random. Not sure if the game has issues with certain hardware configurations (my specs are far above and beyond what a game like this could ever require) or doesn't play well with certain pieces of software, but either way the problem is legitimate and support from the developer appears to be non-existent. "Solutions" are out there, but none have worked for me personally.

I literally spend more time hoping I reach a save point before I lose too much progress from a crash than I do actually enjoying the game.

The game itself seems fine. I like the combat systems, the art direction, and the soundtrack. The story, while pretty whimsical, is entertaining enough - though the writing is beyond fucking cheesy. I want to recommend it, but tbh all I can really say is buy at your own risk... the game may or may not run correctly on your hardware and you may just end up with the frustrating experience of being unable to enjoy the game you want to enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198316844055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3322, 'last_played': 1483344852}
review:
在评价前先说一点题外话、
讲道理，海王星全系列最高的编剧水平在片尾 这几个小故事比正传的扒掉卖萌搞笑捏他以后的主线更有韵味。 重生2ed一直等待姐姐归来琪雅酱，重生3ed传达【女神是引发奇迹的存在】后消失在次元裂缝中nep的背影 心次元升天结局消失在夜空下的涡芽，与真结局接受另一个自己的涡芽，如果剧情这么做肯定更深刻。

先说一下剧情的评价吧

一如既往的硬核，如果对acg的了解不达到一个非常高的层次是很难搞懂充斥整个游戏的梗的。
动画梗，游戏业界梗，以及日本网络文化梗无处不在。以我的宅龄实在是无法全部明白，【如果有解析汇总的帖子，请贴在评论中，万分感谢】但仅仅是知道的那部分也带给了我无限的欢乐。比如 技能上 卡普空的怪猎梗和洛克人梗 可乐美的箱子梗【现在想想konami真心不配用这梗】 se 超武神霸究斩 斩铁剑  财团b...抱歉我没看出来 涡芽的exe大概是neta白金？ 萝姆的新技能冰榔头的台词——让你见识一下新时代的魔法少女 简直欢乐。
剧情方面白国的怪猎梗 还有革命家的我爸爸都没打过我！ 巨硬国的百万亚瑟王梗【不知道和巨硬有什么联系？】se的拍电影梗和陆行鸟梗 财团b有氪金梗 黑国的合金装备梗等等等。

本作的主线是世嘉dc游戏机的黑历史，剧本比较老套，用脚趾都能猜到剧情走向，但某种意义上也是neta经典动画剧情吧？
气氛渲染比较好，零次元的最终战，羽田市还有人记得nep那一战，涡芽的最后一战配合语音bgm演出效果爆炸，骗人飙泪。但也有失败的地方，nep在教会看到涡芽本体消失那个飙泪真的尴尬。四女神洗脑那一战的演出也有点问题。 但总体让人满意。

接下来是其他方面

RPG部分

画面进步了不少，建模比前作精致了许多，但不变的是无节操的重复利用，我知道地雷社是个小作坊，既然你的资源有限，与其给怪物语音，与其做一堆闭着眼睛就能探索过来的迷宫，不如用这些资源多做一点技能如何？次时代模式的头发能不要那么抖好么？
rpg部分有人可能觉得没什么好讲的，但其实本作的思路是很不错的。去掉了前几作多余的一些系统。
连段系统、迷宫和新大地图能看出来制作者还是花了点心思的，黑暗女神战也有一些新意。那么是什么导致本作游戏性烂成一坨呢？
回合制rpg本身就是互动性很差的游戏类型，想要把这种游戏做的有趣就需要花更多的心思去设计关卡，包括己方角色的能力配合，敌人的特殊破解方式，己方装备属性与敌方等级契合。
这几方面本作都差的一塌糊涂，想提高难度就无脑增加敌方属性，破甲系统绝大多数情况下毫无意义。虽然角色有很多技能，但绝大多数的技能只是面板伤害和攻击范围有所不同。游戏后期的难度已经控制不住，角色的实力远超剧情强度。最后一战轻松打完，毫无成就感。
想要达成上述的一切真的很困难么?
许多个人制作的作品都能够做到，一个正经的游戏公司为什么做不到？
只能说明地雷社压根就没有用心去做rpg部分，差评。
ADV部分
立绘和cg更加精致了，加入了非常贴心的自动播放。
剧情仍是一贯的相声，不过有些群像化，nep的戏份被削弱了很多。
强烈要求下部增加主角的戏份。那么想增加其他角色的戏份麻烦单独开个作品好么！【shut up and take my money！
贵圈越来越乱，紫黑cp边缘化。【我有一句妈卖批一定要讲

可能是找到了定位，搞笑部分越来越多，主线则越来越随意。逻辑硬伤多的说不过来。

虽然问题堆积成山，根本吐槽不过来。

但是！

10/10 nep女神这是我这次的信仰请您收好。

author: {'steamid': '76561198096999713', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1840, 'last_played': 1515548128}
review:
Are you a fan of the neptunia franchise?
Buy this game. Don't give it a second thought. Probably the soundtrack too.

Don't know much about the series, but think it looks interesting?
I'll tell you my experience and try to help you make up your mind. (I assume since you're here the anime aesthetic doesn't bother you.)

I bought this game around the time it came out on steam for a similar price to what it is at now, during the winter sale, selling much of my DotA/CS:GO inventory to make the purchase. I had played about half (I think) of the first game, watched about half of the anime series, and bought the second game but never played it. My reason for not finishing the first game was that it was too grindy. I didn't really know what I was getting into. The characters were fun, but the gameplay was repetitive, and a lot of the mechanics weren't clearly explained (elemental damage). The only thing that matters from that prior experience is the familiarity with the characters, and even then this game does a decent job of re-introducing everyone, although there will be a few jokes or references to things that I and you may not get. That doesn't really detract from the experience.
What this game did was improve greatly on the actual battles (in my opinion) and made it so that much less grinding was required to beat the bosses. If you just naturally fought any enemies that you met, you would almost always be sufficiently leveled for the big encounters. The combo mechanic for your attacks makes your choice for moves and weapons more interesting and intuitive. The story is very engaging, and you get to spend some quality time with all of the major characters. The normal end was very good, and the story built up to it very well. The "true end" achieved by doing a couple of specific things earlier in the story, which you'll probably have to look up to do properly, is an amazing conclusion. Once you beat the story, there is a seemingly unlimited amount of gameplay to be had completing quests and doing battles.

I think this game would make a good introduction to the neptunia franchise, and highly reccomend it at its winter sale price, I wouldn't have minded paying full price for it originally if I knew what I was getting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082827739', 'num_games_owned': 198, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2658, 'last_played': 1501220774}
review:
Antes que nada, este juego no es un remake como los rebirth. Es un port del juego que salió para la ps4 sin ningún cambio alguno.

He jugado los neptunia desde el rebirth 1. Y debo decir que este juego se enfoca más en la historia (hay muy poco fanservice y chistes) a comparación con los rebirths. Sin embargo, es el mejor neptunia en cuanto a banda sonora, gráficos y gameplay.

A continuación, dire las pros y las contras de este juego:

Pros
+Buena banda sonora, gráficos y gameplay.
+La historia engancha.
+Los nuevos personajes basados en compañias como square enix, konami,  ect... son un amor.
+Las transformaciones nuevas de neptune, noire, vert y blanc están geniales.
+Muy buen port(Aunque yo no tuve ningún problema con el port, mucha gente se ha estado quejando del port)
+Cualquier control que conectes, el juego lo reconoce.

Contras
-Algunos jefes son demásiados fáciles.
-Comparados con los rebirth, no hay mucho fanservice.

Bueno en fin, si eres fan de la saga, este juego no puede faltar en tu librería.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073257767', 'num_games_owned': 453, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 2408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2362, 'last_played': 1481787715}
review:
[h1]ถ้าคุณไม่เคยเล่น Neptunia Series คุณก็จะไม่ชอบมันเลย[/h1]

ในฐานะที่ผมเป็นแฟนๆเกม Neptunia Series เล่นมาหลายๆภาค พอที่จะบอกได้ว่าภาคนี้ยังไงก็สุดยอดที่สุดในซีรี่ย์ คือถ้าชอบภาคอื่นๆก็ซื้อมาเล่นเถอะ แต่ถ้าให้ผมรีวิวตามฉบับแบบคนไม่เคยเล่น Neptunia มาก่อน พอจะบอกได้ว่า...

[u]มันไม่ใช่เกม ใครจะซื้อมาเล่นก็ระวังจะผิดหวังกันหน่อย[/u] 

ถึงมันจะผสม RPG หรือ JRPG เป็นแนวเสริม (JRPG หรือ Japan RPG คือเหมือนๆกับพวก Final Fantasy ที่ผลัดเทิร์นตีมอนสเตอร์) แต่แนวเกมหลักก็คือ [u]Visual Novel[/u] (มันก็แปลตรงๆว่าการจำลองบทนิยาย) เกมที่คุณจะไม่สามารถเล่นจนรู้สึกว่าเป็นเกม คือเป็นเกมที่คุณเล่นแล้วเหมือนมีคนคอยอ่านนิยายให้ฟัง จะมีภาพตัวละครประกอบซึ่งไม่ได้ขยับท่าทางอะไรมากมาย (ภาพกึ่งสมจริง 2D) ทำให้ตอนเล่นต้องมีทักษะการฟังจากผู้พากย์ อ่าน และทำความเข้าใจเนื้อเรื่องเหมือนอ่านนิยายจริงๆ

[u]ดังนั้นจะซื้อมาเพื่อเสพสุขกับตัวละครบนโลกการ์ตูนหรืออนิเมะ ทั้งงานพากย์ญี่ปุ่น ตัวละครที่แสนจะโมเอะ ภาพสองมิติสวยๆ กกน.ที่สามารถมุดกล้องมองได้ ก็เกมนี้แหละ[/u] (คิโม่ย!)

คือจะให้บ่นตัวเกมก็อยากบ่น เพราะมันเป็น[u]เกม JRPG ที่โคตรจะกาก[/u] และไม่มีความเป็น Tactical ของ RPG เลยเว้ยเฮ้ย ปกติเราควรบัพหรือหายาเจ๋งๆ หรือแต่ละเทิร์นต้องคิดวางแผนเยอะๆ [u]เกมนี่มันแค่กดตีๆหรือสกิลก็ตายห่าหมดแล้ว[/u] ผมเลยเรียกว่า [u]เกมที่ไม่ใช่เกม[/u] เพราะมันง่ายดายเกินไปและน่าเบื่อในบางช่วงเช่นกัน ทำให้ผมเล่นไม่ได้ต่อเนื่องเพราะ Gameplay ที่ต้องไปฟาร์มก่อนมาสู้บอสพลังสุดโหดนั้นแล แต่ถ้าเล่นภาค Rebirth 1 อาจจะไม่เบื่อเพราะได้ลองของใหม่ มีเควสมีไอเท็มเหมือนกัน [u]ถึงพวกไอเท็มที่ต้องคราฟเองมันจะไม่ช่วยอะไรในเกมมากเลยก็ตาม[/u] (คือเพิ่งมารู้ตอนหลัง จนผมเล่นจบภาคนี้โดยแทบไม่คราฟอะไรเลย) ก็คือผมเล่นมา 4 ภาคมันเหมือนกันทุกภาคเลยเบื่อเป็นธรรมดา

แต่ผมก็ยังชอบภาคนี้อยู่ดี เพราะงานพากย์ เสียงเพลงประกอบ เนื้อเรื่อง และหลายๆปัจจัยที่คนติดอนิเมะหรือนิยาย จะต้องชอบเป็นธรรมดา แต่ตัวเกมนี้คือผมรับกับการพัฒนาแต่ละภาคไม่ได้จริงๆ ถึงตัวเกมจะใช้คำนิยามว่า Nep Next-Gen จริงๆมันคือการแปลงร่างแบบใหม่ กับตัว Gameplay ที่เพิ่มเติมนิดๆหน่อยๆเท่านั้นเอง

author: {'steamid': '76561198073088368', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 3086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3086, 'last_played': 1481495471}
review:
I just finished this game a few minutes ago (pushing over 40 hours of gameplay) and here is what I think of this game

Pros
- Like the other games in the series, this game has an awesome storyline that makes you keep playing to find out what is going to happen next
- The Dark CPU fights
- There are some grinding parts, but once you get access to the Colosseum you have your leveling spot to level up your party members

Cons: 
- One of the issues that I had with this game is with the Rank Quests, to rank up you have to find a particular monster or dungeon in the area and you have to send your scouts out. Sometimes you can get the area or monster to show up in 30 minutes and sometimes it takes 3 days just for the monster or area to show up

Even though that's the only Con that I have for this game, I HIGHLY recommend this game to anyone who wants to play a good, solid RPG. I also did get the Ascension ending and after a while I'll try to pick this game up once again to see if I can get the True ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058841791', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1515251100}
review:
Potential bypass for crashes:

As it is tradition for me, I pretty much bought this game on release, as I really enjoy the series. However, I kept crashing with a familiar 'Sorry: Application has crashed.'

I waited for a possible patch to fix the crash issues, but it never came. Now, in December, I finally decided to start playing again, regardless. I fell victim to the crashes, losing a bit of progress, forcing me to spend less time enjoying and grinding dungeons, but more time trying to find a save point before I crashed again.

This review isn't so much on the game (which is really good, by the way. Best in the series.), but an awareness post for people looking to enjoy some Nep-Nep, but can't get past the crashing.

Like many others probably have (or not.), I've found a 'bypass' for the 'Sorry: Application has crashed' problem.

DO NOT click okay on the message.
Click back onto the main game tab, and you can continue playing as normal. The game will 'crash' and show the message again, but just repeat and click back into the game.

Hope this helps for those who are paranoid about crashes, and can't properly enjoy some quality time with Neptune and the gang.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031788789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1481883617}
review:
This game has not been patched since shortly after release (~5 months at the time of this review) and still currently suffers from major stability isssues, frequent crashing, and other game-breaking issues:

- The game has frequent issues with many NVidia Geforce GTX-series cards, even ones far above the minimum/recommended specs, and will crash every 10-20 minutes due to memory leaks. This can even happen to some users with AMD cards, from reports on the forum.
- The game is horribly optimized and will also crash many integrated Intel GPUs that are otherwise more than capable of running the game, in particular one long dungeon very early in the game called Sakura Park.
- The game is lacking a Japanese-only balance patch that fixes glaring oversights regarding the game's combat system and scaling, namely with activated skills and EXE drives (aka. hypers) falling off into complete uselessness past the early game.
- There is frequent stuttering and delay within the menus that can lead to crashes, especially with one of the graphics cards mentioned above. One of the July patches that IFI released helped the problem and made the stuttering far less noticeable, but it still happens.

However, the abandonment of this game by the devs is particularly concerning, as IFI has done this once in the past. A previous game in the series, Neptunia Re:Birth2, saw IFI completely drop support for it while the game suffered from constant crashes, rolled back several problematic attempted fixes, and then did nothing for the rest of the game's lifespan. It still has not been patched.

Overlooking the problems, Neptunia VII is a surprisingly good RPG with a long and indepth (if silly and whimsical) storyline, decent humor, and moderately challenging fights. I have been a fan of the series for years, but VII's abandonment by its developers in spite of its balance issues and lack of stability means I can't easily recommend this to anyone looking for a complete experience, especially not with this pricetag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005816494', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2354, 'last_played': 1584205693}
review:
19 hours in as of writing, but figured I'd put this out there. I'll update it if something changes?

--NEP REVIEW PART 2: ATTACK OF THE ROBO GE-GES--

Okay, so now I've cleared my first run of the game and can say a bit more. Even on a regular ending, the plot was quite enjoyable! I liked a lot of the jokes and references the game makes, some were unexpected.

The difficulty never ramped up, it actually got much easier, haha. If you use the scouting system strategically (AKA you put the experience booster wherever you are) you level up far above what's required through a little grinding. That said, I greatly appreciate the ability to fast forward/skip battle animations, with how easily my party of waifus obliterated foes battles would take literally a handful of seconds. Combine that with certain characters and their abilities and you're able to tank through dungeons with barely any problems as long as you pay attention.

Got to NG+ where you can literally bring everything over progress wise (including all your end game party members unlocked from the beginning!!) so I can unlock the true ending, and they hand you all sorts of bonuses to make your second run faster, I can already tell. Props that they make multi-runs accessible, now I can dig into the other systems of the game I basically ignored without having to trudge through the game again. Smart thinking!

Final-Final thoughts are it's not a particularly challenging RPG for those willing to bite down deep with its systems, but it is a particularly-outstandingly fun one. I did feel like my goddess-like (CPU humor!) power was the result of my own planning, so I was proud of my first run. Totes fun, ya'll. Oh, and it took me 34 hours to clear the game due to super-over-levelling at the end. (Hint: The colosseum is an amazing grind spot for EXP and money, I leveled 6 times in an hour)

--Original Review from 19 Hours in--

Nep's been my closet enjoyment for the last couple of years since deciding to try it from watching my friend get the first remake of Re;birth 1, and this is the one I can definitively say is what you want out of the series. I'll admit that when I played the first few in the Re;birth series I liked the concept of the world and its characters, but that the game flow (primarily being so attached to the guild quest structure) didn't feel very cohesive. Re;birth 3 started getting better, and now we've got this one on our hands. It's finally clicked!

Maybe it just took me multiple games, but now all the systems the game has in place makes sense. You'll get the hang of the attack combo system, investing in your nations, and grinding your way to (as of now!) powering a hole into those bosses. The writing is getting better with each entry too, and the VAs really give their perfomances a lot of heart for something like this (I'm a bit biased towards my lord waifu Nepgear, but ya know).

If you're someone like me, getting past the fan service hurdles can be some mental hopskotch, but there's nothing quite like mashing your way through that obligatory bath shot still screen to avoid family judgment while still trying to comprehend what's being said. Keeps you on your toes!

TL;DR the jokes are better, references are abound, and gameplay is totally up to snuff. Judgment by your friends and love ones can be healed with time and acceptance towards your strange, new hobby and you'll be all the better for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026846672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 3964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3964, 'last_played': 1504327724}
review:
This game got good reviews and good sales, so I thought I'd try it out.

It's a hilarious game which is basically Console Wars The Anime The Game.

Let's start with the cons:
-No sexy dudes
-Fanservice is a bit much
-No option to remove boob jiggle
-Felt too easy for the first few hours

Pros:
-Animations are really good
-Combos/coupling/combat is well thought out and very complex
-Cool armor skins that make me feel fabul--- I mean powerful...
-scout system that allows you to discover new dungeons/items/enemies etc.
-No option to remove boob jiggle
-Story is actually pretty good
-Characters are fun and varied in personalities
-English voice acting doesn't make me want to kill myself

review:
I have most of the NEP-NEP games and started feeling like the games were getting bit recycled(still fun). However, I started playing this game and it seems to have the best story so far out of the series. The music is amazing. They redid the system a bit. It is now a combination of Agarest Generations of War Mixed with Fairy Fencer F and Neptunia. The game is a little more serious this time around. Must buy if a Neptunia fan. New Monsters

*Great game for JRPG fans. I started playing Rebirth 1 just to try out and i ended buying Rebirth 1-3 and this one. So far this Nep game is my favorite.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132724918', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1531024487}
review:
I give positive review for this Megadimenison Neptunia VII because i love the story and also the new transformation of the CPUs. Also this game has some weapons and characters DLCs so those made the game story more interesting. Unfortunately, there are some disappointment points that make me a little... or maybe so disappointed to this game. So i do recommend this game if you love series of Neptunia game (just ike me （>∀<）) and i do recommend the other Neptunia series, like Hyperdimension Neptunia re;birth 1, if you just wanna try Neptunia game (・ω<).
The disappointment points that make me disappointed to this game are:
1. The main menu interface. In my opinion, the main menu in this game isn't as good as the main menu in other Neptunia series. The other series have more friendly, elegant, and more enticing interface main menu.
2. The animation. Hard to describe about this one. But this point is the most disappointing one that make me disappointed.
3. The backsong. i feel that the backsong in this game is not as pretty and enticing as backsong in the other neptunia series. Especially the victory backsong.
4. Last point, Neptune's voice. Her voice is not cute as usual (つД⊂) especially when she says "Kangarū no yō ni" and when shout for joy

Well, this game is recommended to complete your Neptunia game series and isn't match for you if you just wanna try Neptunia game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082583457', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4364, 'last_played': 1593171477}
review:
I think Megadimension Neptunia V-II marks something of a watershed moment for the Neptunia series in that it's no longer "good, but...[insert caveat of your choice here]", it's just plain good. Actually, great, even.
Finishing my first playthrough of the game took me roughly 55 hours; that was taking it fairly leisurely, unlocking this and that that wasn't absolutely necessary for the first playthrough and goofing around now and then. After that, there's still the "true" ending, which leads to a post-game segments during which you can clean up any bits and pieces you didn't finish off first time around - Or trophy hunt. 
Well, at first, I want to say that I think this is Compile Heart's finest work to date. While there are some technical issues regarding frame drops in a few places, most of them are not really all that significant. Ignoring some typos, the script and translation are both excellent, the gameplay is enjoyable, smooth and well-balanced. The first and last points there adress two of the biggest criticism the Neptunia series has had ever since its release - technical issues regarding atrocious framerates that weren't really justifiable for the kind of game they were, and balancing issues regarding inconsistent or just way too easy difficulty. MegaNep counters both of these problems: It runs at pretty consistent 60fps pretty much all of the time, only dropping in particularly busy scenes, and has a very well-paced progression with no point in the game that felt too easy or too difficult. The revamped game systems work extremly well: Skills feel neither under- nor overpowered, characters feel unique and pretty much any party combination can work perfectly fine.
Now, narrative and characterisation has never been an issue for the Neptunia series, but, pleasingly, MegaNep even improves this, making up a story that is spectaclar, dramatic and even emotional at some points in the end. Additionally, it keeps the humorful atmosphere, with Neptune being the goofy, likeable, forth-wall-breaking protagonist that we all know and love. 
In other words, it's not just a great Neptunia game - It's a great RPG, period. The only thing that saddens me is the fact that so many people will write it off without even giving it a shot for themselves; still, I guess that makes it all the more special for those of us in the know who can enjoy and appreciate it, both on its own merits and as, to date, the absolute pinnacle of the series.

游戏系统大幅度进化,游戏画面的质感也得到了极大飞跃
[spoiler] (狗改不了吃屎)[/spoiler]

临近毁灭的游戏业界,那样的话,就让"梦想"打破这该死的局面

author: {'steamid': '76561198087263447', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9836, 'last_played': 1499525260}
review:
I have played the previous games (by that I mean all the Re;Birth ones) before this one and I must say, it is my favourite of all!

It got better graphic's, new mechanics, great music ( especially the Boss Fight Music) aaand more waifu's.
Also the plot was even great! Not that the plot of the other games were bad. I enjoyed them. But the plot of this game was just great, in my opinion.

My only problem is this god-forsaken [spoiler]Spelunker Zero [/spoiler]. This is true hell.

Besides this it was a lot of fun. I really recommend playing all the other games before this. But I think this is clear.

I would rate this game a 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198076567866', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 3430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3292, 'last_played': 1499535274}
review:
1v1

YOU AND ME FOOL

OORAORAORAORAORAORAORAORAORAORAORAORAORAORAORAORAORA

OOOORA!

True review because I know completed the game

This nep is the best of the series, IF and compile heart finaly found their way to make great nep games, graphicaly and game mecanicaly
Nep/10, nep not only broke the 4th wall but she also broke dimension walls.

Pros:
-Nep
-the OST is just AWESOME, I love them, everyone of them, none are mediocre or bad.
-Graphics are great
-you feel the pudding flowing inside you everytime you play this game

Cons:
-Bad PC port, loading times and event skips are extremely slow compared to PS4. (about 50% slower)
-MAZES ON THE LAST LEVELS OF THE GAME, REALLY?
-RNG on some bossfights, its either you get full wiped first turn or you can keep playing.
-Insulting normal ending. completly the worst normal ending I have ever seen in the series.
-2nd worst bad ending in the series. you obviously know who's the first. (pro tip: MK2 conquest ending ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) )

author: {'steamid': '76561198027696917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10866, 'last_played': 1591813905}
review:
Very fun game if you don't mind/enjoy fanservice and 4th wall nepping (breaking was not strong enough).

I originally picked this game because I wanted to play a JRPG that didn't take itslef too seriously, and I can say that I have been both satisfied and pleasantly surprised.

As for the price tag, I go for the common rule of 1h/€ (or similar currency). So considering I have 100+ hours on the game, I say it is well worth its price.

I recommend having some knowledge of the gaming industry's history as well as its major companies (both platform manufacturers and game develloppers) and/or be ready to do some research in order to fully enjoy this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145288322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1545101516}
review:
(Note I have only played the neptunia series available on steam) Victory2 10/10 amazing game.  Skip the 2nd paragraph for new players and 3rd for those that have played neptunia's review. 
Btw for anyone that reads this don't listen to reviews(in general )that says anything along the lines of if you don't like anime, fps or rpgs then that the specific game is bad, because it's really not; if you don't a specific genre, it doesn't mean the game is bad, it just means whoever made that review just don't like the genre. ( sorry about that, it's just I read review for a different game that said that it was "bad" because of its game genre; now on to the review )

New players, I going to say this the eng dub and sub might put off the character's line in a different a light sometimes; so I personally use the Japanese dub; but if you really perfer the English dub I won't stop just know that the English dub, can make some lines come out weirder sometimes . And also that some jokes gets lost in the translation, so if it came out weird in English; the joke is either lost in translation , or that it was just not your cup of tea. Also here are fan services, but you watched anime before, just know it's not as bad as DxD, or to love ru; and that it could be a lot worse. If you are not an anime fan, and have only played jrpg like ff, or the tales series, there will be a bit more fan service compared to these two titles; but look at it with an open mind, and that it's no where as bad as hunniepop. The combat gameplay for V2 will be different to some lvl compared to those previously mentioned titles; but nonetheless a very good game. Just that as a new player to the neptunia franchise, story is topically a lot more interesting then what it seems.  Also this game is somewhat new player friendly, just note that it spoils some of the previous main titles, but you don't need to play the previous titles to understand, but it will help if do play the previous titles.  

Ok, if you are a neptunia fan, then you probably know this that victory 2 might be one of the greatest neptunia games yep. And that if you like nep, gear and the other CPU's that they are all back and more amazing. Now back to the review, v2 has changed a lot of things when compared to the previous, however this made it a bit more interesting, since this game might be the only one I had to take some time to plan on a boss fight fairly early in the game ( might be, because I rushed a little...) nonetheless, it is awesome.  The new world map, combat system, and the new combo/equipment system most of all was interesting. Since the weapons now, needs the player to be more aware of the combo system, since the type of weapons has a different set of combo slots available. There's other different  changes, but I'm lazy. Victory 2 however is has more of a interesting story compared to previous neptunia games( since in V you would know somethings if you watched the anime, and played the previous games).  In V2 the event scenes are a bit long, but it also allowed the for new players to get an idea of each character, and old players to get a better grip of the storyline.(let's say it's shows more depth, if you understand it) for any new players or old that read this for just Remember to go in to this game with an open mind, and use the Japanese dub, it's a lot better for the neptunia series in my opinion. 

For the time I played it, great game and will continue to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020987713', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7895, 'last_played': 1592605163}
review:
This game from the hyperdimension neptunia series may by my favorite.
gameplaywise and story are pretty great.
Controls are simple and easy as always and most element from the other games can be found back. of course there are changes, for example the combo's. no longer spamming the same attack and what your previous attacks are determine the effectiveness of the next attack. you really have to think to find a good combo. The formation attacks are also a welcoming change. posistioning on the battlefield is now even more important.

there are some bummers. like the HUUUUGE grind at the end of the game. its boring as hell and i won't complete it. also the neplunker bunkers are a bit anoying. but i can see other players having fun in them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047123777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4248, 'last_played': 1486048028}
review:
TLDR: The best game of all Neptunia games 9/10 cause CPU chips achievement


This is my first actual review so bear with me.

About me: I have played Neptunia Re:Birth Trilogy on a Vita and just almost 100% this game except for 2 achievements at the time of writing this review. And I love jrpgs so the score might be biased

-Might accidentally contain spoilers. Sorry-

Graphics: 9/10
This game uses a different engine compared the Re:Birth series (correct me if I'm wrong) and the visuals are colorful. The CGs are always good and some are fanservices as usual in Neptunia games. The areas are mostly new, though some of the old map themes are still used (the digital dungeon, virtua forest, and outside area. This isnt their official names btw).

Gameplay: 10/10
There are new features in this game like the revamped combo system, route, and the development system has been changed. It gives this games a fresh feel that wont make you say, "This is just another Neptunia Re:Birth Remake with a different story and some added characters. Gameplay still same so boring zzz". There is also a minigame called Neplunker, based on the game spelunker, that is honestly frustrating when you never played spelunker before playing this (like me) but eventually you will get used to it (still frustrating to die jumping so high tho). Grinding in this game is WAYYYYY EASIER compared to the previous games. or maybe its beacause i forgot to turn on the level cap dlc. but hey you dont really need lvl 999 in completing the achievements. Also there is a new form called Next form. EDIT: there is a lvl 999 cap and colo battles and grinding up to that level is a challenge since the biggest xp monster only spawns once and the you can only use 30 of an item that force spawns it per run.

Sound: 9/10
The music of the story part is mostly still the same from the old Nep games but the new maps and boss themes are new. The opening soundtracks of the three series is my favorite. (fun fact: I actually heard musou katharsis before playing this game and I immediately liked it). And the monsters here have sounds when its their turn. wow.

Story:7/10
Story has never been the selling point of Neptunia games (I think). But this tries to amaze the player with the new character's coolness. The fourth wall breaker and comedy is here. My favorite thing about this is how they put the gaming puns and I just laugh when I get it. (S-sha's lines are my favorite).

End Game Content: 8/10
I guess the post game content for this is unlocking the endings, the colosseum, , , uh I guess that's it. you will probably spend most of your time finish that rng based achievement (*cough* CPU CHIPS *cough*) and with a painful hand. EDIT: There is a lvl 999 colo battles and that grind is hard. For those new to the series, there is a new game plus so dont worry if you missed something you can just try again. warning though: you scouted areas and hidden treasures will be reset.

Conclusion: 9/10
yeah maybe this score is biased but if this is your first neptunia game, you may have a hard time playing the older ones, as this I said, this is the best nep game there is currently. Post game maybe a little lacking but completing the achievements sure gives you a lot of hours to play this game. It brings new features that give it a new feel rather than a "same game, just a different story" kind of feel.

Well hope this helped. Enjoy Nepping. I'm off to prepare to get those 2 SR cards I haven't obatained yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056264254', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 172, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1530399402}
review: i have played this game for less than two hours and i can immediately tell you based off that and my 20 hours of re;birth1 that if you have any interest at all in this series, buy this game and no others. this game is actually pretty good, and has funny dialog, and has combat that takes less than three minutes. if you like it then you can decide if you wanna play any of the others, but this is probably the best one to start with if you just want a fun jrpg

author: {'steamid': '76561198041355619', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3828, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2810, 'last_played': 1608414103}
review: For long-time players of the Neptunia franchise, Megadimension Neptunia VII is a clear step in the right direction in terms of gameplay and storytelling. It also manages to strike a beautiful balance between relentless comedy routines and tearjerkers, something the Neptunia series has struggled to do until now. Framerates are mostly stable even on my integrated graphics card, but the bloom looks atrocious in certain dungeons. Overall I would certainly reccomend it, but you'll get more out of it if you have some prior experience with JRPGs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284809202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 6800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6200, 'last_played': 1575346669}
review:
ich bin ja ein fan von final fantasy titeln mit ff9 und ff7 bin ich schon früh auf j-rpg gestoßen. hab auch zu playstation 2 zeiten vorzugsweise spiele im anime stil gespielt :3 aber die hyperdimension Neptunia Reihe ist echtes Neuland für mich, diese Spiele sind ganz auf fanservice und comedy ausgelegt. Voller weiblicher charaktäre, viele lustige dialoge und komplett synchronisiert, man kommt sich so vor als würde man eins dieser unanständigen animes sehen xD 

Megadimension Neptunia VII ist das neuste und größte RPG der Reihe hat auch imao die schönste grafik. Storymäßig hängen die Titel nicht wirklich zusammen aber ich würde alle titel empfehlen alleine wegen dem witz am liebenswerten neptunia universum

author: {'steamid': '76561198108805063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7813, 'last_played': 1527077286}
review:
9/10(วิจารณ์โดยใช้หลักเหตุและผล)
15/10(วิจารณ์โดยใช้ความชอบของตัวเอง)
เอาตรงๆว่าเกมนี้ก็ม่มีอะไรดีมากแต่ภาคนี้ชอบเนื้อเรื่องของอุซุเมะมากอีกทั้งเพลงเปิดก็เข้าหูจนเปิดฟังซํ้าไม่รู้กี่รอบ ตัวละครก็ Design มาได้ค่อนข้างดีแถมยังมี Ending ทั้ง 3 แบบให้เลือกเล่นแต่เนื้อเรื่องของ Bad Ending ดูตัดจบไปก็เลยหักไป 0.3 ไอเทมบางชิ้นก็โคตรแพงและยังเจอมอนเป็นว่าเล่นเลยหักไป 0.5 ระบบบางอย่างก็ดูซํ้าซากไปเลยหัก 0.1 แมพก็ดูงงงง(น่าจะงงแค่คนเดียว)เลยหักไปอีก 0.1 ส่วนอีกคะแนนวิจารณ์นึงเป็นเพราะว่าตัวเองก็ชอบเกมนี้อยู่เลยจึงอวยเป็นพิเศษ

author: {'steamid': '76561198155116579', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2113, 'last_played': 1510996437}
review:
黑五特价入了游戏，增加了许多特效，自然配置会增加，关了一些特效稳定在30多帧左右（I5 4210M+GT940m）

游戏系统和重生炒冷饭系列不一样，增加了迷宫预览，这个很像妖剑F一样，然后把重生系列的史黛拉迷宫改成了见闻者系统，这个很像重生2的史黛拉迷宫再加上妖剑F的插剑buff，不同的是，一个见闻者只能在一个迷宫，不像妖剑F多把剑插在迷宫里，多个buff生效
HDD变身系统，这个在nep许多作品都能见到过，但是发动变身要把exe槽填满一个才能发动，不像重生系列消耗指定的mp发动变身，而且这次变身还多出了个过场动画（x
连招系统，这个系统和以往都不太相同，一开始解锁了5次连招，但是不同的武器连招也不一样

author: {'steamid': '76561198102735083', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1486181751}
review:
发个汉化吧
http://steamcn.com/forum.php?mod=viewthread&tid=225208&highlight=%BA%A3%CD%F5%D0%C7
本汉化为Steam版 Megadimension Neptunia VII 用外挂式 中文化Mod。
可正常解锁成就，与原始英文版存档正常互相兼容。
本Mod所有内容基于SCET的繁体中文版（《新次元遊戲 戰機少女 VII》）。并作出了部分修正，详见以下：

 已处理部分
　游戏本篇内所有数据内容。
　所有主线支线剧情文本。
　修正了繁体中文版本身的部分文本错误。
　修改了繁体中文版大部分人名译名与地名译名。
　DLC人物剧情文本、竞技场、怪物、物品名称等。　　※DLC包
　大部分界面图片内容，游戏开篇前的ＣＧ等。　　　　※图片界面包
　4个OP与4个ED替换。　　　　　　　　　　　　　　※替换视频包
　
未基于 繁体中文版 （※保留英文或基于日文版翻译）的部分
　DLC人物：海男。
　DLC竞技场敌方怪物所释放技能名称。
　DLC装备物品等名称及其说明。
　DLC见闻者探索完成报告。
　部分据点菜单首图片。
　部分人物技能释放效果。
　“史莱犬看起来好像”支线事件。
　所有教程图片。
　以及其他若干细小疏漏。
评论区提醒，新地址网站域名更换，新地址 https://keylol.com/forum.php?mod=viewthread&tid=225208

author: {'steamid': '76561198015229979', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 6421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4733, 'last_played': 1619396050}
review:
The 4thgame in the Neptunia series !! a Port of the Ps4 version
Has alot of improvements and tons of replayability content .

The world map is alot bigger and more interactive with routes between locations.

extremely more sidequests to be done postgame .|

New unique and fun characters. 

This game is seperated in 3 Big major chapters which the game even makes fun of each could of been its own big game .

Each chapter adds a new twist to plot and some mechanics.

The neptunia series is a great JRPG series where each character are references to the game industry . 

Great humour and addicting gameplay 

Would highly recommend to play previous neptunia games before playing this for the full experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130529481', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7819, 'last_played': 1593292395}
review:
Haaa ce jeux, comme tout les autres jeux de la série j'y ai passer des centaines d'heures ! Cette episode est sans doute mon préféré pour le moment , on retrouve l'humour NEPesque des 3 précédents mais cette fois avec de nette amélioration du côté de l'ecriture du scénario. 

On retrouve aussi plein de nouveau personnage et les graphismes next-gen nous permettent d'encore plus apprécier ceux que nous retrouvont. 

Du coté des succès c'est la encore un véritable plaisir a monter a 100%, certe c'est long mais la difficulté est bien jaugée et meme si ont peut passer plusieurs heures sur un succes on ne reste pas "coincé" et c'est au final vraiment classe de pouvoir afficher sur son profil le succes final :) 

Bref je nomine ce jeu pour la catégorie "Pas de remords" car il le mérite largement !

author: {'steamid': '76561198054521718', 'num_games_owned': 973, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 9894, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 160, 'playtime_at_review': 7158, 'last_played': 1711636737}
review:
First off, I must say I was impressed on the speed, and the quality, of the port from PS4 to PC. Megadimension Neptunia VII released in Japan last summer (2015), and international PS4 release was on the first quarter of 2016. The PC version was released in Q3 2016. Unlike some unluckier ones, I had zero problems with the game from the beginning. And boy, was I impressed how much the series has grown. While the cast has been reduced quite a bit, the new additions of Uzume Tennouboshi / Orange Heart and the four Gold Third are a welcome addition. The game runs super smooth, even with my medium-specced rig (AMD FX-4100, GeForce GTX 960 4GB, 8GB DDR3) and it looks very nice (as would be expected from PS3 / PSVita to PS4 change). The soundtrack from the deluxe pack is also a welcome addition (these deluxe packs have been released for other games too, since then) but it does not contain every song found in the game (figures, as some songs are reused from earlier games).

The story is divided into three arcs, almost episodic like an television series. The premise is nothing you haven't already seen in these games; end up in a weird place, befriend some new people by fighting them and then save the world while searching for a way back home. It's cliché, but it works in games like this.

Around midway through the story the CPUs gain a massive power upgrade (Next Form). It trivializes some of the content afterwards. Overall, the difficulty seems to lean towards easy for most of the game, save for a few fights that might throw you off until you learn to prepare for them.

Overall, the game is a wonderful addition to the Neptunia series. The music is superb, animations smooth, game mechanics refined and the story, while not deep, manages to keep you interested on what is happening next.

Pros and Cons list:
+Beautiful graphics compared to other titles in the series
+Beautiful music
+Next Form, accompanied with full transformation videos and over-the-top attacks. And the music. ABSOLUTEly the best track in the game :)
+Uzume and the Gold Third
+Umio!!
+Same good Neptunia you all love. More of it and refined to the max.
+Neplurker (Depending on your gaming skills and patience, might become a negative point)

-Scout system
-Hidden Treasures
-Lack of many characters from the earlier series such as Falcon, 5pb. and MAGES.

Overall a very solid game, and a good entry point to the series if you haven't played them before. Just beware that the earlier games aren't as pretty and refined as this.

9.5 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198279899222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6082, 'last_played': 1582334167}
review:
两周目完美结局后，为了能够全成就。把其他成就全做完后，只剩下一个卡牌成就，这看脸看人品的成就是我完成的海王星系列成就里最难的一个了。不算前面推剧情时抽卡的时间，光两周目后其他所有成就完成只剩抽卡成就时的时间，用S/L大法花了四个小时才把所有不同的卡片凑齐，共33张卡片，SR4张、R 12张，N 17张。用S/L法抽了近7200次才完美达成。
      以后的新作，可不要再出这种看脸的成就了啊，我还是更愿意做全人物好感成就。我们黑脸族好怕看脸看人品的东西。
      好期待四女神online上steam啊，都快等不及了~

author: {'steamid': '76561198283578802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1482083703}
review:
地雷社新作，NEP的新冒险之旅！

别人安利我这个游戏的时候，

一开始我是拒绝的。

因为，你不能让我打个好评，我就马上去给地雷社打个五星好评对不对？

第一我要玩一下，因为我不愿意打完好评以后再去强颜欢笑说这个游戏不好，游戏体验很差，还经常闪退，正版也会闪退？！

这样评论区的看官出来一定会骂我，根本没有这样的游戏，就证明上面那个是我吹的。

后来我也经过证实这个游戏真的很不错，很耐玩，战斗系统特效满天飞！

我断断续续玩了大概一个月左右，感觉还不错，后来别人让我写评测的时候不要跟风说这个游戏是怎么怎么骗钱的，我同意了。

因为我要让还在犹豫不决要不要入这个游戏的玩家看到，我玩完之后是这个样子，你们玩完之后也会是这个样子！





[spoiler]日呆萌豚大作，强！无敌！不买不是二次元！！[/spoiler]

review:
作为nep的信徒，跟着她们冒险就是一种荣幸，游戏业界多险峻，来世还生紫耀都。

然而和nep的日常永远都会有人打扰，
这次还是有那个喜欢搞事的欧巴桑。
来到了一个处于末日的次元。
然而nep依旧充满希望，
当然还遇到了一位脑洞奇大的女汉子。
一段奇妙的冒险
穿梭于几个奇妙的世界
之后
一切还是日常
每个女神又收了个后宫
我还是侍奉着女神
即希望无事
又希望能和她们再次冒险

author: {'steamid': '76561198041307797', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3703, 'last_played': 1470193272}
review: Having played all of the Neptunia Re;Birth games and VII, I can honestly say that VII is my favorite out of the lot. It provides a lot of fun characters and a great story that could only be done right with Nep and the rest of the CPUs and CPU candidates. The game provides a reasonable challenge without getting too difficult, although some of the boss battles late in the game do go a little overboard. This game is also not a good starting point if you're looking to get into the Hyperdimension Neptunia series, that belongs to Re;Birth 1 which can be purchased for pretty cheap nowadays. Nonetheless, the pros far outweight the cons of the game and I have had a tremendous experience!

review: There's a lot of game references as usual in any Neptunia game. Probably why I love this game is because my waifu Noire/Black Heart and the fact that [spoiler] S-Sha has "Cloud's Omnislash Ver. 5" well it's called "Omnislice Ver. S" since I grew up playing Final Fantasy 7 [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197962970136', 'num_games_owned': 361, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2578, 'last_played': 1535358415}
review:
This review assumes you know the basics of this game: JRPG, turn-based with movements, a lot of dialogues, grinding, a heavy load of female characters, video game industry references, minor fanservice, and such.

To serie newcomers:
The game does give some background info on important characters so you don't feel lost too much.

To long term fans:
IF scored a lot of points with this one. The addition of "the Sha gang", as I call them, made the references to the video game industry even stronger by adding major companies.

[spoiler]B-Sha: Bandai Namco
K-Sha: Konami
C-Sha: Capcom
S-Sha/E-Sha: Square Enix[/spoiler]

The game was split into 3 different arcs, or sub-stories, each with different leading characters. In the end, it all makes sense (somehow...). You can make use of 'scouts' (minor reference characters) to boost/lower stats/exp/money for stages. They can also find money or items for you (good piece of change compared to Stella's Dungeon). The overall map has routes which you need to build in order to move from one area to the other, adding random mob encounters on the way. You can invest money in industry/commerce/public relations to unlock new things in every major city/town.

1080p graphics to better enjoy Nep trolls and clearer Uni panty shots.
Features the original cast of 4 godesses, the 4 Candidates and IF and Compa, with the addition of the 4 members of Gold Third and Uzume. Add in 5 DLC characters (Umio, Nepugya, Million Arthur, God Eater, Notroplus) and you've got a cast of 20 characters (let's hope I'm not forgetting anyone...)

Definately recommended to anyone who's a fan of JRPG or anyone who likes to see references to other games.
If you can't stand the boob jokes from time to time, just skip Vert's route and stick to Blanc's.
