author: {'steamid': '76561197981885367', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4497, 'last_played': 1479947631}
review:
If you love JRPG's and want something that makes you laugh, this game is for you. Without spoilering the story, I feel the new characters add a new depth for what the story actually is and was a breath of fresh air. As for the soundtrack, I feel it easily has the best soundtrack over all the other games.

Now for some negatives I have with this game:
-The game can have really bad grinding moments.
-You will have a bad time if you're a completionist.
-Platforming. Enough said.

Other than the small complains I have with this game, I have to say that this is one of the better if NOT the best Neptunia game I have played. I would highly suggest picking this up when you can.

P.S.: I only have the character, swimsuit, and nightware DLC's. I was not disappointed with these either.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198041223707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 4552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4412, 'last_played': 1480266628}
review:
Всё равно хотел писать обзор, но стим заставил это сделать чуть пораньше :)
Прежде всего в этой игре сразу 3 игры... Да да, вам не мерещится, три игры по цене одной, объединенные общей сюжетной линией. Вообще очень приятно смотреть за прогрессом нептунии. В лучшую сторону в этой части изменилось практически всё: графика, сюжет (да-да, его завезли наконец то), боевка, рисовка, диалоги, проработка персонажей и тд.
Из минусов отмечу некоторые собирательные ачивки (привет мастер карт! чтоб человек, который придумал эту ачивку, горел в аду), добавление платформенных элементов (не пошло на пользу, хочется сказать лишь: не умеешь, не берись), а также рандомные схватки во время передвижения по карте (это возвращение к механике жрпг прошлых лет и оно не пошло игре на пользу, просто затягивает время и раздражает). 
Итоговая оценка 9/10. Прогресс очевиден, он огромен, но есть куда ещё стремиться.

review:
Plot and gameplay are nice, but optimization is 2 blocks down.
every new nep game brings some new features and deletes one old, u can call that "Modernization". 
Everytime plot is longer and more interesting, new dimenshion, new girls and even a fish. 
This time we get very large plot which was divided in parts not to be confused. 
A plot about a girl who always tried to do all by herself to protect everyone, finds some new friends to protect with and becomes happy of having them. 
9\10 for game plot/gameplay 
Game's settings don't even work properly (like always, pretty shitty port). Seems they don't fix any bug from the very beginning. 
4\10, because they've added AA\Shadow settings and etc, but render still doesn't work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292245609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 7844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7261, 'last_played': 1507114070}
review:
VIIR发售快两个月后终于白金了这款游戏[spoiler]虽然距离到手才一个月不到[/spoiler]，很惭愧，连微小的贡献都算不上。

    [h1]首先，写在开头的是[/h1]我谨代表广大死肥宅警告地雷社不要自取灭亡，好了ノワールちゃん的伤疤就忘了疼，见得风是的雨地把ユニちゃん和某机器死宅硬点一番，胡搞毛搞出什么暧昧，作为一个有虚拟恋爱经验这么多年的宅男，我可谓是身经百战见得多了，但像这样被撞见看本子批判了一番就打蛇随棍上的剧情呢，它实在是无中生有的东西，再者说，虽然我[spoiler]们大[/spoiler]家的ユニちゃん是你社女儿，但是我们玩家的撅♂腚权也是很重要的，ユニちゃん是[spoiler]我[/spoiler]谁的老婆，是要按照香港的基本法，按照选举的法去产生………………总之，地雷社你们啊，NAIVE!!!!
    然后，就算海男是条鱼，也不该被硬点和うずめちゃん搞暧昧，I am angry!!!!

    [h1]批判完了一番心理舒畅了很多，下面开始评测。[/h1]

    相比后续作世嘉少女的移植本作的优化并不尽如人意，直接导致我入库雪藏到换了新机才玩上，实测8GB 7700HQ 1050ti可以流畅运行，但低于这个配置的话我也没有发言权，大家自行斟酌吧。
    
    一个作品吼不吼，当然要看他自己的奋斗，但也要考虑历史的进程。从销量就可以看出，新次元是一部夹缝中的作品，但它是不是真的如其销量一般不尽人意呢？我觉得这是无中生有的。
    
    [h1]这部作品的自我奋斗呢[/h1]其实是相当不错的，众所周知小厂作品的质量（建模、地图等方面）难以与大厂抗衡，因此常常是只能在人设立绘音乐和剧情上下文章，平心而论本作的剧情够长够充实，没有明显的大坑，没有猎奇重口，强行拖一波的地方也不算多，虽然肯定难以媲美闪轨传说这些久负盛名的作品，但也不是某些小厂随便搞搞就做得出来的。比上不足比下有余嘛，我们都懂的。
    
    接下来就是比较尴尬的地方——地雷社没有好好考虑这部作品的[h1]历史进程[/h1]，这也直接导致其销量相对尴尬。不难看出，在此之前的无印开始只到RB3都是明显的小厂作风，（当然也是限于年代）瞄准PS3/PSV平台，对游戏性没有强烈的追求，当然剧情和つなこ老师的立绘都是可圈可点的；而本作的定位本该是地雷社打入PS4平台，打响名声的第一战，并为此做出大量创新，可惜因为种种原因没能成功，可谓是相当遗憾。
    
    [h1]在游戏性方面[/h1]本作下了足够的功夫来做出一定的革新，包括新增加的投资系统，大改连击系统，制作困难化，战斗与练级难度提高，以及（半）取消了前几作为所欲为的快速旅行[spoiler]只有虫也才能在两句诗的工夫从上海到北京[/spoiler]，促使玩家在一周目做出各种行动前需要理性考虑后果，一定程度上避免了过早沦为刷刷刷游戏的困境。因此，尽管其拥有相当之长的剧情，也不至于使一般玩家过早地感到无聊导致弃坑[spoiler]没错说的就是你，陪老婆玩游戏都能放弃的渣渣[/spoiler]。
    
    在这种情况下，拥有过长的[h1]剧情[/h1]跨度就不再是累赘，反而可以算一个优势了，因为玩家既然付了钱，在玩得开心的情况下自然希望玩到的越多越好。而且并不像某些游戏强行用多个视角讲一个相同的故事[spoiler]还tm第一天就涨价[/spoiler]，本作在单视角叙事（零、心次元）就已经非常优秀，超次元也是各个视角对应不同经历，并不会给人强行拖沓的感觉——相反，这种手法的运用在同类作品中也不算太多，再加上确实驾驭得当，可以算一个闪光点。
    而且，长是一方面，精是另一方面。本作的剧情编排算得上严谨（当然不是在虚拟中寻找真实感的那种），没有明显的坑，就精彩来说也远远超过同类作品平均水准了，还是很不错的。
    [h1]另外[/h1]，作为一个相声游戏，严肃的战斗中穿插几段逗笑的的时机总的来说是得宜的，うずめちゃん的白日梦，ネプ的相声，如此种种，都各有风格，也确实能引人发笑，真结局之后的四国各有几段对话非常有意思，反正在下笑了好久。
   
    此外，本作新增[h1]音乐[/h1]好评，从镇作之宝妄想Katharsis，到几首处刑曲，以及给人印象极深的HEAVEN，该抒情的抒情该燃的燃，可谓下足了功夫。つなこ老师重置了老人物的立绘，除了我家ギア额发稍微怪了点，全员吼评，点名表扬ネプ和うずめちゃん，格好いい。


    当然除了虫也没有人是完美的，对游戏也是一样。本作[h1]致命的硬伤[/h1]也有一些，我以为最主要的是[spoiler]三件事[/spoiler]两点。

    [h1]一是对玩家定位不够明确[/h1]，导致核心玩家得到了相当满足的同时，萌新在一旁射射发抖。本作的隐藏宝物，黑迷宫以及后期的战斗设定（无DLC武器下）有些过于硬核，后期战斗难度超越了已经公认较难的RB1，偏偏这些还都是相对重要的游戏部分，想好好体验游戏的话省略不得，导致坠痛苦的，就是这个黑迷宫里打架找隐藏，还看不到地图，这个效率啊Efficiency…………此外，我不知道有谁真的打了999的竞技场，反正我发现2KW经验都没法升一级后耻辱地选择了放弃——级数梯度划定可谓相当不合理，也缺乏有效的练级手段。

    [h1]二是革新不够彻底（战斗人员安排），某些地方又过于过分了（技能和连击）[/h1]，导致后期战斗技能的无力让玩家习惯近身平砍，法爷ロムちゃん和ラムちゃん主宰战场，相对出战人数待机人数过多等等问题未得到很好的解决，有一种换汤不换药之感。
 
    当然见闻者出现太晚，后期迷宫等候时间太长也算是个黑点，不过这些都是小事，主要的问题就是上面那件。



    不过瑕不掩瑜，[h1]总的来说[/h1]，虽不能向大厂精作看齐，在顶级的立绘和编曲，优秀的卖萌情节和Live 2D，超过平均水准的剧情支撑下，尽管只有三流的战斗体验和3D建模，新次元游戏：海王星 VII仍是一部不容小觑的作品，也确实对得起这个价格，值得购入。

    [h1]评分 NEP/NEP——看什么评分和评测，海王星直接买不就好了[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198087565261', 'num_games_owned': 860, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 4882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4649, 'last_played': 1503169919}
review:
[h1][b]“4 เทพธิดาแห่งโลกเกมบน Next-Gen”[/b][/h1]

Megadimension Neptunia VII (VII ไม่ใช่เลข 7 โรมันนะครับ ในที่นี้หมายถึง Victory 2) เป็นเกมภาคต่อลำดับที่ 4 ของซีรีย์ Hyperdimension Neptunia (ไม่ได้นับจากภาค Spin-off และ Re;birth) ซึ่งเคยลงให้กับ PS4 เล่าถึงความวุ่นวายบนโลก Gamindustri และการผจญภัยของเหล่าเทพธิดาแห่งโลกเกมทั้ง 4 (Neptune, Noire , Vert และ Blanc),  เหล่าน้องสาวเทพธิดา และ เหล่า Maker (Human) ตัวละครที่เป็นตัวแทนของผู้พัฒนาเกม (IF และ Compa) เหตุการณ์ในเกมจะเป็นเรื่องราวที่ดำเนินต่อจากภาค Victory (หรือ Re;birth 3 V Generation ในฉบับรีเมค) แต่.....ต่อให้คุณไม่เคยเล่นภาคอื่นๆ มาก่อน คุณก็สามารถรู้เรื่องราวก่อนหน้าได้จาก Prologue ของเกมสั้นๆ ประมาณ 5-10 นาที ในรูปแบบ Visual Novel (แต่มันก็ไม่มากพอที่จะซึมซับอารมณ์เท่ากับกลับไปไล่เล่นเองทุกภาคในภายหลัง)

ระบบการเล่นในภาคนี้ หากคุณเคยเล่นภาค Re;birth หรือ เกมอื่นๆ ของค่ายนี้มาก่อน ก็จะเข้าใจระบบการเล่นได้ไม่ยาก ตัวเกมจะเป็นรูปแบบ J-RPG Turn-Based กึ่งๆ Dungeon Crawler ตะลุยดัน ลุยบอส เดินไปตามอีเว้นท์แต่ละจุดเพื่อดำเนินเนื้อเรื่องของเกม ซึ่งซอยแบ่งออกเป็น 3 ส่วนอย่างชัดเจน คือ Zero Dimension ซึ่งเป็นบทนำของเนื้อเรื่องทั้งหมดของภาคนี้ , HyperDimension G และ Heart Dimension บทสรุปทั้งหมดของเนื้อเรื่องที่จะนำไปสู่ฉากจบของเกม

ระบบต่อสู้ที่นอกจากการเล่นแบบ Turn-Based ในภาคนี้จะเปลี่ยนแปลงไปจากภาคก่อนๆ นิดหน่อย ตั้งแต่…
- ระบบคอมโบ ในภาคนี้ไม่ใช่เอาท่ามาแปะให้ครบตามค่า CP (Combo Point) ที่มี เพื่อที่จะได้มีท่าตีเยอะขึ้นในแต่ละครั้ง หรือมาแปะไว้ใช้เท่ๆ อีกแล้ว หากคุณวางท่าโจมตีดีๆ และกดตามเงื่อนไขที่ท่านั้นวางไว้ เช่น ท่าแรกที่กดไปเป็นสาย Power ส่วนท่าที่ 2 เรากดท่าจากสาย Standard ที่มีเงื่อนไข “ใช้ต่อจาก Power” จะทำให้ คุณจะตีติด Critical เสมอและตีแรงขึ้นกว่าปกติ เป็นต้น
- Part Break ทำลายชิ้นส่วนของศัตรู เพื่อตัดการใช้ท่าโจมตีบางท่า หรือ เอาคุณสมบัติพิเศษบางอย่างของศัตรูออกไป เช่น กันการโจมตีกายภาพ เป็นต้น สามารถกดสำรวจศัตรูว่ามีชิ้นส่วนให้ทำลายหรือไม่ได้ด้วยการใช้ไอเทมแว่นส่อง ในหน้าจอต่อสู้
- Nepluker มินิเกมดันเจี้ยนพิเศษในรูปแบบ Platforming เดิน-กระโดดตามแท่นยืน ที่อ้างอิงจากเกม Spelunker
- Next Form ร่างที่ 3 ของเหล่าเทพธิดาทั้ง 4 ที่เสริมค่าพลังตัวละครเพิ่มอย่างมากโข รวมถึงไม้ตายใหม่ หากใช้ไปแล้ว จะกลับร่างปกติทันที

ในเรื่องกราฟฟิกถือว่าทำมาได้สวยงามขึ้นมากทั้ง โมเดลตัวละคร 3D , สไปรท์ 2D (ภาพตัวละครแบบ 2D เคลื่อนไหวได้ในฉากพูดคุยแบบ VN) ที่วาดขึ้นใหม่เพื่อ Next-Gen โดยเฉพาะ และ เอฟเฟคต่อสู้ที่ดูจัดเต็มมากขึ้น แถมตัวเกมยังใช้แรงเครื่องที่ไม่สูงมาก สามารถเลี้ยงเฟรมสูงๆ ได้สบายๆ

สรุปแล้ว หากใครเป็นแฟนเดนตายซีรีย์เนป ก็ไม่ควรที่จะพลาดเป็นอย่างยิ่ง หรือ ต่อให้คุณไม่ใช่แฟนเกมซีรีย์นี้แล้วหลงรักและชื่นชอบในตัวละคร ก็จัดไปอย่าให้เสียครับ

+ ระบบการเล่นแบบ J-RPG ที่เข้าถึงได้ง่าย ไม่ซับซ้อน
+ การเล่าเรื่องแบบ Visaul Novel มีการปล่อยมุกตลก และ เซอร์วิส เป็นของแถม
+ โมเอะชนะทุกสิ่ง!

+ / - ช่วง Post-Game ที่ดูจืดสนิท ที่นอกจากไล่เก็บ Trophy/Achievement และไล่เคลียร์ Collosium Battle ที่เหลือ ไม่มีฉากบอสไฟท์หรือดันเจี้ยนลับอะไรเพิ่มเลย เศร้าแท้ -*-

author: {'steamid': '76561198013559405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4362, 'last_played': 1525898920}
review:
Its a fantastic mix of a visual novel and a turn based RPG. It took me over 60 hours to beat the main game but it was a great experience from start to finnish.

The artwork and voice acting for the story sequences is top notch.(90% of the game is fully voiced)

The selection of characters for your party is 14 or more

The battles and combat have tons of depth and everything is animated from special attacks to transforms to team attacks.

Has a New Game + option that lets you carry over all your progress or as much as you like and a total of 3 endings.

My game ran with no crashes and a near constant 60fps 
win7
i5 4590
8gig ddr3
gtx 750ti 2gig

author: {'steamid': '76561198089289691', 'num_games_owned': 2958, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 8626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8475, 'last_played': 1479176868}
review:
[h1][b]¿QUÉ ES MEGADIMENSION NEPTUNIA V-II?[/b][/h1]

Megadimension Neptunia Victory II (o V-II) es la continuación canónica de "Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;Birth 3: V-Generation" y videjuego creado por Compile Heart acerca de consolas y el mundo de los videojuegos personificadas como chicas estilo anime en un JRPG que se siente mas balanceado que sus juegos anteriores, con la adicion de un nueva CPU: Uzume Tennouboshi, en una aventura divertida y lleno de guiños a la cultura gamer y otaku.

[h1][u]LO BUENO[/u][/h1]

• Apartado visual mejorado con respecto a las limitaciones de sus predecesores.

• Gameplay mas balanceado y mecánicas que hacen mas fluida la experiencia.

• La adición de Uzume como personaje “protagonista”.

• Mejor historia y eventos mas interesantes que mezclan bien el drama con la comedia.

[h1][u]LO MALO[/u][/h1]

• Sigue usando assets de sus juegos anteriores aun habiendo un salto importante de la PSVita a PS4/PC

• Problemas técnicos en ciertas áreas del juego.

• Neplunker ... 


[h1][u]Mi Opinión...[/u][/h1]

Volveré a repetirlo las veces que sea necesario: La saga Neptunia es uno de esos placeres culposos de la vida que tengo. Lo admito, sus juego no serán del calibre de un Final Fantasy, pero mantiene una buena dosis de humor y drama aceptable, y donde en este titulo se denota que no se han ido con diálogos o escenas innecesarias. Quizás la primera parte del juego sea horrendamente larga, pero luego es mas abierto. Con respecto al juego en si: No se nota demasiado el salto que hicieron de una consola a otra, quizás también el primer problema que no dejo en primer instancia que sea un titulo mucho mas imponente. La duración también es otra ha “mejorado” siendo la media de casi unas 80 horas, en las cuales en 2 ocasiones especiales (pero no obligatorias) se necesita farmear niveles y con una party de nivel 70 puedes pasar la historia sin problemas, salvo algunos dungeon extras donde te castigan enormemente. Megadimension Neptunia VII es un buen juego, y titulo que todo fan tiene que tener y quizás una carta de despedida de las CPU, por no poner spoilers ni nada.


[B]NOTA:[/b][i] *B*[/i] – Megadimension Neptunia VII es un gran avance técnico como en gameplay comparado con sus predecesores, donde realizan algunos cambios favorables y otros no tanto que podrían haberse sumado a la formula y con una historia agradable con algo de historia real de la industria (aunque no lo crean). Que no te deje engañar el fan service y las escenas casuales que puede ofrecerte el consumidor promedio, es un muy gustoso titulo para los amantes del anime y videojuegos especialmente.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980699864', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2352, 'last_played': 1479681211}
review:
new neptunia game=insta-buy (c)

[h1]Pros[/h1]

[h1]characters[/h1] 
your favourite "waifus" are here + new ones C-sha([b]CAPCOM[/b]), B-sha([b]Bandai Namco[/b]), K-sha([b]Konami[/b]), S-sha([b]Square Enix[/b])
[h1]soundtrack[/h1]
45 songs, for everything: joke scenes,boss battles,dungeons
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=31Yot7znY7A&index=2&list=PLqyzqHbjpDCwospM0vVbR2VUEWaXWhyJd
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GjgADKCKBKI&index=4&list=PLqyzqHbjpDCwospM0vVbR2VUEWaXWhyJd
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HubJEA_vxlk&index=25&list=PLqyzqHbjpDCwospM0vVbR2VUEWaXWhyJd
[h1]solid gameplay[/h1]
i farmed only once in "vert arc" for 5 levels(remember when you grind tons of levels in other jrpgs for bosses?)
combo system got rework: 
[b]EVERY WEAPON[/b] have [u]unique[/u] combo style
[b]example[/b]: 
weapon a=3 rush slots,1 power,2standart (standart replaced "break" attacks)
weapon b=1rush,3power,2standart.
[b]Most of the monsters got voice when they attack,getting damage, being nearly dead![/b]  [spoiler]YOU ASSHOLES (c) nearly dead gang boss cat.[/spoiler]
[h1]References[/h1]
Theres TONS of them:
Enemies pixelvader, old consoles,pipes from marYo
Skills and combo names... ORA ORA ORA
Scenes from game
[h1]Plot[/h1]
If you played previous games, you expect  "oh, final boss gonna be arfoire  as usual" and try save world.
But you fight BIG dark cpus, ninja-robot Steamax, lover of "busty blondes" affimojas and... true final boss *plot twist* [spoiler]dark uzume[/spoiler].

[h1]Cons[/h1]

[h1]crafting[/h1]
In previous games you use plans and craft cool items right?
There you craft MAXIMUM only 5-10 items.(like forbidden twig, and heal items)
[h1]Guild[/h1] 
Uselles,  you only using them for "first money", "shares" or "do quest to continue plot" (completed game with D guild member rank)
[h1]random encounters[/h1] 
you gonna say "but dude, you can farm exp,money,materials!" yes it is... BUT NOT WHEN EVERY FUCKING MOVING=ENCOUNTER and you wasting time for low-level mobs
[h1]monster power[/h1] 
you can deal ZERO damage to monster(so you spam skills) OR you can ignore them for plot bosses. And yeah... group of monsters more powerful than a bosses.
[h1]arc difficulty[/h1]
neptune arc= easy since you powerful and monsters are weak
noire arc= you run from monsters 
blanc arc= monster rekt your face(you slow,your damage suck)
vert arc= "hm, go farm levels, its "square enix" boss anyway" 
--------------------------------------------------------
even when i told you "pros" and "cons" (may missed something)
i rate this game ∞ outta 10 [spoiler]or just 10/10[/spoiler]
you can buy game on sale, but this game and developers [b]deserve[/b] full price.

UPD: steam nomination 2017

author: {'steamid': '76561198084556418', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4173, 'last_played': 1517641140}
review:
VII might be the best out of the five main games. 
I feel like the difficulty increased but overall the game is quite running on the same formula.
The gameplay doesn't change but I really like the battle system of VII. It's still more or less the same as before but it's easier to transform and spam the EXE moves in my opinion : just use rush attacks to build up the gauge and unleash the special effects.
A note on the transformations by the way : You now have transformation cutscenes, like in the original first game, and they look awesome.
Also, Neptunia is no longer the main main character : Every CPU enters the spotlight and has her own route during the Act II even though it's not that long. But it's still a nice surprise.   
One thing I didn't like though, is that to navigate in the world map you have to use roads and on those roads, you can get a random battle. It's quite unnerving when you have to go from Planeptune to Lowee ecause everytime a battle happens, you have to select again where you want to go. Plus those are very easy so it's just slowing the pace uselessly. Thankfully, on the second playthrough, you get an item to skip them.
Tip : Don't play the Neplunker dungeons. The rewards are not worth breaking your game pad over the frustration.
Sad point : No Pururut.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032618704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1482712735}
review:
ich weiß immer noch nicht so recht was ich von diesem teil halten soll
ich würde dem game eine 4 geben bis stand jetzt!

wen  ich an meine re-runs der  Re;Birth teile denke habe ich da recht viel zeit investirt 
oder den teil zu mindest einmal druch gespielt.

für mich macht das game recht viel andrest und so auch leider  schlecht, 
was halt meinen spielspaß gegen null tendiren läst.

das hauptproblem was die neptunia reihe  hat wirt hier halt nicht angegagen,
aber erst mal punkte die mich in den vorigen teile (Re;Birth) gestört haben;

es gab extrem viel Copy & Paste elmente.
in Re;Birth 2 hat mich das Lily Rank System extremst generft,
wo druch ich erst ganricht die andren ende frei gespielt habe.

in teil 3 gab es weniger  synchronisiert text sachen 
das Lily Rank System wahr immer noch nerfend den je.

dennoch hat sich hier vieles verbesert der Stella's dungeon master wurde besser 
das neue  Menü hat mir extrem gut gefallen.
die kleine änderung am Kampfsystem wahr super.

also was macht Megadimension den so schlecht?
das ich es gerade mal nur bis sand jetz 2h gespielt habe!

ja über dlc kann man sich streiten und die imba waffen aus den Weapon Pack braucht man nicht wirklich aber
das spiel ist wie alle teile schon so zu einfach, die zusätzlichen Party Character erweiterungen sind nicht wie 
füher von anfang  an für die party verfüg bar. 

Die neue hup welt finde ich langweilig da fand ich die alte nep map besser drot konte man noch irgend welche guddis fnden,
es spiel sich da etwas die die ganzen broweser games , man klick an einen punkt und der charakter läuft dort hin und wird gegeben fals angegriffen.

Die story fühlt sich extrem zäh an.

ich habe sogar teil weiße diloge einfach weg geskipt (gerade wie in teil 3 die nicht  synchronisier sachen) 
um voran zu kommen (und das ist disesmal kein re-run).

in den andren teile wahr das nicht so schlimm wie hier.
den dort hat mich die story bei ersten mal noch so weit geka$t das ich alles aufgesogen habe, 
evtl fehlt mir auch der humor der in den alten teilen viel weg gemacht hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070907784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1498, 'last_played': 1478960485}
review:
BEST NEPTUNIA GAME EVER.

I have owned the previous games, Nep1, 2 and 3.

And I must say this version is x10 better because: (NO SPOILERS)

1- Alot of new features
2- Actually has a story, and not just about puddings. 
3- Lots of new maps, and maps got bigger.
4- Less recycling.
5- New characters with fun personalities.
6- Better artwork
7- x10 Better music. 
8- More BOOBIES. Bigger and bouncier than before, too.

Buy it in a heartbeat. Amazing.

Recommend. 10/10

TIP: Buy all the DLCs except the ones which give armor or weapons, because those will take the fun out of the game. Maybe buy them when you reach end game. I love the new characters!!! <3

review:

[spoiler] 顺便感谢汉化组的辛苦工作[/spoiler]

--------------------分割线------------------------
社区有大腿做的繁中的汉化包了，不过翻译习惯可能需要适应一下
一周目已通，懒人只打出了坏结局，为了妹子，继续刷吧


朋友，你知道涅普顿吗


-------------------分割线君2--------------------
闲来无事打算做个评测

海王星系列是地雷社（Compile Heart）推出的萌豚向RPG，历史就不多说，目前系列正统作品有（括号内为原版名字，即主机版）：
超次元游戏海王星重生1（超次元ゲイム ネプテューヌ）（PC/PSV，PS3上为原版)----RPG

超次元游戏海王星重生2（超次元ゲイム ネプテューヌmk2重制）（同上）------RPG

神次元游戏海王星3（神次元ゲイム ネプテューヌV）（继续同上）-----RPG

新次元游戏海王星V2（新次元ゲイム ネプテューヌVⅡ）（PC/PS4）即本作------RPG


外传作品包括：

神次元偶像PP（神次元アイドル ネプテューヌＰＰ）（PSV）------大概是养成游戏[spoiler]（我更情愿认为是个GAL）[/spoiler]？

超女神信仰诺瓦露  激神黑心（超女神信仰 ノワール 激神ブラックハート）（PSV/PC）------战旗RPG[spoiler]（这翻译真难听）[/spoiler]

超次元游戏海王星U（超次元アクション ネプテューヌＵ）（同上）------ACT无双[spoiler]（手感我给0分，外包给了做闪乱那群家伙）[/spoiler]

激次元组合 布兰 海王星vs僵尸军团（激次元タッグ ブラン＋ネプテューヌVSゾンビ軍団）（继续同上）---------ACT无双[spoiler]依旧是做闪乱那群家伙做的[/spoiler]

超次元大战海王星VS世嘉少女梦之合体特别版（超次元大戦 ネプテューヌＶＳセガ・ハード・ガールズ 夢の合体スペシャル）(PSV)------RPG[spoiler]你咋不上天在多搞点这些[/spoiler]

四女神OL（四女神オンライン CYBER DIMENSION NEPTUNE）（PS4）[spoiler]就是贝露沉迷的那款游戏，不过不是网游[/spoiler]-----------大概是ARPG[spoiler]（没钱预定要死了）[/spoiler]

以上



------------------------关于本作-------------------------
游戏性7/10

作为日式[spoiler]日呆向[/spoiler]RPG，游戏性是其次的，本作稍微复杂一点也不过是连击系统和开发系统（自认为），略有一点游戏基础的人都能够轻易上手不过并不值得去深入研究[spoiler]反正你也是来看妹子的不是吗[/spoiler]



剧情10/10
实际上剧情概括起来也就一句话：四个妹子[spoiler]大概会更多[/spoiler]闲着没事又去拯救了游戏业界[spoiler]不做剧透党[/spoiler]。不过相比于前几部作品，本作剧情长度和深度已经高了不少[spoiler]我也不知道哪里有深度[/spoiler]，老规矩的多结局也是刷个不停。
PS:实际上除了极个别单词，英语难度不算太大



音乐8/10
虽然有部分音乐是从一代就开始用，不过这次好歹还是加了那么多对吧。三个篇章分别有三首主题曲[spoiler]心次元OP哭哭[/spoiler]，加上OP与ED，推荐加入歌单。
剧情部分各类音乐承转起合还是蛮对我胃口的，BOSS战音乐也挺有气氛[spoiler]好吧我不是学音乐的[/spoiler]。



海王星系列历来DLC都是地雷社圈钱好套路，这一作DLC多到有些过分，以个人观点给出DLC推荐：
武器包（各类weapon pack）、女神化装备包(Processor Pack)和装备包（equipment pack）若非土豪或真爱党请不要购入（喜欢一周目各类秒杀的除外），本作难度系数较低，一周目基本不用练级也可以打过各个BOSS

泳装包(swimsuit pack)泳装提供的属性加成很低[spoiler]妹子的泳装你还不买买买，所有泳装哦[/spoiler]
DLC角色包（Umio、Nepgya、Mllion Arthur、God Eater、Nitroplus）推荐购入，有单独的角色剧情（虽然很少而且都是在玩捏他），一周目非秒杀党绝对会成为你战斗的主力。
-------------------------------------完------------------------------
[spoiler]应该不会有更多了[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198125125325', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 8495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8210, 'last_played': 1527327609}
review:
~SPOILERS FREE!~
After finishing this game twice to get a different ending, i feel like i have to throw this game with a lot of good props in a review.
Apologize for the bad english tho >w< /

[i]Note: I am not gonna compare this game with the spin-offs because they have different gameplays. And also reviews are based on people's opinions... Opinions... [/i]

Megadimension Neptunia VII is the forth installment of the main Re;birth series after Re;birth 3 V Generation.
So if you want to experience the whole Nep-Nep story, you might want to play the other re;birth series first.
But if you wan't to just play MDN VII before re;births, don't worry they covered everything in the introduction.

About the gameplay, i really love the simplified battle system. Everything is just so smooth.
They basically added so much improvements from the previous re;birth series.

Okay let's just jump into the pros and cons section shall we?

[b]PROS[/b]:
- The story is divided into 3 parts (Trilogy), which makes it more interesting in my opinion.
- Always love the Scouts system, really helps with the grinding.
- No more Combo Points thingy for your Combo attacks (Wait did they already removed this in re;birth 3? I kinda forgot lol)
- Combo Traits, basically attacking with a certain 'combo condition' will make the attack a guaranteed critical.
- So much new dungeons!
- So much new monsters aswell!
- More balanced stats and exps. 
- Lots of 'fanservice' >v< b
- More funny game/anime reference jokes and very enjoyable sub-events too! 
- DLC characters are so worth to get. They're not just useful but they also have their own events too!
- Lots of feature improvements from the previous re;birth games that you can ever asked for.

[b]CONS[/b]:
- If you owned and enabled DLC equipments, this auto 'Best Equipment' new feature WILL override your current equipped gears with the best stats gears EVERYTIME your party left/join back again in the story progression.
  The problem is you can't disable this 'Best Equipment' thingy. (Hopefully they'll fix this soon)
- If you use a DLC character as a leader in your party while progressing through the story, there's a chance of crashing the game in some events. (I only had one crash because of this in my 2nd playthrough since i don't use DLCs that much in my 1st run)
- It's getting too grindy for End-Game leveling, especially above level 300.

That's it. The first two cons are more of a bug related so hopefully they'll fix it soon and i'll update this review.
Overall, you can already tell that this game is basically the BEST Neptunia series of all!

Thank you for reading the review! Have a nice day~!  ( > v < ) b

author: {'steamid': '76561198058572820', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 10512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5848, 'last_played': 1575306900}
review:
I think we all believed that Re;birth3 was the perfect game for Neptunia series, but I’ve to admit it, this Victory-II has proven that there were still room for improvements.

To start let’s make a beautiful [b]TL;DR[/b]:

Pros:
+ Big Neptune
+ Finally we have graphical assets for PC (but still frame drops while entering dungeons)
+ More variety of dungeons (still feeling a bit repetitive though)
+ The added a little more difficulty and the new combo system makes the game feel more tactic along with the new way of travelling the world map
+ No more GP, we are free of the classic spam breaker/spam power system
+ Going HDD now uses Exe Gauge instead SP, yay!
+ All the CPUs have their moment to shine in their own Story Arc
+ No more Lily Max/100M credits achievements
+ They nerfed the ridiculously OP Exe Drive

Cons:
- They nerfed Exe Drive too much (above lvl40 is better to use normal combos except for AOE)
- Next forms are cool, but they don’t have a major role in the game and feel like a bit waste of potential
- The new trio (Neptune, Nepgear, Uzume) can’t beat the one made by Neptune, Plutia and UD Noire in comedy and chemistry
- Lots and lots of unnecessary fanservice like no other Neptunia main game has had (yep, for me this is bad)
- Little end game content compared to Victory


[h1]Review[/h1]

Megadimension Neptunia Victory-II is the fourth main game of the Neptunia franchise.
Taking place some time after the events of the original Victory (V Generation in Steam) , we find Neptune being, once again, transferred to another dimension were, along with Nepgear, she’ll met Uzume, a mysterious girl fighting against a giant monster called Dark CPU.
Here will start the story, which would take us in a long journey into three “sub-games” inside the game with their own OP, ED and plots making them a “trilogy within a single game” because nep is nep guys.

Regarding the [b]performance[/b], which is one of the most important concerns from Japanese games, we have for the first time in the franchise access to a variety of graphic assets, but still a problem with frame drops at the moment the monsters in a dungeon charges. Out of it the only “problem” is the charge time between battles and world exploration.

In the gameplay, we face a classical Neptunia system with some elements added, more centred in a new balance. In this game we don’t have full access to each combo class, instead we’ll have the slots each weapon has (and no, the best weapons don’t have all the slots unlocked). This, along with the new combo traits, makes more important to chain attacks in order to activate the combo trait (100% accuracy/chance of critical hit) making a better work for the gameplay than the classic “spam breaker until you can spam power”.
There’s no longer GP, instead some monsters (and nearly all the bosses) have some kind of part that can be broken to show a weak spot, but the necessity of guard breaking has disappeared and this is a total improvement, also the Exe Drives now have been nerfed to the extreme, making them only a bit more powerful than a common skill and (in higher levels) weaker than a good chain of combo attacks.

The world map has also been redesigned into a one with a real feel of travel. Now we have to make roads to reach the dungeons with money, cities play a new and more realistic role since our characters can only recover HP/SP without items going to them, items development/scouts are also only accessible from those cities and there are random encounters while travelling between dungeons/cities.

The scout system has changed once more and, for me, to worst. The new scout system features lots of the classical Gamipics now working for us. In this system we don’t explore an external dungeon like in Stella’s one, now we explore the same dungeons that we have in the game, and each scouts has its own effect to make it easier or harder. They also find monster drops, money and clues to make the hidden treasure appear, but only work with the game running, not like in Victory.

Next Forms make their debut in this game, but they are nothing more than testimonial since their appearances in the main story are more than limited (in this game fighting a story boss with HDD from the start is rare) and, although being awesome, it feels that we need more time with them (hopes for the next game).

In conclusion, this is overall a must have for every Neptunia fan and, of course, JRPG fan.
A pretty solid game with good mechanics, improving all the areas and making the gameplay takes a giant step forward and starts killing the flaws of previous Neptunia games.

Rated 9.5/10 still needs more Plutia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013410553', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4783, 'last_played': 1474715779}
review:
К сожалению, steam предоставляет очень маленький объём для написания текста, поэтому здесь я ограничусь фрагментом. Кому интересна полная версия обзора, с плюсами, минусами и скриншотами по каждой части серии, прошу сюда: http://stopgame.ru/blogs/topic/76077
Помните, что любая оценка и любой обзор это чьё-то субъективное мнение/впечатление. Прошу не кидаться кака шками (да что нецензурного в этом слове? :) ), если кто-то со мной не согласен. Я готов к (и даже рад) конструктивному диалогу.
_____
Ууууххх. Наверное, самая сложная с точки зрения выставления оценки игра серии. Великолепный сюжет (его основа взята из реальной истории, а именно история краха Sega Dreamcast). Игра стала больше, глубже и взрослее с геймдизайнерской точки зрения. Обрела отдельные арки для разных персонажей, обрела моменты  разделения, среди которых в одном прохождении можно выбрать только один, практически избавилась от гринда. Замечательный саундтрек, который даже в отрыве от игры прекрасно звучит в ушах. Отличные новички, персонифицирующие современных и так хорошо знакомых нам издателей.
И .... совершенно несбалансированный геймплей. Игра (полагаю, все же не намеренно, а по недоработке тестеров) пошла по пути упрощения. Изменив боевую систему, разработчики пропустили балансировку количества маны и стоимости скиллов, в связи с чем всю игру я просто заваливал бесконечными скиллами рядовых боссов, главных боссов, опционального босса 99 уровня. Не беспокоясь об экипировке, команде, пассивных способностях. Все это было не важно. Тем не менее, это очень сильная, благодаря сюжету, игра, упрощенный геймплей которой не портит впечатления от погружения в её историю.
Отдельное "спасибо" за Neplunker Zero. Пусть эта темница будет гореть в геймдизайнерском аду до тех пор, пока её не пройдет каждый игрок. Для тех, кто еще не начал играть а только присматривается:
Разработчики решили отдать дань уважения игре Spelunker, сделав собственную темницу Neplunker Zero со схожими правилами. Задумка интересная, но реализация… Скажем так, потратив 1-2 часа вы разберетесь со всеми нюансами и сможете проходить это чуть ли не подряд без смертей. Но за эти 1-2 часа вы проклянете всё, что вам дорого, ибо каждый раз, думая, что вот, уже почти конец, вы будете умирать, по сути, не сделав никаких ошибок. Ибо проблема игры в том, что у нее неверный трекинг высоты и вы можете умереть даже просто прыгнув, пока будете идти к своей цели по прямой. Стоит ли говорить, что это будет проблемой, когда нужно будет реально прыгать? Думаю, нет — это очевидно. И это бесит. Тем не менее, если через эти самые 1-2 часа ваш геймпад еще не улетел в монитор, ваш стакан чая не разлит на полу, а ваш кот все еще сидит рядом с вами, а не зажат в углу от ужаса, значит вы совладали со своими нервами и заслужили свою награду в виде… ничего. Видел немало гнева на формуах на эту тему и теперь могу сказать почти наверняка, что прохождение не обязательно для достижения. Не проверял непосредственно это, ибо прошел её до фарма сокровищниц, но в итоге мне не пришлось брать самую последнюю сокровищницу, а значит не пришлось бы и брать её, будь она из неплункера. Может это сэкономит вам время :)
_____
Оценка: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198022112453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1710732188}
review:
It hurts to do this, but Megadimension Neptunia VII is hands down Idea Factory's worst Neptunia PC port to date. Even with a state of the art rig like mine crashes are a constant thing, and there are no fixes on the way. IF has made it very clear from their complete lack of any updates since the release that this version is what we're going to get, and we'll have to deal with whatever problems arise ourselves. The Rebirth Series had a lot of bugs and issues with RAM, but Megadimension is a game that will run fine for random intervals of time and crash for no apparent reason. During cutscenes, fights, it even crashes in the menus. What kind of game crashes in the Main Menu? Astonishingly, despite being a PS4 port, this version does not properly support a PS4 controller. Even when the game is running normally, graphics will flicker and get choppy just navigating the game map between areas. Sometimes the sound will begin to reverberate like the characters are talking in a tunnel or a cave. Having played the PS4 version prior to this, it's shocking how poorly this runs by comparison.

The game itself is really great, but for a lot of people it's completely unplayable on PC in it's current state. I would advise caution if you intend to purchase this. It may or may not work for you, regardless of the system you're using. It seems to be hit or miss with hardware.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258180311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5490, 'last_played': 1476302504}
review:
I enjoyed Megadimension Neptunia VII a lot. I am writting this after having unlocked all the achievements in the game (It was tough, I tell you), this shows how much I love this game. And you might like it too! 
This was my first Neptunia game, and it is definitly not the last!
The thing with Megadimension Neptunia VII, is that it has some really good points but also some rather "meh" ones about it. I will try to list them, for any of you, who would like to buy this game.

Very good points:
-The story is really good, I really loved it, it has some very powerful moments that made me love the Neptunia Universe!
-Some pieces of music in the soundtrack are amazing, I don't have any other words to describe them. If you were to listen to one I will recommend "Mousou Katharsis".
-The characters have distinct and intresting personnalities, which make them stand out in my opinion from other JRPGs' characters.
-And they are also very funny, especially Nep.

Good points:
-The game is long enough to keep you entertained for easely 80 hours.
-The New Game+ feature is really nice and make less painful the grinding for achievements
-There are many "mini-mechanics" in the game that are very nice (I will not spoil them, it is up to you to discover them! ;))
-The help messages is very clear and not invasive
-The quest system is nice

"Meh" points:
-The enemies and certain dungeons can be kind of repetitive
-The graphics for the dungeons are not that great for a 2015 PS4 game (But people say there is a massive improvement from the previous Neptunia games, so it might not be that relevent)
-The controls for a PC are not that great, I recommend playing with a controller (Xbox or PS4)

That's it for me, even if there are some rather "Meh" points, this game is really nice, I enjoyed playing it a lot! So give it a try.
I'm sure that Idea Factory International and Compile Heart are willing to improve their games, and I hope that this review helped, and that those issues will get fixed in the next main series games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239519450', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2465, 'last_played': 1488297985}
review:
本作是我心目中的系最佳作，V2R虽然我没玩但剧情流程基本是一样的。总体而言在游戏系统上较之前作有显著提升，在重生3完整的系统上更进一步。同时故事和音乐也有较大突破，剧情长度应该是系列最长，虽然依旧沿用了很多老音乐但新的BGM质量都非常高。
三个篇章环环相扣，二周目的时候发现了很多伏笔，看得出编剧的用心。BGM好评，印象深刻的包括OPED以及BOSS战和次世代变身BGM。   升天结局确实虐到我了，所以通宵打出TE ……
最后，居然没有UZUME背景，辣鸡地雷社！！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198073633559', 'num_games_owned': 611, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 9905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5794, 'last_played': 1661292287}
review:
Megadimension is fine example of improvement from the previous games why the performance of megadimenson is allot better compare to rebirth 2 and 3 for my pov. FPS drops non existing on my fx 8320 and 970 including my other pc that use an fx 6300 and R9 270X with an overclocked CPU the game scaled very good on amd hardware that I have tested. Soundtrack is major improvement compare the previous it's have a more depth and techno like instruments. Not only hearing it sound good be prepare for goosebumps some songs on the soundtrack is really relaxing and calming to the ear. Lastly is the story honesty is a massive improvement of rebirth 1 and 3 more serious scenes and more development for the goddess to see what their dreams and wishes. The story humor breaks the fouth wall like no other more a light heart way. Overall I think game is very fun and very interesting story/plot if you have played the previous neptunia games then go for it but make your hardware can handle it.

Update this game after beating it still worth playing it

author: {'steamid': '76561197994382336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5946, 'last_played': 1474778513}
review:
Another great installment in the Neptunia series.

Pros:
- Great graphic improvements since the previous title (R;B3:V Generation)
- Great story (if you like 4th walls broken every second line of text)
- There's actual plot!
- Great voice acting, as usual!
- Great humor (if you get the references)
- The HDD transformation sequences have been reworked and look pretty nice. 
- Most skills have custom animations too.
- Umio.
- New levels, new enemies.

Cons:
- The game is one patch behind the official release, meaning some features or game 'improvements' may be missing. 
- I purchased all the DLC only to find out that there's no real leveling/character progression past level 200-ish so most of the Colloseum battles will remain untouched. The only way to level up past 200 is killing the same enemy over and over again over 3000 times. Given the inventory limitations for enemy-respawning items this would mean a couple hundred of hours just to get to 999.

Complaints:
- The damage output of EXE Drives is pathetically low, compared to other Neptunia games. They deal less damage than a normal attack combo or a standard magic attack.
- Combo EXP bonus is lower (because the game is a patch behind) for large combos, which means grinding experience takes effectively twice as much time. (For instance: You do a 200 combo hit and that should net you a 100% bonus EXP, but it currently tops at 8%)

TL;DR:
- If you're a fan of the series and don't mind the drawbacks noted in the complaints section, this game is a must have. Hopefully it'll get patched one day, allowing for an end-game leveling progression which doesn't rely on a single enemy for grinding. 

As a fan of the franchise and Tsunako's artwork, I can recommend this game (without the DLC). Try nabbing it during a sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198107675942', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 9641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8744, 'last_played': 1638134879}
review:
Estava quase cogitando a compra de um PS4 e pá... eis que a IFFY me surpreende com o port do jogo pra PC.

[h1][b]Prós:[/b][/h1] - A historia foi muito bem elaborada chega a ser surpreendente em alguns momentos além de fazer vários ganchos com os jogos anteriores. IFFY faça um anime de Megadimension pls!!!
- Uzume/ ***** Neptune
- A OST é uma fucking M-A-S-T-E-R-P-I-E-C-E!!!! sem exagero nenhum. Foi um grande passo em relação aos 3 primeiros que tinha uma pegada mais digital em sua maioria.
- + Referencias mais em um nível superior Exemplo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WXCLESn6ETI

[h1][b]Contras:[/b][/h1] - O port não foi muito bem feito. Da pra notar quedas de FPS em alguns momentos como por exemplo abrindo e fechando o menu durante o jogo e em algumas batalhas escolhendo skills. Sendo que na versão de PS4 quase não da pra perceber queda de FPS em nenhum momento.
- A dificuldade do jogo é meio desbalanceada porque mesmo você não usando equipamentos de DLC ele é fácil em grande parte. Sem contar que o dano normal de combo da mais dano que couples skills de 4 personagens WTF??!!
-  Pós-game fraco... não deram muita atenção a ele sendo que só tem alguns eventos curtos sem gameplay. Queria zerar todo o coliseu mas só existe um mob para upar os personagens do lvl 99-999 e eu me recuso a usar trapaças ou matar um maldito Dogoo cinzento 3000+ vezes >.>''

[h1][b]OBS:[/b][/h1] Depois de finalizar o game fiquei com uma estranha sensação de saudade dos consoles da Sega .-.
E quem foi o desenvolvedor filho de uma Arfoire que inventou o Neplunker... serio que câncer @_@

Que venham Cyberdimension e Superdimension para a Steam mal posso esperar _(:з」∠) _

author: {'steamid': '76561198093454952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3928, 'last_played': 1660926767}
review:
I give this game 8/10 (Why? Pros and Cons time! And just because i'm Nep fans so i had no choice but atleast better than IGN or any) 

Pros:
+ Battle System (Become more 3D ver and is more different than Re;birth 1,2 and 3)
+ Post/Style (Every different win have 2 different post every battle)
+ New Transformation (As you know, NEXT form,)
+ Quality (Most likely are seem more len flare, shadow and a lots. You can change the settings in the game)
+ Combo (If combo traits correct, critz everytime!)
+ Transformation effect (It's more different than Re;birth just without any transfiguration step but now they added. For some reason)
+ Game series (Now they have 3 series in game. Zero, Hyper and Heart dimension.)
+ Weapon (Different weapon different Combo traits)
+ Shop (Cheaper than you thought!)
+ Investment (Increase your Shares, Dev item and Cloth)
+ Fun DLC (Umio, Nepgya and lots of Party Character you can bought)
+ Character (Now there's Gold Third and some.. spoiler character are able to join!)
+ Story (3 Different dimension, 3 different story. The true story are started on the beginning.
+ Guild (Improve your shares, but there's no cost on ur shares)
+ Gallery (Rewatch the events)
+ Disc (You can able to create a Disc name on Disc! What am i saying)
+ Disc Chips (You can able to bought at Shop or you can get it on Monster)
+ Ending (The ending are always sad. But is a good story)
+ Map (Different than before, use route to go everywhere)

Cons:
- DLC (DLC is too op enough to kill these monster easily and without taking any damage)
- Combo (Now that unable to use the same combo skill)
- Skill (Still the old skill nothing much change)
- Enemy (Enemy are strong, so without level up ur character, it's hard to beat the boss and Enemy)
- Graphic (If you change it to high, might be laggy when they transform and the step will be different. (If you're using old Graphic card)
- DLC Glitch (When you start a new game plus, everything will mess out. Except you have to turn if off and back on again. Then have to restart the game)
- Guild (Less than before)
- Investment (The price, it's killing people)
- Ending (In bad ending/good ending. You're unable to play back the game, you have to start New Game Plus.)
- Map (It's pretty annoying to go everywhere without New Game Plus, monster appear randomly and stopped ur move)

Nothing much to say. But here's the pros and cons that i noticed. If there's offensive things to you i'm sry, but this is just my pros and cons.

If i miss something maybe.. you can tell or else i guess.

(Sorry if i had a bad grammar)

author: {'steamid': '76561198127088638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1546177298}
review:
重写一个 作为海王星的新作 之前是在ps4上面发售，然后移植到了电脑上面，所以在操作方面会有的吃不消，建议连个手柄玩
比起前作 新次元海王星 的剧情更长，更具有可玩性，而且互动内容更多，地图也不在局限于之前的那几张，后期4女神的剧情分开选择后更让游戏具有探索性，玩家玩完一个剧情就会去打第二个剧情，全部打完后还会有另外一个次元的剧情，还有DLC剧情。
而且游戏后期渲染也很不错，风景也可以，是一款成功之作

author: {'steamid': '76561197997230290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 7260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7074, 'last_played': 1481844223}
review:
If u waited for better Nep than Reb3 then here u go. 
Pros:
+ No more repeating ng+ just to get that extra mb to craft plan, now u need only resources.
+ Nep is back with cool story, good nep jokes and cool new characters.
+ Awesome NEXT Forms and new exe skills
+ Better graphic and nice ost
+ NG+ options and bonuses (wanna keep ur lv, items or characters? Now u can choose!
Cons:
- Route building - u can build road to dungeon but only the way game will let u (u would like to build road to dungeon next to u? Too bad go around.
- Neplunker - Srs if u played dark souls and still are sane just don't :D 
- Wanna lv up to 999? sure just go and kill this one dogoo over 6k times in dungeon where u have no map and have to go back to shop to buy 30 items for respawn and back to 4th floor. Have fun.
- Lot of weapons or rather upgrades of old weapons that are useless.
Anyway if u like Nep, BUY IT even if would cost more than ur house :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198072692168', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 6695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3974, 'last_played': 1695080166}
review:
不管是玩了几遍也依然觉得很好玩，剧情上面没得说（一周目就升天的我二周目结果忘记做伊丝的任务结果又来了一次升天结局，当时心都快碎了，最重要的是没存档你造么），还有变身之后超帅的说(总感觉某300又能出新皮肤捞一笔），画面相比前几期来说也有提高，开头音乐也很好听，不过我还是喜欢重生1的，总的来说还是不错的。

















永远永远永远不要让我再见到那只又大又灰的史莱姆！！！！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198043982694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 13891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8900, 'last_played': 1651441953}
review:
Neptunia VII is a huge step up in quality compared to its previous titles. The new map system is more interactive and makes you more wary within the game. Some of the new challenges and functions within the game - collectable figurines and cards, hidden treasure challenges, Neplunker and investment - gives you a lot more stuff to do in New Game Plus. This recent addition to the series also brings about both new mechanics and obstacles that make the game more entertaining, and the newest cast members are incredibly entertaining.

The only downsides to this game are the lack of unique CPU and Gold Third costumes (not including DLC) and the pesky Card Master achievement, not to mention that Uni still needs a less flimsy skirt I mean holy marbles she might as well be named Captain Underpants at this point. Someone give that kid some trousers, please.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025028109', 'num_games_owned': 2088, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 2867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2867, 'last_played': 1473402910}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia VII is the 4th main title in the "Hyperdimension" series. Following the events of Re;Birth: 3 the main cast goes on their biggest adventure yet. This time we follow the tragic tale of the Sega Dreamcast.

If you've played any of the previous games you'll know what to expect going in. A large cast, lots  of meta jokes, hundreds upon hundreds of jokes about Gamer and Otaku culture, and a turn-based battle system that rewards mild positioning and strategy. but lacks real depth. If you've been following the Video Game scene for a while expect to get about 1/2 the jokes. If you know a lot of Otaku culture (Anime, 2Chan, etc.) expect to get the other half.

PROS:
[list]
[*]The battle system has had another minor overhaul making your combo length based on your weapon choice. The attacks you use now also have modifiers that can buff them if you meet certain requirements.

[*]The game requires very little to no grinding as long as you do fight [i]some[/i] enemies along your path through the dungeon, but this may be the hardest of the 4 main entries due to the fact the story constantly forces you in to smaller 1-2 man party sizes (sometimes without a dedicated healer) with 3 members at the most for large chunks of the story.

[*]Each of the 4 main Goddesses get their own dedicated story arcs. This is cool.

[*]The "Development" tree, which before allowed players to alter the way the game behaves, has been completely redone and now serves solely as a way to create items.

[*]Each of the 4 main cities now has an "Investment" option where you're able to spend your Credits on one of 3 branches: R&D, Commerce, and PR. (P.S. Only PR is worth your time)

[*]Unique dungeons and challenges in all dungeons that unlock special items.

[*]Scouts that act as Dungeon Modifiers which grant buffs to the location you send them to.

[*]There's now a navigable overworld that lets you set routes up to traverse complete with random encounters!

[*]New dungeons that actually require some minimal exploration and platforming!
[/list]

CONS:
[list]
[*]The development tab is now completely worthless for most people AND getting the items to do it DOES take lots of grinding.

[*]Quests (which were mostly grinding before, but offered some value to do along the way) now offer very little unless you do spend time grinding your way up through them.

[*]The game constantly pulls people in and out of your party, but this resets any equipment you have on them. You like those clothes and the hat you dressed them up in? Too bad. Put them on again.

[*]The random encounters in the overworld...

[*]There are still too many recycled dungeons along the main path of the game.

[*]Lots of the dialogue is broken up into small "chirper" events now. They help simulate that X amount of time has gone by, but there are times where you basically go through 3 or 4 of these in a row that may as well have been 1 longer one.

[*]The item drop rate is excruciatingly low. If you want to craft anything you WILL be grinding. Even with scouts gathering resources for you.
[/list]

OVERALL:
While I can't call this one the best of the main series, I still think 3 is the overall best, it is definitely up there. If you want to try the series out for the first time I'd recommend checking Re;Birth 3 out over this one. It's simply a better entry point for the series. Megadimension Neptunia takes the series 3 steps forward and 1 step back. I'd love to see Quests be more important and the development tab return to form. As it stands it is still a very good game, but it isn't a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308800057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1351, 'last_played': 1605040800}
review:
(5.5/10)
I'll get some hate for this but I truly cannot reccomend this game, it is Hyperdimension Neptunia however its so different with no transition into this difference. Not to mention i didnt want them to change the game in the first place. 
Negatives:
This game barely touches the same level of comedy, barely touches the same level of emersive gameplay, Completly changed how you have to battle, Tons of storyline battles are completely luck based (Spoiler maybe: At some point you battle the 4 cpus sometimes they can continusly spam exe moves or somtimes you can live while they use normal attacks), They put in a new quest system but they dont even use it effectivly, it barely touches the same level of almost everything. By the way remeber all the items you used to be able to collect in dungeons? Yeah, nope not anymore.
Positives:
However there are some big imporvemnets (not enough to balance its flaws)- The Scout system is way better, the new characters are really cool, investment is a really cool concept (they killed it by making anything but public relations almost pointless), Also it is really neat and annoying (but its a good kind of annoying) how you can have random encounters while walking across the world you cant just fly over unphased 100% of the time. 
Overall rating? 
5.5/10 that is compared to HDN Rebirth 3 at a 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198125309957', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1468351154}
review:
1 reason to buy this game.........Nep-Nep........the end (cant believe i havent posted a review until now for this awesome addition to the neptunia series)

but to be a bit more serious I had this game on ps4 early this year when it first came out and played through it like crazy.......the 3 miniature stories are a nice twist to the neptunia games along with new characters like Uzume (super kawaii!!!) and i love the music in this series over the other 3 predecessors and the new NEXT forms add a nice welcome bit of spark to our beloved protagonist, loli's, gaming otaku, and tsundere.......plus.............there is some A+++ Neppintastic! fanservice here for all the neptunia fans dying for whats........"NEXT"......lol.....also i love that the EXE drive moves arent OP "insta-kill" anymore like they were in the other games......neptunia games dont require much thought at all in battle.....but at least now it requires a little more......

very good game i would have to say it is tied with the first neptunia rebirth game as my favorite of the whole series when i am in the mood for nep i will always come back to this game.....hopefully they come out with a second season of neptunia the animation that is based off this game........hopefully.........anyhoo.....im going to get some pudding now so.....bye!!

8.8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198141401549', 'num_games_owned': 2944, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2028, 'last_played': 1473423709}
review:
[h1][u][b]Introduction[/b][/u][/h1]


With the game's story starting off after the events of Re:Birth3, our beloved CPUs, CPU Candidates, and humans return on this installment that showcases three dimensions happening in different timelines namely; Zero, Hyper, and Heart Dimensions.


[h1][u][b]Gameplay[/b][/u][/h1]


In a nutshell, [b][i]Megadimension Neptunia VII[/i][/b] is a compilation of three (3) different episodes: Zero Dimension, Hyper Dimension, and Heart Dimension. 

[i]Zero Dimension[/i] (which is the first one to be played from the three), shows a darker premise compared to the setting of the other games in which is presented in a post-apocalyptic fashion of Gamindustri in which a new goddess, [i]Uzume Tennouboshi, the Orange Heart.[/i]

[i]Hyper Dimension’s[/i] story and setting is very similar to the earlier Re:Birth games and focuses more a new character group called “Gold Third” formed by [i]C-Sha, S-Sha, B-Sha, and K-Sha[/i], and serve as the counterparts of our dear Gamindustri goddesses that also has a transformation similar to HDD referred to as [i]“Gold Form”[/i].

[i]Heart Dimension[/i] focuses more on plot twists which is the result of the combination of both the Zero and Hyper Dimensions, wherein the CPUs travel to a strange, new dimension to find out who is the mastermind of the anomalies happening in other worlds.

The gameplay, compared to the earlier games of the series has also improved. One of those improvements is the [i]"Combo Make"[/i] system, which is somewhat staple in the series. This system helps you customize the attacks that you can use to combo in which the number depends on the current weapon you have equipped on your character (with a maximum of 5). 

In these combos, there are three types of attacks that you can do; [i]"Rush"[/i] attacks, which focuses fast multi-hit strikes, but gives fairly low damage per strike; [i]"Power"[/i] attacks, which hits harder than the other types but has lower number of strikes; and [i]"Strike"[/i] attacks, which is a balanced type in terms of power and strike count.
Another feature on this system is the [i]"Traits"[/i] for each attack type, wherein successfully fulfilling the condition stated on the trait (ex. a standard attack requires you to NOT use a power attack) will bring in more damage output to the performed attack type.

Other gameplay features such as the [i]"Disc Developer" and "Item Development"[/i] similar to the earlier games comes back in this game which serves as a method to make additional equipment or items for your characters. [i]Disc Developer[/i] allows you to create your own original game discs by incorporating "Idea Chips" which has different kinds and varies from levels 1 to 5.Certain combinations can determine if the disc will turn into a [i]"Godly" or "Sucky"[/i] game which offers additional positive or negative bonuses once equipped. 

[i]Item Development[/i], on the other hand, allows you develop items, accessories, and even weapons for your characters to use. In order to make those stuff, you will need to have a [i]"Product Proposal"[/i] which serves as a recipe and will require you to gather ingredients as well as achieving specific Lily Ranks between two characters to produce it.

Not only that, there also other mini-games that you can access (take Neplunker as an example), as well as additional maps and characters unlocked through the DLCs.


[h1][u][b]The Pros[/b][/u][/h1]


    [*][b][i]Quality Art and Audio[/i][/b] - Whenever I play Neptunia games, I always look forward to the soundtracks that I can add to my playlist as well as the "cutesy" and "ecchi" moments described by the artworks presented, both of which are plenty and of quality (and beware, asmost of the art are more revealing compared to the earlier games). High quality standard being kept by IdeaFactory is very much worth of praise.

    [*][b][i]Improved Difficulty Balance[/i][/b] - If you played the earlier games of the series (Hyperdimension 1 to 3), most of them are pretty easy and smooth-sailing in terms of the battle system. However in this rendition, it seems that our daily mobs have learnt some spunk and will give you a hard time especially if you skip most of the enemies and ignore leveling your characters. This is a good adaptation which ups the challenge of the gameplay instead of just hacking enemies in a flash.

    [*][b][i]Tons of Hours in Game Content[/i][/b] - Seperated into three different episodes (Zero, Hyper, and Heart Dimensions), this rendition of the series is arguably the most "content heavy" compared to the earlier Neptunia games. But the game having separate episodes split isn't the only reason why it has more content, the game showcases the comeback of characters from the earlier games (like IF and Compa), as well as some new and interesting characters (like Uzume Tennouboshi and the Gold Third), and also some new features in the gameplay such as the "Combo Make" which adds more flavor to the battle system.


[h1][u][b]The Cons[/b][/u][/h1]


    [*][b][i]Grind Heavy Gameplay[/i][/b] - Due to the gameplay being more of a challenge than the earlier games of the series, this factor will translate into more grind time for players to compensate for the difficulty balancing. Another factor contributing to that is this time, there won't be an EXP boost add-on that could help decrease the grinding, especially in the end-game stages.

    [*][b][i]Reused Assets[/i][/b] - As you progress through the game, you will notice that the enemies and some of the dungeons are somewhat reused with a different arrangement (ex. different color scheme but same model, same maps from the earlier games). While this is something that has been around since the earlier games and isn't something that is of a major downside, it would've been a nice addition especially since the game's theme is about other dimensions.


[h1][u][b]Final Thoughts[/b][/u][/h1]

As usual, Neptunia games are of quality and it's a no-brainer to get for long-time fans, and it is a pretty good RPG to say at the very least for those who are new to the series (and to those who are new, beware of fan-service content overload). 

[b]Rating[/b] - 9.2/10 

[quote]This review was submitted for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/elitegives]Elite Giveaways[/url], check us out for more reviews ranging from Indie games to AAA games.[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198044839188', 'num_games_owned': 3384, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 2724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2724, 'last_played': 1473154324}
review:
Remember when The Wither took bath after battle and womens wnet WOOAAAAAA and *GASP and stuff?
This time woman are taking bath after the battle and guys goes WOOAAAA and *Gasp! and stuff.

https://youtu.be/h5mWFVOBF4Y

Cała recenzja jest tutaj > http://www.gikz.pl/artykuly/recenzje/megadimension-neptunia-vii/

Czas spędzony z Neptunią to była słuszna sprawa. Było śmiesznie, były zaskoczenia, śledziłem jak dobry serial cały czas dobrze się bawiąc. Cieszyło mnie zaprojektowanie gry, przynajmniej pierwszego przejścia (NG+ nie sprawdziłem), na lekką strawę, bez konieczności specjalnego grindu. W zakresie walk, bo nie sposób przy takim podejściu wymaksować absolutnie wszystko (ale strój pokojówki miałem, ghe ghe), wiadomo. Niemniej jednak raz czy dwa pobiegałem po labiryntach, żeby natrzepać pieniążków na lepszy sprzęt, ale żeby mieć jakieś mocne spięcia z przeciwnikiem i bym musiał koksić nie wiadomo ile, nie stwierdzono. Skracanie animacji, pierwszorzędne. Patenty narracyjne, zaskakujące. Pewnie i tak nie korzystam z szału w pełni, bo nie doszukuje się w postaciach swojej waifu, ani nie siedzę i nie wykłócam się na forach steamowych jak ułożyć TOP 5 babeczek w grze występujących, dzieląc to na te trzy akty, ale będę wspominał miło. Pewnie do kolejnej części. Nie, żebym teraz był jakimś fanem visual novelek, ale też jakoś mniej się dziwie tym, którzy po nie sięgają.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125983259', 'num_games_owned': 375, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1483925060}
review:
Поиграл несколько часов, дропнул, дал второй шанс, опять дропнул, скорее всего больше не возьмусь (разве что от безысходности).

Плюсы -  графоний, рельефы,(нет, не лесенками), говорящие мобцы в боях (разнообразие)
Минусы - система пошаговых боев, как в в 1-2-3 непе (уже начало надоедать), опять же говорящие мобцы, но уже в вн состявляющей (я что пришел сюда слушать убогих мобцов или на годный юрец смотреть?), глупая система перемещений с возможностью боя (простите, но это не FFT, где бои длятся по 20-40 минут), данжи превратили в лабиринты (смысла в этом вообще не вижу), 20 проходов - из них, 15 тупиков, 4 сундука и 1 нужный (ну глупостью пахнет, честно). ЦЕНА МАТЬ ЕЕ - 900Р за ЭТО, хотя должна стоить она на деле, не больше первой непы (если уж хотите покупать для коллекции, то меньше чем с 60%-80% скидкой не берите).

Не ведитесь на отзывы, а критику сразу же минусуют

Рекомендую купить (НЕТ). А если честно, лучше купите Action U (в ней правда мыльцо присутствует мыльцо, но оно лечится), она в разы лучше. Если хотите в Акшоне хардкора, то купите длц для настоящих корейцев (difficult quest, сомневаюсь, что вы пройдете ее, кроме как за Верт)

Короче - 10 купленных отзывов из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198123236969', 'num_games_owned': 3530, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1877, 'last_played': 1472438164}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia V II  (Не 7 а V2)

Це продовження досить популярної серії ігор, про дівчат котрі є "Богинями" своїх націй, а також вони ЦП (центральні процесори) Звучить дивно, але потрібно зіграти щоб розібратись =)
Я не буду вникати в лор світу, для цього існує трилогія Rebirth =)

Що собою представляє ця гра, це суміш JRPG та Графічних новел. Тобто в грі є підземелля з покроковими боями в реальному часі, та маса діалогів у вигляді графічних новел, і такий мікс працює, і не рве враження від гри. І насправді мало за що гру можна покритикувати, але все по порядку.

Тепер трішки детальніше про гру, почати варто з того, що ми отримуємо не одну гру, а одразу три гри (окремих історії, в котрих навіть є частково різні геймплейні моменти), кожна з яких займе не менше 20 годин на проходження, кожна має свій сюжет і наслідки на наступні, і хоча сюжети наче прості, але цікаві, і за рахунок геймплейних моментів дарують різні враження, що вже є безперечно перевагою. В сюжет вникати важко без спойлерів, але це справді на голову вище за попередні ігри серії.

Як я писав вище геймплей складається з двох основних частин, по-перше це покрокові бої в реальному часі, тобто це покрокові бої, але кожен хід ми можемо рухатись по полю бою для використання тактичних маневрів, для прикладу удари в спину наносять набагато більше пошкодження і подібне. Бойова система дуже широка і складається як з комбо ударів котрі покращуються з рівнем і покращенням зброї, так і зі скілів. Але головною родзинкою гри є тимчасові "еволюції" героїнь, в так названий стан HDD, коли вони стають "Богинями" це добавляє статів, та добавляє чи змінює скіли. І про нововведення цих ігор, це величезні бої з босами велетнями, де нам доведеться вибирати навіть устрій команди для оптимальних комбінацій, і також друга стадія еволюції, що звісно дуже круто =)

Графічно гра теж розділена на дві частини, коли ми в підземеллях чи в боях ми в 3Д світі, котрий хоч виглядає непогано, але технічно застарілий, і на жаль багато запозичає з попередніх частин серії, що точно можна занести до мінусів. Але коли ви в діалогах, перед нами 2Д моделі персонажів, дуже високої якості, трішки анімовані, статичні, але проявляють емоції згідно діалогу, ось вони виглядають класно, і навіть трішки покращилась відносно попередніх ігор.

Для мене особисто однією з найсильніших сторін є озвучення серії, я не знаю японської, але просто фанатію від англомовної озвучки персонажів, але на жаль і тут не все так просто. Хоча озвучено дуже багато діалогів, але знову на жаль все ще не всі, тому є куди покращуватись.

В цілому це справді хороша гра, тут величезна кількість контенту, тут справді класні персонажі, котрим приділяється достатньо часу, тут цікаві діалоги в котрих ми знайдемо масу мемів та відсилок на реальні події. І хоча грі є куди розвиватись, для прикладу добавляти з новими частинами, більше нових монстрів, локацій, покращити графічну складову, чи більше уваги приділити озвученю, я все рівно буду рекомендувати цю гру і неважливо чи ви хочете її зіграти ради геймплею, котрий тут глибокий і дуже цікавий. Чи просто ради історії і персонажів, котрі веселі і точно запам'ятаються =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198012815897', 'num_games_owned': 572, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2677, 'last_played': 1472773309}
review:
[h1] Skippable Disclaimer [/h1] 

[i]Before you head on to read my review I would like to leave this note explaining some things I think are worth mentioning: I have neither played any Neptunia game ever before, (thus this review is meant to be a standalone one , not a comparison to previous titles.) Nor I'm experienced with Novel games as they have never really dragged my interest in the past. (Although in the contrary im familiar with the RPG elements this game provides). 

Despite all that, I had a wonderful time playing through and finishing the game and im most likely going to play around on my NG+ savefile a little bit more. Aside from all this , i've decided to split the review into Short Gameplay Positives and Detailed Gameplay Negatives. The reason behind that is that I feel like there's an overflow of positive self-explanatory stuff over the few actual worth mentioning negative stuff. [/i]

[h1] Introduction [/h1]

Megadimension Neptunia VII is a game that combines the Novel and RPG genre into one , creating a heavily story driven game while adding alot of gameplay elements to keep you interested and curious to see how your characters and the story progress. The game has it's own standalone story although there are many characters that you may be familiar with if you have played the franchise in the past. With the main protagonists being Neptune and her sister Nepgear you'll find yourself in a crazy dimensional hopping adventure, A story broken down into 3 Arcs that on average should take around 40-50 hours to complete assuming you do not skip dialogues and play the game the way its meant to be played. Ontop of that once you're finished you're given the ability to start a NG+ which allows you to try for a different ending, raises difficulty and opens you up to more achievements and challenge hunting.

[h1] Short Gameplay Positives [/h1]
[list]
    [*]The first playthrough alone should offer 40-50 hours of rich storytime and action.
    [*]A great variety in customization for each character including weapons , clothing for both human and HDD forms and accesories.
    [*]Visually, very satisfying both in 3D action and on the Character + Background art during dialogue.
    [*]Alot of treasures/unlockables spread around all dungeons for the players to search for.
    [*]A great ammount of soundtracks and sounds whether you're in a dungeon , listening through the story or moving around in the overall map.
    [*]A great ammount of action-filled unique skills for each character, each with its own crazyness whether its casted directly from them or if it's a formation skill where specific characters gather up to cast an attack together.
    [*]A selection of either Japanese or English Voice-overs to choose from depending on personal preferation.
    [*]Both grindy and casual achievements for players to hunt.
    [*]A big selection of dungeons to play through with many enviromental themes and many different type of monsters.
    [*]After finishing the game, the choise of going for a NG+ which adds more playtime for those interested and those who want to replay the game without having to start from zero.
    [*]Multiple Characters to unlock and choose from despite them not being available on all the parts of the game. (Unless on NG+!)
[/list] 

[h1] Detailed Gameplay Negatives [/h1]
[list]
    [*]The system the developers use on dungeons, while there is a big variety of base themes, is basically recycling a selection of them and changing their layout. While that isn't really a problem I feel like they could improve ALOT on filling out these giant -but at the same time, aside from monsters and few breakable blockable objects such as boxes- EMPTY dungeons. 
    [*]While knowing this is a novel-based game and perhaps the developers wouldn't want to drive that core element away from their game, it would be welcome to see more animated parts on core story moments. It seems that there was an effort  to do that , but it seems like it was executed poorly.
    [*]It bothers me that while theres such a great variety of skills, you cannot interact in any way with them after you've casted them. I would like to see some gameplay elements like: Pressing a certain key on the right time while you're watching the animation of your skill, will cause extra damage or not pressing it at all, will cause it to miss. It doesn't have to be that way for every single skill but it's a real shame when the grinding part gets to you and you basically skip through the animations of skills you've watched multiple times in the past and theres no longer an excitement factor into them. (You can skip watching friendly/enemy attacks or skills with a press of the button if you want to speed up the game)
    [*]Illusionary difficulty: While that shouldn't be something surprising for an RPG , obviously the higher your level is, the easier the game gets. The more underleveled you are, the more grinding you'll have to do. But it seems that there are many stats like Elemental damage and Ele. Resistances that didnt seem to be all that important in the first playthrough/main parts of the game and it seems like raw difference in levels is all it takes to beat the enemy.
[/list]

[h1] Conclussion [/h1] 

I didn't know what to expect when I jumped in. Having the game's pricetag in my head ([i]Note: I recieved the game for free[/i]), I told myself at the beginning that I was going to be a little bit more "harsh/judgemental" than usual but in all honesty I put that feeling aside within the first 3 hours as I was getting sucked into the story more and more. If you like novels or RPGs with a rich story for that matter then I definitely recommend Megadimension Neptunia VII, I had tons of fun playing and in the future Im looking forward to try a new Neptunia title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025400295', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 3114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2435, 'last_played': 1473032063}
review:
A solid title for all those who praise Nep, but for newcomers, it's not a good entry point into the series.  You can tell that it tries, but this kind of series has way too many references to earlier entries for the 4th game to be anyone's first.  That's right, this is Neptunia "V2", not 7.  Because why not.

Overall, it introduces some good things and some bad things:

+More area variety (not many, but if you've been on the ride this long, it's a welcome addition)
+Combo system redone to require actual thought (can't just set up "powerpowerpower" then "rushrushrush")
+Skill use outside of combat
+A small handful of cg cutscenes
+Better overall quality
+Nepgeardam hat for Nepgear

-No more instant travel, including far, FAR too many world-map random battles that can't be turned off until ng+.  I had to fight normal dogoos twice on the way to the final dungeon.
-tedious scout system in order to discover areas and hidden enemies
-quest system ruined by the sheer amount of quests that depend on scouts finding the enemies beforehand
-party members in the back don't get exp now.  I have 20 party members and only 4 front line spots, Iffy. Why.

At the end of the day, it's more Nep.

:3   dont tell anyone...ne


List of Pro's/Con's so far:

+ The best Neptunia release in the series for many reasons as below
+ More serious/upbeat OST along with the old ones
+ More characters introduced
+ More interaction with cities like investing etc
+ Scouts work similar to Fairies from Fairy Fencer F
+ Has that Next-Gen feel to it with wider areas with more detail
+ Reworked, Redrawn characters during dialogue scenes
+ Tweaked system from Fairy Fencer F
+ Well matched voice actors
+ New win, level-up-a-des poses
+++ Tsunako. I want to marry her art


- Old OST from previous games feels over used and shouldn't have been added
- Some characters taken out like Plutia for e.g, should have been added as DLC character
- Some areas can leave you feeling a little lost especially when in a rush to save
- EXE bars fill too fast
- No difficulty option
- No 4K support (mod workaround)
- Nepgya not worth as DLC character. I get the humor in it but should really be unlockable accessory for Nepgear

author: {'steamid': '76561197995824575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2672, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2672, 'last_played': 1475244371}
review:
I've you've even partially enjoyed any of the previous Neptunia games then you need to play this one.

The story is their best yet, the music is better than ever, Formation and Coupling skills now actually feel like a part of the game rather than simply tacked on, and the DLC characters actually feel like a part of the world.

Add to that several story elements that are either rare in this series if not straight up unheard of and you've got a recipe for a solid experience all around.

The main story has many twists and turns that I simply did not see coming as well as several moments that reminded me why I keep playing these games time and again.

One thing that I really loved is that after your first run through you get items to make it much faster to get back to the parts you want to play through again without getting stuck with all the drudge work of the first run through.

The music, as I said before, is better than ever. Getting to a serious moment and having the perfect music kick in with flawless timing makes those great moments feel even cooler. Add in the ability to rewatch literally any scene you've seen allows for easier access to those great moments without having to trudge through an entire nother run just to see it.

Seriously, play this game. If you're here reading this then you will probably enjoy it.
