author: {'steamid': '76561198007451060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2702, 'last_played': 1494673537}
review:
[i]Spoiler Free Personal Review[/i]

[b]Definitely worth every penny with all the DLCs.[/b] 

-Summary-
Hilarious conversations, puns about real life console wars / Game Companies / Movies, the beautiful artwork / character designs in addition to an engaging story and finally the end game colosseum that keeps you hooked till the very end. 
[list]
[*]Story: 10/10
[*]Game Mechanics : 10/10
[*]Characters/Artwork: 9/10
[*]Audio: 10/10
[*]Difficulty: 10/10
[/list]
10/10 would definitely want a sequel and I cant wait for the spin-off game 4 goddess online: Cyber Dimension Neptune


[h1][b]Detailed Review[/b][/h1]

[b] -Story- 10/10 [/b]
The reason why I love this series is due to the perfect depiction of the console wars in real life format where each contries in gameindustry represents the popular console makers such as the Sega Neptune, Sony's Playstation, et cetera. So far the stories for each of the Neptunia series has not disappointed me. All of this series always makes me constantly asking myself  'what's going to happen next?' Neptunia VII is no exception. With this drive, I always end up spending lots of time playing it, even if you feel bored grinding, the story always finds its ways to cheer you up with hilarious conversations that will make you grin like a r*tard. However I have to say that this has by far one of the most engaging story so far coupled with some tearjerking moments. Steam already handled the summary so I will not touch on it in my review.

[b] -Game Mechanics- 10/10 [/b]
The Neptunia Series is probably 1 of my most favourite JRPGs ever since its first release on PS3. From spamming SP skills to Rush combos -> EXE skills, the evolution of this game's mechanics has come a long way and MDNVII has by far the best game mechanics compared to the prequels. Compile heart and Idea Factory really nailed this one perfectly. Strategic planning of your own combos to activate bonuses for critical damage as well as some special skills that you can use at your own discretion if you want to end a battle with style. Unlike the previous series where spamming skills is the best way to deal damage, this time its all about setting up the perfect combos.  

[b] -Characters / Artwork - 9/10 [/b]
I took interest in the neptunia series when I saw the 1st game's PS3 Boxart for the first time on the shelves of my local retail store. The beautifully created characters along with each of their unique personalities has kept me hooked onto the screen everytime a conversation or dialogue is being played. All the characters in this series has never triggered my disdain even the main villians in the series always has a certain charmpoint/funny aspect about them that makes you laugh and grin everytime you see them.  Characters aside, the background artwork is always wonderfully drawn in tandem with the characters. However minus 1 from verdict points as some background are just reused from the prequels with HD Textures. Addin on, some endgame dungeons are are really annoying with no textures, like you're in some retro game and those dungeons really takes a toll on your eyes but nevertherless its not a big deal since its only like 4 or 5 dungeons.

[b] -Audio/bgm/voice- 10/10 [/b]

The music/bgm in this game is perfectly done for every situation and it always fits the situation you are in. Be it a dungeon, when you're transforming to HDD Form, climax sections, when you're unleashing an ultimate skill, et cetra. The audio team really composed the BGMs to fit perfectly in any situations. So far none of the bgms has made me annoyed before. As for the Voice of the characters, NIS always provided English and Japanese Voices so its a personal preference. I prefer the Japanese Voices as it feels more natural and there is more emotions involved in the speech patterns. Japanese Voice acting has always been Top Notch.

[b] -Difficulty- 10/10  [/b]

This series has never offered any difficulty settings and the difficulty is based on your equipment and level. The difficulty of this game is really flexible as you can choose to purchase DLCs to make the game easy for those that are interested in the story only or simply don't have the time to grind your levels or else, you can play the game normally and you will encounter certain parts that will prove to be a challenge unless you grind your levels.

Kudos to NIS for translating the game ever since the start of this series as well as Idea Factory and Compile Heart for making such a wonderful series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023928592', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1135, 'last_played': 1597807722}
review:
[b] Actualizado después de dar vuelta el juego, apuntando lo más alto posible[/b]

Primero, antes que nada, tenía planificado juntar algo de dinero para comprarme una reluciente copia de la Edición Definitiva de Forza Horizon 3 desde que lo ví en la E3 (ya que es para Windows 10) (CLP 80000 Aprox. aquí), y yo anticipando que la cuarta parte de Hyperdimension Neptunia llegaría el próximo año... Hasta que un amigo me dijo: 

[quote=Inject20X] ¡Grone, prepárate, el Megadimension Neptunia VII va a llegar a PC este verano! [/quote]

Y de allí, las proridades cambiaron, la cuarta parte de HDN Neptunia va a llegar.... y Renuncié (por un rato) a reservar un FH3 Ultimate... Ya que sabía que HDN4/MDNVII NO ME IBA A FALLAR.

PD: He jugado este juego en modo fuera de linea, en un lugar sin acceso a una internet estable, así que el tiempo de juego real, ES MUCHO MAYOR

Megadimension Neptunia VII (es V2, por que es la continuación del Re;Birth 3 V Generation). Para los nuevos en esta serie, HDN se trata de versiones personificadas de las diferentes consolas hogareñas de videojuegos (las Console Patron Units [CPU's]): Neptune (Representando la cancelada Sega Neptune que combinaba la Genesis con las 2 actualizaciones de hardware, la Sega CD y la 32X), Noire (ella va por la PlayStation), Blanc (ella va por las consolas de Nintendo), y Vert (ella va por las Xbox).
En este capítulo de la serie, el lugar donde viven está pasando por una transición de generación de consolas, y las heroinas del juego, están siendo aplastadas tanto por la prensa y el púbico, como por la competencia... Mientras Neptune y Nepgear (la hermanita de la protaginizta principal) encuentran una consola abandonada, que se parece a la Sega Dreamcast (el último intento de Sega de una consola hogareña)... Y con ella, encuentran una nueva dimensión, y con ella, una nueva protagonista: Uzume Tennohboshi. Tratando de hacer el menor spoiler posible, este juego es más maduro que los Hyperdimension Neptunia anteriores, con una curva de dificultad más alta, que te exige maximizar el grindeo, el uso inteligente de ataques, EXEDrives, ítems, y leveleo... Además el tono Episódico nos hace acordar: [spoiler] Gabe, ¿Dónde Está mi Cópia de Half-Life 3 [/spoiler]


Para aquellos que ya están acostumbrados a HDN, he aquí las novedades:

[list]
    [*]Gráficos en ULTRA ALTA RESOLUCIÓN... Pero eso tiene un pero: Necesitas SÍ o SÍ una GPU Dedicada decente, y Windows en 64 bits con por lo menos 8GB de RAM instalada para que no se te crachee
    [*]Las protagonistas principales pueden pasar un escalón aún más OP que la HDD estándar: el Next Mode (y es Más OP todavía si compras el pack de armas OP del paquete Full o Full Deluxe)... Los demás personajes de la alineación estandar también pueden apañarselas solas...
    [*]CINCO, no uno o 2... 5 Paquetes de Personajes DLC's diversos y bastante potentes, si es que lo sabes administrar bien... (Peeeero, Pierdes a la Sádica safada de Plutia [La Iris Heart], la rompebarriguitas que se vuelve la "Señorita Pechotes" Peachy [La Yellow Heart], y por primera vez en un HDN principal, pierdes a la ayudante favorita de muchos, Histy).
    [*]Mejor optimización (agradécele eso a la experiencia de la vers. de PC de Fairy Fencer F, aquí tambien en Steam).
    [*]Uzume, aguerrida como ninguna.... y la Orange Heart... ¡Muy demaciado cuite para no quererla!.
    [*]Los dungeon ya no se repiten tanto como antes, además, ¡Puedes llamar a los Scouts al dungeon que quieras ir, para un farmeo menos doloroso, y entregándote un Boost de Munie y EXP en el proceso!
    [*]El Sistema Parts Break del MDN pide estrategia, ya no es pegarle con todo de frente, ciertos enemigos van a resistir tus ataques hasta que hagas el Break
    [*]Y por el Sistema Parts Break, el escudo de los enemigos se va, y el ataque Break también, ya que, seamos sinceros: [spoiler] Nadie usaba esa cosa [/spoiler]. En su reemplazo, tienes ataques híbridos entre Rushers y Powereds..
    [*]¡Por primera vez, tienes el Digital Artbook y el Soundtrack disponibles, sin tener que recurrir a la ver. de PS!.
    [*]Ambos doblajes están de lo más bien (hay algunos peros, pero no afectan el juego en demasía).
    [*]Aún pagando el paquete Digital Complete, ¡TE AHORRAS HASTA EL 70% DEL PRECIO DE LA VERSIÓN COMPLETA PARA PLAYSTATION 4! (Si te lo pillas con descuento).
    [*]La historia te llega al corazón... Los hombres normales no lloran, pero los que quieren llegar al final de este juego, lo harán sin dudarlo... [spoiler] De hecho, apunté de inmediato al Revival Ending, y terminé llorando de verdad, cómo lo hice por ejemplo en el final de Furious 7, o el final del Burial at Sea del BioShock Infinite [/spoiler].
[/list]

Veredicto: Fans de HDN... ¡A GASTAR ESOS MORLACOS, INCLUSO EN LA DIGITAL COMPLETE!... ¿Recien llegaste a este tipo de juegos?: Juega los Re;Birth anteriores, ¡Vas a quedar enganchado!... Ah y por si acaso: [spoiler]  UNOS PAÑUELOS DESECHABLES POR SI LAS DUDAS [/spoiler].

[i] Y Ahora tengo que volver a juntar plata para correr mi Lamborgini Centenario en Forza Horizon 3, ¡PERO AGUANTE NEPTUNA, NO ME IMPORTA NADA, VIEJA... de hecho, FUCK FORZA THIS TIME, MDNVII para un GOTY!	[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198055303426', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2137, 'last_played': 1468698654}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia V II is, by far, the best installment in the Neptunia series until now. 

The combat has been improved and somewhat diversified, with the addition of the "parts break" mechanic, the link formation combos and the Sharing Field battles, which require more strategic placement against certain foes. The grind was also lessened considerably, as merely exploring dungeons for items is enough to level in times of need. 

Regarding the dungeons, they are now much more interesting to explore, since they're much larger and more varied, some with areas only accessible later in the game, which can give you great rewards for exploring.
 
The soundtrack was improved DRASTICALLY with entirely new tracks, adding an intensity to the battles/scenes the past games sometimes couldn't provide.

The story was quite a nice surprise, with way more character development than the previous titles, a much larger cast of important characters, the absolute best antagonist in the entire series, three different endings and even some routed scenarios! (By the way, one of those endings *might* make you cry, just letting you know) 

Repetitive jokes such as Vert mentioning Blanc's bust size are a rare sighting now, that might be a positive or a negative point depending on the person. (I was getting tired of those, though) 

Twice as much Nep with four times more intensity. I can't see that as a negative point for anyone.

Also, Uzume. That's a big positive. 

NEXT Forms and NEXT Drives for increased flashiness and damage in battle

Memes, a lot of them. You decide whether that's good or not. 

The Scout and Crafting Systems are completely optional and won't interfere in your playthrough unless you want them to

Now, for the actual negatives. 

I would say some dungeons are bothersome to explore due to their uncomfortably large proportions and amount of rooms, making it easy to get lost. 

The combat systems, although a lot more diversified, might still be a bore for some, but it's definitely better than its predecessors, and assuming everyone reading is familiar with JRPGs and/or the Neptunia series, this point might seem unnecessary. 

A relevant amount of players are experiencing gamebreaking glitches related to their graphic cards, so there's this risk. I expect a patch to be released soon, since there've been quite a few complaints.

Overall it's a very solid title for newcomers to the series and even more so to veterans. However, I'd recommend playing the other games first (at least Re;Birth 3) since it's a direct sequel to them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043535480', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1703205663}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198062394411', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 5459, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4397, 'last_played': 1691881116}
review:
Aye hawk, thanks for getting me this game.

Megadimension Neptunia VII (Victory 2, not V7 lol) takes place in 3 dimensions (Zero Dimension, Hyperdimension and Heart Dimension)

This game was hard asf when I first began playing it, I actually played through the game without grinding, wich made it even tougher, but I still managed to get through it anyway.

As many of you may know, this game origins from the PS4, meaning you might need to get a good graphics card or other stuff, but that still didn't stop my potato from running this game pretty well (The game only crashed my pc only once, wich was just me messing around with stuff)

I'd also recommend saving alot in this game, because like I said, the game is pretty hard. (Unless you go on a 4 hour grinding spree)

But besides that, lets go over to the characters now

Neptune is still our ol lovely girl with her jokes n references.
Noire is still our loner, but hey, atleast she made a good [spoiler]yandere[/spoiler] friend in her arc
Blanc looks even cuter in this game, and her next form is aweeesssoome.
Vert her melons look even more jiggly in this game woohoo
Uzume is so cool (And her HDD form is so cute >-<)

Btw, gold third is totally a ripoff to HDD, but still, they all have their unique personalitys (*cough* And one loving a certain someone too much)

I'd say, I recommend this game, due to the fact this game has alot AND alot of references. (Like the fact the Gold Third Members are named after Bandai Namco, Konami, Capcom and Square Enix, while the sha in their names stand for Company.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198071518291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1663, 'last_played': 1602582830}
review:
Now that I've played the game more extensively, I can make an actual review. This is going to be a long one.

Now, I know that this game is supposed to be a complete overhaul of all the mechanics and elements that made the franchise brilliant. And believe me, it's an overhaul alright. The graphics are nicer, the level design is fucking brilliant compared to the Re;Birth trilogy (which is what I'm comparing it to), and the main characters are even more fleshed out than ever before, which I like. The soundtrack is nice as well; some of these tracks are actually pretty amazing.

That said, there is one major problem with this game. I... didn't have as much fun with it as I did with the Re;Birth series. I'll go through the major issues, which combined, make this game a bit lacklustre, at least to me.

- The first is the difficulty. It fucking slides about like a wet turd on a teflon floor. The first two areas of the game are nice and easy, then the enemies suddenly gain stats that are about three times as high as the ones just before. This is a ridiculous difficulty spike and it really threw me off when I first got to that third area (and I've finished the entire Re;Birth trilogy so I should be pretty good). Unfortunately, this trend continues throughout the game. Some bosses are easy, some are challenging, but then others are downright cheating (I'm looking at you, K-Sha, you multi-turn, million shots per attack shithead). The difficulty of the game flipflops like crazy throughout the whole game and it's not really fun to work around.

- The storyline is not nearly immersive or expansive enough for the story it's trying to tell. Two of the antagonists you see throughout the second part of the game, they're pretty big and important in that bit. Then at the beginning of the third chapter you just defeat them. That's it. THAT'S IT. THEY ARE SOME OF THE BEST AND MOST INTERESTING CHARACTERS AND YOU JUST... DEFEAT THEM. Yeah there's a bit of unnecessary bullshit with the whole 'NEXT' thing, but seriously? The way they portray the whole third chapter, it's like they were never threats at all. This is just one example. Blanc's route during the second chapter is 70% EXPOSITION. The remainder is just bosses and the worst areas in the entire game. There are so many issues with the story that it's barely even worth shitting on, and that's a shame, because it could have been REALLY good.

- After literally more than a dozen games, some of which are spinoffs, you'd think, you'd just THINK, that they'd bother to put more effort into their cutscenes than they do. They're identical to the cutscenes from the old games, which I find is just plain laziness more than anything else. I don't quite understand why these games take over a dozen gigabytes when the cutscenes, which take up about a third of the game in total, are just slighty animated portraits with some facial movement... and text. Just text. Admittedly there is a higher percentage of voice-acting in this one, which is great because I love the voices of the characters. It's just that they're still recycling exactly the same style and sprites for these scenes without any innovation.

- And the bosses. The fucking combat in general is a near-perfect carbon copy of any other Neptunia game, which is REALLY DISAPPOINTING. The only new mechaninc are the giant fights, of which I experienced two of them, and both of which were in the first chapter, and are never brought up again. BOOOOORIIIING. I want at least some innovation, please, is that too much to ask? But I digress. One new mechanic in the boss battles is the multiple health bars thing. BUT IT'S POINTLESS. They only exist to give a false sense of progression through a boss battle, and nothing EVER makes use of them. WHY HAVE THEM AT ALL? Some major bosses also have some quote they'll utter when they hit half health, but nothing else ever happens, so why bother? The difficulty problem also applies - some bosses are piss easy and do barely anything, while others FUCKING NUKE YOUR ASSES OFF THE PLANET. Why have bosses with nukes? That's just cheap. And don't even get me started on K-Sha.

I got the bad ending on the first run, which is good, because if I get the bad one then I like that it's because I didn't fulfil the requirements for the good one. The problem with the  bad ending is that the already short story just... stops. Abruptly, and with the whole 'we're all going to die' vibe. That whole bad end just sums up the game really. It's just that in comparison to the Re;Birth games, this is just a bit on the disappointing side.

That all being said, I still had SOME fun with it, just not as much as the old games. I can still recommend it, especially if you've not played the Re;Birth trilogy, but if you want something better, just get those.

review:
Megadimension Neptunia VII (Victory 2) is honestly the best Neptunia game I have ever played or seen.

The storyline in this game is awesome, and it introduces my favourite character in the series!

Gameplay-wise, it is similar to the Re;birth games, but has plenty of new features and mechanics. plus upgraded graphics. It looks awesome honestly!

Overall, I would class this in my top favourite games ever! Must get for fans of Neptunia, or even just this genre!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072125443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1631275532}
review:
Before you decide to buy this game,
Be aware that this game has shit compatibility with AMD cards, and even some nVidia cards,
It will flicker non stop, and has FPS issues where your FPS will be super slow, like 10-15fps.

I really like Neptunia series, bought rebirth 1 to 3 for my PSP, tried buying this on steam but, it has only given me many trouble, nobody knows how to fix the screen flickering.
And even FPS issues is hard to fix.

For your information I am using Radeon R9 390 GPU, which is equivalent to nVidia 970.
My computer spec is even better than the 'reccomanded', except for Windows 7, which is the miminum.

I tried to fix the flickering/FPS issues, and resulted in steam play time over '3hours', which is not eligible for refund. Fuck me.
Googled to check, even re:birth1 to 3 has this issues for steam.

50+ USD for a game which I have trouble playing, and gonna put it on shelf forever because of technical issues,
I will never buy these games from steam EVER again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069597169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1961, 'last_played': 1500080381}
review:
The latest game in the series improved on graphics, interface, gameplay, and added many new features and updated older features. I see that this game had way more effort put into it, at least for me, than rebirth 2 and even rebirth 3. There is a lot of content here.
There are 3 stories to play through. The characters are great. I have always liked the writing in this series which is one reason I keep coming back to the series.
I also feel like there isn't as much grinding that you have to do like in the earlier games. But having played the other games I ended up going overboard and over leveled.
Note that making in-game money for cosmetic items can be difficult if you want all the costumes and hats but if you don't care about that stuff than its alright.

If you have not played the previous games this game will explain certain characters and events of the previous games as you play.
I also loved the soundtrack in the game. Its still wierd that they don't have a much larger budget for their english voices but atleast the majority of the main quests are voiced.
The game comes with quite a bit of free dlc. The dlc bundles you can buy are not necessary as they are just op weapons and equipment. But the dlc characters are worth it.

Overall I enjoyed the game and am still enjoying and would recommend it to my friends. At least the ones who enjoy anime.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988533984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1362, 'last_played': 1621433259}
review:
The last installment of the Nep-Nep series and the first one ported form PS4!

How it all started:

- i was bored, searched for a anime game
- I found HDN U, hack'n'slash at its finest, got bored
- finally bought all 3 Re;birth games, i grinded all achievements on Re;Birth 3
- Mega Nep V2 for PS4, sad face :(
- finally got released on PC, absolutely enjoying it!

This game throws fanservice and 4th wall breaks at your face. You will laugh, trust me.

Buy this game, get nepped and your wallet is gonna be faster empty than you think!


PS: Add Plutia and Peashy as DLC playable characters. So many people missing them. :/

author: {'steamid': '76561198045859202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 689, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1469836929}

author: {'steamid': '76561198150808825', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1700534628}
review:
As an avid fan of JRPGs, particularly the Neptunia Series and Visual Novels also having to wait for thsi game's steam release since it's PS4 release more than a year ago, this is the best one yet.

It may not apeal to many people because of how long the dialogues are or how grindy it can get but that's the who point of it being a JRPG. The story is a continuation from HDN Victory/Rebirth 3: V Gen so a must buy for those after the actual story.

Gameplay wise, its been revised to a completely new mechanic while retaining the turn-based elements we have gotten used to. We must not forget the increased fanserive from our girls. The visuals have gotten a lot better considering it is a PS4 game. I have no issues with the game so far.
To make it short, if you love Neptune and wish to compete the Tetralogy then picking up this game is a must.
Needs more Noire though... 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198188582963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1523781421}
review:
作为主机党的我本着对nep的爱又买了一份pc版，终于做为评论者，来给各位-传教~进入正题（我就分剧情，画面，系统，音乐来客观的评价下吧）
 Megadimension Neptunia VII如各位所想的一样是一款偏萌豚向的srpg游戏（看标签就知道了喂）制作商为ch，
1剧情：十分有心且精致          无论是人设，世界观，人物刻画还是故事的展开都可以说下足心思，什么样的世界是被人憧憬的，什么样的人物是被人所喜欢甚至为人所爱的，这些又要怎么体现出来......这些显然都被制作者考虑在内而。       而这作的剧情也制作的十分用心，（跟上边一样，用心就是可以说是该燃的时候让你燃，该吐槽的时候让你吐槽，该感动的时候让你感动）无论是过程还是结局都令人赞叹，长度也有rb1的3倍左右，而且比较让人兴奋的是这作可以说摆脱了rb1那种完全靠卖萌而赚钱的形式，虽然对我来说剧情方面对于我心目中的神作还有差距，但就冲他不用卖萌来坑钱这一点我给10分

2画面：ch：给我足够的机能，我给你一个世界          额，在各各方面ch都很弱，但是这一代的画面实在是让人震惊，（因为和前几代对比相差十万八千米），无论是动作的流畅度，模型的精致度，还是光影的渲染都和前几作不是一个量子级，，，不过这些都与我无关，从前几作开始就可以体现出ch对于场景的想象力都是十分强的，但是psv的机能就不足以表现他们的想法，，，，，这一作是由ps4移植，ch的创造优势便体现出来，实话说有几张地图，比如带樱花的那张着实吸引住了我。（我玩什么孤岛危机3的时候只是不停的爆炸）         不过既然他是移植的就有优化这个问题，我的显卡比较好，所以没什么问题60fps测试全程没怎么掉帧偶尔卡卡可以说是竞技水平的帧率当然（我没在pc通关等以后有心情再5周目买剧情dlc还得重开，，，）但据显卡不怎么样的同学们都说优化渣，这也是一个很大的问题。希望下次能改善             画面我给8.1分   参照（显卡危机3：    8分）（我认为真正触动心灵的画面便是好画面无论是rpgmaker还是虚幻4有点跟不上国内的主流价值观那，，嘿嘿大家自己感觉就好~）

3系统：srpg老家系统相当成熟创新的地方也不少，comdo系统实在吸引人·只要你不买武器dlc就够你研究了               这句话已经把我要说的基本说完了，值得一提的是本作稍微（sang bing)的提高了难度对于rpg萌新来说难度堪比黑魂，，，（也没那么难了哈哈~）srpg中的精品7.8分（参考。守望先锋8.5分在我眼里系统的成熟与创新才是王道守望的问题i还很多那，，，）

4.音乐：棒棒哒~                 无论是游戏的音乐还是限定光碟的音乐都十分棒， 必杀音乐，变身后的音乐让我很是震惊，3篇的op也很好尤其是第3篇的op简直美爆，，，(ch围绕这一ip创造的音乐很多而且都很好有兴趣的可以从音乐网站查找）         音乐我给9.3分（参照gta电台6.8分     这个是自己的事了gta电台音乐本可以拿到很高分但是实在无法与gta本身融合以至于我想听歌还要调电台和萌新都不知道有电台这回事           综上所述我的评分标准可不止有音乐本身哦~  不过本身我也觉的海王星的分要高于gta，，，，）

于是在本人的心里这是一款高分作品比守望先锋还要高，有人一顶会问问什么和守望比因为我打剧情dlc时他们俩一直在争宠，最后nep赢了，，，，好吧还有dlc地狱大家挑dlc时一定要好好看，我推荐睡衣dlc和剧情dlc睡衣一定要买~
       测评就到这里了，希望对大家有用

author: {'steamid': '76561198216740721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 11718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11262, 'last_played': 1558801572}
review:
[h1][b]写在真结局通关和白金后的撒花——Hello, Our Cherished Dream![/b][/h1]
基本上是为了超海v2换新本本后的新评测：新本本配置为i7-6700HQ+GTX970M+8GB RAM，拿它来整1080p的全特效最高画质60fps的体验就是爽！除了个别的地方会因为读取地图或大型人物模型时的原因稍微卡下，总体运行非常流畅
游戏剧情容量丰富，编剧水平也很不错，相比起reb1、2、3微调过的战斗系统也挺有新意，总之海王星之次世代进化佳作绝对是当之无愧的！
[spoiler]其实之前人家就忍不住用i5-3210M+集显+4GB RAM的渣本本测试了下，没想到开启全低特效时也能较正常运行，虽然3D场景下肯定是幻灯片帧率没办法，2D场景下还是有差不多25fps，优化方面窝觉得其实还是不错滴～[/spoiler]
顺便人家还给了它2016年度的真·游戏之世界·世界之游戏的奖项，海王星系列迄今为止最佳作当之无愧！
不多说啦，人家继续为了ねぷねぷね耍耍耍去咯～
[h1]为2017年度“我行我素”奖的冲刺——喜欢你，没道理，尽在海王星！[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198145330392', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1469993175}
review:
This is everything that you expect of a Neptunia product and even more.
It has a great sound track, a great design, meta-breaking comedy, epic fights, and pudding. Lots of nice pudding.
Mainly for gameplay, the battles feel much more engaging and the world feels tons more alive with the route system. The giant battles and the transformation sequences feel satisfying and make you feel powerful as well, which is a massive plus.

I've been a fan of Neptunia since the release of Hyperdimension V and I thought the cast of V was it. It was their best moment and none of the side releases like U or Hyperdevotion Noire could amass to what they've accomplished. But Idea Factory and Compile Hearts delivers to impress on VII with an even BETTER cast and even more characters to love.

Who ever thought that since on release, that the dodgy original Hyperdimension Neptunia series for the PS3 would spawn such a large fanbase with such a niche but smart target audience?

I'm probably just fanwhoring at this point but I do support people buying this game and hope they can have the same enjoyment that I had with it.
Maybe for context, you would want to buy Re;Birth 3 first, but as a standalone, VII can be lovable as well.

NepNep/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198209817584', 'num_games_owned': 63, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2088, 'last_played': 1473217644}
review:
When the reviews are saying "this is the Best Neptunia game yet" they are not giving double talk, this is the real deal.

If you were a fan of any of the previous games in the series, then you will enjoy this game, if you like anime and JRPG tropes this is game will be right up your alley.


Unlike other releases on Steam, instead of being a VITA port his is a port of the ps4 game proper so check your system specs, I had to personally upgrade my graphics card to a Geforce 750 ti, was worth it as I was also experience graphics issues with other games.

If you enjoy anime and all the cliches that come with it, this is the game of all those concepts incarnate in game form.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039738770', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 5482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3187, 'last_played': 1506544444}
review:
Megadimension is the best part of the Neptunia Series to date.

Pros:

- Great soundtrack
- Great storyline
- Great reference to other games like the Gold Third represents Square Enix, Konami etc.
- Every goddess has her own short storyline
- the right amount of serious moments
- Its the first game after Rebirth 2 Uni plays an actual role in
- 50% new enemys and dungeons

Contra:

- the other 50% are recycled dungeons and colour swapped enemy types from previous games
- You cant play with the character you like the most, the game force you 90% of the story to use certain party members
- Verts new voice actress, its no longer Tara Platt
- a little bit to much "Fan Service", even Nepgear shows her butt

For me who like the neptunia games for the characters, storyline and references its a realy good game. I think the ohhh anime girls, butts and breasts faction is pleased as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038672985', 'num_games_owned': 121, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 4172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4172, 'last_played': 1468477874}
review:
여러모로 발전한 모습을 보인다.
포메이션 시스템이란 게 생겨 합동 이그제 드라이브와 달리 포메이션 공격으로 강력한 공격을 주는 게 가능해졌다.
변신씬도 전작까지는 그냥 빛 한번 번쩍하고 변신 끝! 이라는 느낌이었지만 이번에는 좀 자세하게 보여준다.
퀘스트도 목표가 있는 던전을 표시해줌으로서 퀘스트 클리어를 위해 어느 던전을 공략해야 하는지 일일히 살펴볼 수고성이 줄어들었다.
무엇보다 영차원,초차원,심차원 3개의 편으로 나눠져 있어 전작들과 달리 큰 볼륨을 보여준다.
특히 초차원편에서는 4여신인 넵튠,느와르,블랑,벨 4명의 스토리를 각각 따로 다루는 세밀함도 보여주었다.
다만 단점도 보이는데 전작과 달리 맵에서 이동을 하려면 루트를 이용해야 한다.
그런데 이 루트라는 게 그냥 있는 것도 아니고 가끔 몬스터가 나오는데 귀찮기 짝이 없다.
왜 멀쩡하게 잘 움직이던 걸 버리고 루트라는 걸 넣었는지 의문이다.
또한 PS4 기반이라 그런지 약간의 버벅거림이 존재한다. 이벤트씬은 문제 없으나 던전의 경우 약간의 버벅거림이 존재하는 걸로 보인다.
그리고 이건 나만 겪는 문제가 아닌 걸로 보이는데 간혹 그래픽 하드웨어 문제로 게임이 강제 종료되는 경우가 있는 듯하다. 단순한 컴 사양에 의한 문제인지 게임 자체의 문제인진 모르겠지만 후자라면 하루 빨리 고쳐지길 바란다.
결론을 말하자면 꽤 게임 같아졌다. 클리어 데이터를 이어서 할 때도 자신이 원하는 것만 이어서 하는 게 가능해졌다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075001079', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1784, 'last_played': 1487323255}
review:
一周目完结··二周目白金攻略中。三周目白金GET。完整版赛高~泳装大法好。noire我老婆！noire我老婆！noire我老婆！
  《新次元海王星Ⅶ》的画面并没有让人失望，同前几代相比这一代子在许多方面都得到了加强和改善。首先是人物立绘上面，每个人物都会有一个呼吸的动态效果，这对于以视觉小说进行剧情的游戏来说无疑增加了逼真程度。另一方面本作在战斗场景中的画面也有所改善，虽然近看还是一如既往的满是颗粒感，但是无论是人物模型还是背景效果都有大幅度改善提高。画面8分。画质UPUP和一些细节处理比之前好多了。
  超大BOSS的设定十分带感啊~打起来手感也不错。nextfrom变身好评如潮。游戏操作上7分。
  游戏也分了零次元海王星Z，超次元海王星G，心次元海王星H三篇。较之前作品多了许多新元素。但是我突然发现篇章之间钱貌似是不继承的~你这是搞事啊朋友。剧情8分.总算不是单纯卖萌了。
  音效上萌豚福音，うずめ的三种声线好评w。CV阵容依旧屌炸。可惜没我兵库北的iris  heart。P.S。地铁站环境音效绝对是音效的最大败笔没有之一。音效9-2分。背景音乐不错。CV阵容强大。地铁环境扣2分

  游戏性上比起之前的无脑莽增加了【些许】难度。当然DLC逆天还是海王星的一贯特色。
  总的来说。玩了海王星，身体一天比一天虚弱了。不说了、白金预定。接着肝去了。
  
 P.S。对话中听出来了好多梗啊。比如0079阿姆罗的连我爸都没打过我。还有0079夏亚的经典台词。还有NEP每次突入BOSS说的：通往未来的领航员就让我neptune担当.00剧场版Mr.不洗澡的梗。编剧你是多喜欢高达啊。

author: {'steamid': '76561198177309250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 16195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8987, 'last_played': 1493155871}
review:
這作的遊戲系統比以往的容易好多
但百合度過份容易提升,可以讓些少難度嗎....?
畢竟玩過前兩作不多不少都了解劇情和內容
地圖方面都是有好多是重複使用,但怪又增加不少奇奇怪怪的
音樂方面還可以接受,但IF&Compa模根本是重用移植的,換個新模好嗎??

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198024129564', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 5120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4417, 'last_played': 1649519164}
review:
Самая лучшая игра от IF

Сравнивать с реберфами будет аналогично если сравнивать Небо и Землю

3 Арки с приличной продолжительностью и отличным сюжетом.

Боевка улучшенна до максимума, стало удобно использовать скилы, Exe атаки, кооп атаки. Переделана система комбо его продолжительность зависит от оружия а также скилы теперь нельзя повторять.

Теперь игра не будет давать кучу персонажей заставляя игрока выбирать своих любимцев в первое время вы будите прыгать от одних персонажей к другим позволяя поиграть всеми (под конец все персонажи будут доступны)

Схватки с огромными боссами добавили новую механику в игру

Имеется миниигра - пародия на Спелункера, пытаетесь пройти данж прыгая по платформам избегая ловушек жизни ограничены так что все не так просто.

Очень порадовали новые "Некст формы" играя за них чувствуешь значительную силу

Убрана надоедливая Стелла и добавленны Скауты
Скауты - это огромное количество персонажей которых мы можем отправлять по данжам и они будут приносить деньги, предметы, других скаутов а также открывать новые данжи и врагов. Еще при отправки в ту или иную локацию они дают бонус на нее (аналогично мечам в Fairy fencer F)

Думаю это можно отнести ко всей серии но разные отсылки, даже мелкие и ломание 4 стены делают оч забавной :D

Саунтрек как во всех играх Иффи 10/10

Получить тру концовку не так трудно, а после ее получения как и в 3 реберфе дается полностью открытый мир с тремя измерениями и новыми испытаниями)
Покупайте не думая ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561198012475603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1204, 'last_played': 1485726551}
review:
Megadimension Neptunia V.2 is probably the best game out of the series, probably because it is the newest and they improve.

Gameplay: 
10/10
There are actually jumping platforms now? Hell yes.
Is it worth getting the extra characters like God Eater-chan? Hell yes.
The GUI looks pretty outstanding in terms of matching the game's theme.
Japanese VA is always on point, subtitles are somewhat accurate but make you laugh sometimes.
The amount of references this game has towards other anime/games is too damn high.

Art:
10/10 Tsunako needs to draw more Noire.

Music:
10/10 Soundtracks are hype.

Character Development:
Well, Nep did develop if you know what I mean.

This game is so good, I would f*ck pudding while having spoons attached to my eyes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022632322', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1434, 'last_played': 1498929274}
review:
Really recommend this game. Maybe more than I would Fallout 4, with all the DLCs in mind and even with the replayability factor against it.
Idea Factory has done it. This is the best Neptunia game of all, and the performance of this title on a PC beats the PS4 performance (keep in mind that PS4 doesn't actually run 1080p, it's upscaled 900p). 

There's a caveat however. Slowtown occurs when random battle happens at world screen. There's also memory leak management that needs to be improved.

A controller is highly recommended if you want to play this game. Both Dualshock 4 and Xbox one controller work nicely with it.

*The game may not run to full potential on laptop as it defaults to windowed mode. Manually set profile for Neptunia VII to performance mode solves this issue. 
**Read http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=720156292 if you wish to set the resolution above 1080p. You need a hex editor but it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098762030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2319, 'last_played': 1470631513}
review:
Nitroplus (DLC, I know.) is literally the best thing for me since I loved the Visual Novel she's (mostly) based off of.
It must suck seeing the enitre world as meat/organ-based entities and your only lover looks like that to everyone else, yet to them they look human.
I wonder what it's like to be in bed of one of those things.
I could ask the Visual Novel it's based of off...
Saya no Uta? (Song of Saya)
Yeah, you guys should read it.
I hear people dubbed it too.
Gave that VN a 10/10 myself personally.

Oh right; this is a Neptune game review.
Right...
Yeah mostly everything gets better with every subsequent game.
So if you like it, you'll like it. If you don't like it, that's okay.
No one ever said Neptune was for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029849756', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1468058335}
review: I bought this game because of the overwhelmingly positive reviews. Upon closer inspection, it seems the vast majority of those 300 positive reviews were fake/bought by the developer. If you read enough of them you will see the same few ideas repeated over and over again in a slightly different way. The story and dialogue are as long and time consuming as they are terrible (EXTREMELY). I played three hours and spent like 2 of those hours reading text. When you do get to play the combat offered no challenge whatsoever. The leveling gives no customization choices, simply get a new skill and stats boost. I could go on and on like this but try the game yourself and you will see how bad it is. Nevermind $32 on sale, I wouldn't play this game for free, and am requesting a refund. If my refund is denied, I will never play it again. DELETED. I especially find the use of fake positive reviews infuriating and feeling like my time was wasted and my money stolen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101247248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1468088640}
review:
Here is some pro and cons of Megadimension Neptunia VII. Note that this review is based on PS4 version and I believe that there are no differences between the PC version:

Pro
----
+ Uzume (no seriously - possibly no 1 reason). Her gap moe is something!!!
+ Umio.
+ Adult Neptune and Neptune combi!
+ Megami 2nd form!!
+ Scout system now easier to understand - unlike Victory.
+ Brought back the original Neptunia features - Break obstacles!
+ LARGER DUNGEON!!!
+ EXE drive does not carry over to the next battle (yeah! more challenging!!). No more cheap EXE spam!
+ Enemies has breakable parts! (Now positioning characters makes more sense!).
+ One of the few games that I need to utilise buff skill!!!!! (Kudos, challenge 5 star).
+ G dimension lets you fully utilise each megami individually! No more picking fav yo! (at least in G dimension)
+ More suspense and refined storyline! (Just play until the end)
+ THE BGM!!!
+ Each weapon have fixed preset of Rush, Power and Standard. No more cheap spam attack.
+ Positioning during battle to activate party skill!!! POSITIONING!!!
+ Lily system now does not require mandatory 2 party member to coupling front and back!!! (HELL YEAH!!!)
+++++ Fanservice

Meh
-----
?? HDD drive transformation eats nation shares... I prefer it to be like MK2 where it gradually eats SP overtime instead...
?? Where are the Oracles???
?? Where are Mages?? 5pb?? RED?? Falcom?? Etc.
?? Where are Pururut and Peashy???
?? Still... same old boring dungeon. No innovation...
?? Personally I prefer Stella’s ☆ Dungeon over scout system... faster and easier.
?? EXE skill and SP skill is under one window and not in different command (just personal preference).
?? Battle in Sharing Field felt limited... only allows player to use skill and not normal attack. Game dev should improvise it in the future.
?? Route building felt unnecessary. Instead, why not making the routes as a full explorable map instead of route point?
?? I notice a bit of lagging when compared to PS4 counterpart. I have a quite decent gaming PC rig with Radeon 7970 though...
?? I'm not a fan of the Challenge mode though... too much time wasted.

Cons
-----
- If Megami KO in battle == ate large chunk of nation shares... WAT!!?? THIS IS PUNISHING!!!
- Scout exploration outcome heavily random... detecting hidden treasure waste a lot of time even in NG+ which makes...
- NO HIDDEN TREASURE SCAN ABILITY!!! WHY DID YOU REMOVE THIS??
- ORNAMENTS BECOME ACCESSORIES!!??? WHAT?? (Now only Armors, Idea Chip and weapon give increased stat...) OH PULEEEZZZ!!!

Overall
--------
I still believe MK2 (the PS3 version - not Rebirth:2) battle system is slightly better than the other main Neptunia titles, as MK2 utilising both AP and SP system approriately. However overall, Megadimension Neptunia VII delivers better content as well as gradual improvement over its predecessors. As a Neptunia fan, there are no dissatisfaction in playing this. I give this game a solid, umio out of seaman!!

Should you buy it? Hell yeah!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198043825146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1554038081}
review:
Bought with all DLC (I don't have too much time to grind). A bit tone-changed for the series. I kinda like the dungeon map music in Zero dimension (at the beginning), feels little bit grim and desperated. Quite a changed but it's really good. Overall music still great as usual.

Overall, great to play, not so magnificient, controls is a bit changed (two or three buttons, i believe) but still great and still nep as usual (I still ranked Rebirth 3 as the best, cause HanaKana ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) ). Dashboard Information also a little bit better. Also, runs a little bit better/fluid than all previous game (don't sure for previous game that it has the Anti-aliasing options, but this one has, which is nice).

PS. Nepgya best gurl.  ¯\_( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)_/¯

author: {'steamid': '76561198013194255', 'num_games_owned': 757, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 1776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1254, 'last_played': 1479827279}
review:
期待这个游戏很久了，之前的内测也参加了，终于上Steam马上就入了

本作在各种方面都改进了不少
画面，战斗系统，音乐
故事背景定在次世代主机还没大规模上市，前时代主机市场衰落的时代（Steam崛起的时代笑)
比起愉快欢脱的前三部，本作的故事情节上要沉重不少，这点从开始画面就能看出来。。。
之前历代的菜单界面都是用欢快的背景BGM，唯独这次的音乐则是用的相对悲壮一些的BGM
不过嘛。。。有捏噗在再沉重的故事也会变欢脱
还有就是终于有完整的女神变身动画了！之前的圣光变身简直反人类啊！

另外本作的音乐制作相当出色，很贴合气氛，不少地方甚至用上了交响乐和人声来烘托气氛，要比RB123公用OST的电子乐高出好几个档次。

即便不是萌豚应该也能愉快的玩这一作。

[spoiler]“其实零次元篇讲的是一位迷途的少女和心爱的恋人的悲剧啊”[/spoiler]

DLC能让初期便轻松一点，入不入看自己期望了
增加角色就当塞钱吧，不过推荐豪华版，因为带OST和设定本

author: {'steamid': '76561198037003719', 'num_games_owned': 4057, 'num_reviews': 385, 'playtime_forever': 2536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2471, 'last_played': 1561552023}
review:
《戰機少女》系列最新作《Megadimension Neptunia VII》正式於今年七月五號從 PS4 主機平台移植至家用電腦平台，此篇評論是以電腦版本為基準且不包含完整 DLC 內容介紹。本作破天荒將遊戲主線劇情分成三大章節，分別是零次元、超次元、心次元，玩家進入遊戲所接觸的第一章節【零次元】訴說著 Sega 家用主機 Dreamcast 之殞落，對手 Playstation 擁有 Dreamcast 所缺乏的 RPG 大作，加上 Sony 於千禧年正式在日本地區販售 Playstation 2 ，給予 Dreamcast 無情的最後一擊， DC 世代正式結束。女主人翁『紺紫之心』涅普迪努和『女神候補生』涅普姬雅不小心誤闖異次元，巧遇掌管零次元的女神『橙色之心』天王星烏茲梅，三人同心協力要擊敗來者不善的黑暗女神，拯救即將消逝的零次元國度。


第二章節【超次元】所講述的故事跟你我息息相關，單機遊戲已經無法滿足消費者需求，手遊課金遊戲迅速發展引起遊戲業界動亂，被黃金之力擊敗的四國度女神失去了人民的信仰，掌控黃金之力的神祕少女 B-Sha、C-Sha、S-Sha、K-Sha 成為遊戲業界新統治者，不過生活在遊戲業界的居民們並不快樂，少數人心中仍存有對四女神的記憶與信仰，故事也將從四女神視角出發，目的是要取得國度統治權。看到這裡，大家是否發現神祕少女們的名字就是在暗喻日本四大手遊大廠：萬代南夢宮、卡普空、史克威爾艾尼克斯、以及惡名昭彰的柯拿米，黃金之力也是暗諷『打不贏嗎？多課一些錢吧！』的課金文化，人們漸漸忘記玩遊戲的初衷，變成手遊大廠眼中的肥羊，誰來支持堅持研發單機遊戲的廠商呢？

超次元章節還另外新增了拓展路線、都市投資、見聞者等全新功能，區域之間的移動是用地雷踩格方式進行，想要進入新地城必須要花費金錢拓展路線；而都市投資項目細分為商業、工業、公民關係三種，商業投資等級提升可以在商店內購買更多種類商品，工業投資等級提升可以研發更多種類道具，公民關係投資等級提升會觸發事件，除了能獲得道具獎勵以外，還有機會讓見聞者加入你的團隊；見聞者功能讓玩家能派出見聞者去地城探索，不僅能使玩家在地城探險時獲得增益效果，每隔一段時間見聞者還會從地城帶回素材喔！


戰鬥系統方面跟前作沒有太大區別，同樣是以連續技為主、技能為輔的作戰風格，透過連段攻擊累積 EXE Drive 氣槽，同時消耗氣槽使出強力必殺技或是獲得女神變身效果，較大的改動是取消了【Break】破防技，取而代之的是部位破壞系統，玩家在戰鬥時破壞怪物特殊部位會使對方防禦下降，同時還有機會獲得額外素材獎勵。順帶一提，當玩家進展到【超次元】章節後期時，更會開啟【女神二段變身】能力，從名稱和外觀來看可以明顯發現，女神們透過二段變身成為次世代主機，除了外觀有明顯改變外，戰力更大幅提升。

遊戲前期難度較高，主要是因為加入隊伍角色過少，補品攜帶數量從 99 降為 30，角色升級也不會自動回滿血量，只能離開地圖回到據點補血，種種設定都讓未購買 DLC 的玩家吃盡苦頭，金錢不足無法取得補品只好先農怪賺錢，要去農怪又發現同等級的怪物血量傷害都偏高，只好回到低等地城苦蹲。還好到了超次元章節後，人物等級提升到三十左右，遊戲整體節奏快了許多，怪物不再硬得跟石頭一樣，頭目雖然還是一樣強大，但不至於會到被三招秒殺的程度，簡單來說本作屬倒吃甘蔗類型的作品，熬過前期後面會輕鬆許多。


為什麼會特別跳過第三章節【心次元】劇情介紹，《Megadimension Neptunia VII》不像是系列前作，主線劇情清楚明瞭跟你說誰就是反派，這次的敵方勢力比較特殊，反派真面目要在故事最後才會顯現出來，太詳細介紹心次元章節會因為劇情透漏影響到遊戲體驗。《戰機少女》系列作一直以來都是粉絲取向，專門以人物設定為主要賣點的日系角色扮演遊戲，先不管遊戲性好壞，光是作中反映真實遊戲業界的史實捏他，就讓熟知遊戲發展史的玩家們激動不已，所以本作是一款值得一試的好遊戲嗎？答案是肯定的。


優點：
+主線劇情分為三大章節，見證 DC 興衰史、課金手遊崛起等史實捏他。
+女神二段變身系統，次世代主機已上市多時，女神當然也要次世代化。
+舊酒不只換新瓶，拓展路線、都市投資、見聞者等全新功能等你體驗。


缺點：
-令人無法直視的海量 DLC 商法，建議大家單獨購買角色擴充包即可。
-遊戲前期難度非常不人性化，可能會造成耐心不足的玩家直接棄坑。


結論：值得用心體會的戰機少女新作，遊玩總時數堪稱是系列作之最。


網誌圖文好讀版：
http://mgrim214.blogspot.tw/2016/07/megadimension-neptunia-vii.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198152870785', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1509758539}
review:
谢谢这款游戏
目前我只玩了3小时，发觉BGM，画面什么的变化很大，画风也有一些细节的变化。
对于这3小时的游戏体验，发现游戏在对于新萌点进行了许多探索。
UZUME是有3条不同的声线，每个性格都有许多变化。但是，萌点是在于人物塑造而非反差萌。
另外我认为游戏在开始阶段略微沉重，有时是在刻意卖萌，这点不够出色。

****但我暂时并未深入游戏，现在我对于游戏的了解过少，总体而言
1.游戏有足够的新意和画质提升。
2.场景丰富不少，在对话中的动作以及表情变化非常丰富。
3.优化有点不够给力。
4.暂时评分8.8/10

PS.等了很久的海王星了，总体还是要谢谢这个游戏带来的欢乐。

NEP~

author: {'steamid': '76561198071982991', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2437, 'last_played': 1537370994}
review:
从未坚持玩JRPG这么久，怎么说呢，本人是个没耐心看外语的人，英语简直让我崩溃，而日语更加看不懂了（汉化懒得打）。不过不得说，这游戏虽然花了我至少15-20%时间用于翻译剧情，不过这剧情线给了我不少动力玩下去（Re:birth1/2/3都还没过呢= =)。
  剧情是不错，游戏系统变化也蛮有意思的额，刚开始因为英语折腾不少时间去搞懂，里面的特色连击还是要下不少功夫去研究，不过技能的杀伤效果比我想得强多了。至于EXE系统改进个人觉得没啥实感。
  至于画面，总觉得优化做的还是不够完善，移植了这么多部游戏优化的水平不也应该可以了么- -，为何不再做得更好一些呢。。
  总而言之，这个游戏，绝对是不该错过的。写下这篇测评的我一周目还没过，但在此强烈建议不要开DLC道具，不然挑战性简直变成零，变成割草了（仅个人意见）。想单纯娱乐的话，一周目也可以开DLC人物，反正大多数也要在第二篇章才能得到她们（除了两个人)，不过依旧强烈建议也是不开DLC人物，不然会失去策略性。(你想想2个人的skill和4个人的skill效果，这差距23333)
  好了，该继续去打BOSS了（笑）。

author: {'steamid': '76561198111807805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 72579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1512737120}
review:
I have cleared all the Hyperdimension Neptunia ReBirth series (1,2,3) and U aswell, and thats why i can say and i will say that this game is THE BEST COMPARED TO ANY HYPERDIMENSION NEPTUNIA SERIES!
 THE GRAPHICS! THE SOUNDTRACK! THE STORY! IS SO F***ING DAMN GREAT!!!!

*This is my review about this game (my english isnt perfect. so im sorry if there is a rip grammar in this review T_T) And if u want to read a better review i’ll give you the link in the end of this review 

[h1]About this game[/h1]
This is a sequel of Hyperdimension Neptunia Re Birth 2 and 3, but if u didnt play Re Birth 2 and 3 its ok, because the story isnt really related to that both game. And if u ask why i didnt say if this game is sequel of Re Birth 1 because Re Birth 1 is a story about different dimension (SuperDimension)
There is so much improvement to this game, such as battle system, animations, and grapics. The story is absoultely great as well. And you know what? This game is [strike]better than Infinite Bullsh*t or Doom or even GTA VI[/strike] *ehem, i mean its better than tetris.

[h1]Pros[/h1]

[b]1st[/b], Something that is common (many people already know)
+New Battle System/Features
+Next Form
+3 Dimension’s Story
+New Dungeon mini-game

[b]2nd[/b], Additional
+Animations improvement
+60 FPS
+WITHIN THE POWER OF NEXT GENERATION, THE JIGGLE  ARE REAL!!! EVEN BLANC’S CHEST CAN JIGGLE!!! HOLY SHIT!! ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°) ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)
+Best Graphics in Hyperdimension Neptunia Game (ofc, this is Next-Gen Nep afterall :>)
+So Many New Great Soundtrack
+Many New Dungeons
+4th Wall Joke
 
[b]3rd[/b], Something that i really like
+ADULT NEPTUNE!!!!!! (≧v≦)
+MORE NEPTUNE AND NEPGEAR!!! (≧v≦)

[h1]Cons[/h1]
-Histoire became adult ヽ(≧Д≦)ノ

[h1]Story[/h1]
I will just write the main of the story, so there will be no spoiler for the details :>
1.) Zero Dimension
This is a world that neptune and nepgear found and its on the brink of collapse. In here you will meet uzume (orange heart) and ADULT NEPTUNE, and you will fight the dark CPU together
2.) Hyper Dimension
There is a CPU Shift Period in this dimension, and there is a group called “Gold Third” that wants to be a new ruler of HyperDimension,.
3.) Heart Dimension
Zero Dimension chara, Hyper Dimension chara, Gold Third became one to fight the enemy

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Well the conclusion is... [Spoiler]BUY THIS GAME!!!!!!!![/Spoiler]
And this is the link for the other good review :
tech-gaming.com/megadimension-neptunia-vii-pc/

author: {'steamid': '76561198078909392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1525497946}
review:
Note: If using a controller, be sure to map right trigger to positive ROT (by clicking right trigger when mapping). This will fix your menu navigation issue.

The game is essentially part VN part Dungeon crawler. If you like the past games, this is definitely the best in my opinion, length and mechanically speaking.
The VN part is great, dialog is quirky, and Nep-nep being self aware never gets old. The dungeon crawler part is pretty good as well, nothing spectacular, but the combos and move done are a blast.

Overall 9/10 would nep again

author: {'steamid': '76561198093711899', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 4916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1563693125}
review:
Lemme just have y'all know that I could have easily just whipped out the PS4 version of Nep VII and simply played the game on that. But no. I bought this game again, along with all it's character DLC, on the PC, just to show Compile Heart and Idea Factory that the Neptunia series is one of the best thing that they have ever created. 

The game itself is pretty good, and serves as a great entry point for newcomers to the series. The only thing you'll be missing for not playing the previous games will be a few random references relating to them. They added a ton of fancy new gameplay elements, but it's still the same Nep formula, so those who have actually played the other Nep games won't feel alienated in the slightest. In fact, almost all of the additions are vast improvements from the other Nep games, making this game probably the best Nep game in the series thus far.

This game is actually crazy complex, so I'm not going to delve too deep into things. If you want to know more about this game, then go read some other review, or actually buy the game. The game comes with tutorials. Read them. Seriously though, it's a good game. Everything you need to know is explained as you play along, from the combat to the storyline. The only noteworthy flaw is that on lower end PCs, don't expect this game to peak at more than 20 FPS at any point. IF and Compile Heart really decided to jack up the graphics, given that this is a PS4 game, and all the previous Nep games were either PS3 or PSVITA games. Seriously though, having a GTX 960 as a reccommended requirement is pretty intense for a JRPG, even if it's a PS4 game. Other than that, the gameplay is solid, and I would recommend this to anyone who is a Nep fan, or really just likes JRPGs in general. The art is drawn by Tsunako, and it looks fantastic The gameplay and story are also both amazing. Also, the guy who voiced Umio also voiced Aizen from Bleach, which I find to be absolutely hilarious and amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119999579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1321, 'last_played': 1597458951}
review:
The best among the rest of the Neptunia series. Although its not necessary to play thru the previous series, there are some references in the game that relates to the previous series. 
The game has a lot of features borrowed from Fairy Fencer such as item development, unlocking ranks for quests, sound effects and the scouts giving effects to the dungeons. The combo system has been greatly enhanced and thought out. 
Still half way thru the game, but i am really enjoying it. Much more expensive than the previous series at launch but for the content, it is definitely worth it. If you think this will be another Neptunia game like the previous series you will be mistaken.

Definitely worth it for the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046448320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1498683910}
review:
[b]** MINOR SPOILERS! HEAVY SPOILERS ARE COVERED! READ THE SPOILERS AT YOUR OWN RISK  **[/b]

Im memory of my CS knife. RIP

You might've already guess it: Yes, I am a big fan of the HDN franchise. I mean, right now I am having a Green Heart profile picture. But that doesn't mean I always am a blind follower of the decisions IF made about gameplay! I always have to critizise SOMETHING a game is not doing well, or at least not at its best. While it was a..."different" gameplay in HDN 1 (not talking about the Re;births here!) or monotonicity reagrding enemy models/dungeons in Victory, this game was another attendant to be critizisied!...Except I actually don't have to critizise that much which is just...wow.

I need to mention that I have been playing this game a lot on my PS4. 100+ hours

I am structuring my review this way:
[b] 1. Story [/b]
[b] 2. Gameplay [/b]
[b] 3. HDN-worthyness? [/b]
[b] 4. Performance on PC [/b]
[b] 5. Conclusion [/b]

[h1] Story (9.8/10) [/h1]

Our heroine Neptune buzzes off in the park again just to find a mysterious console in a dark, shady alley. And why the heck so ever, the console can talk! After bringing that console to Nepgear, the Nepsters(The Nep-sisters) turn on the console!...just to be sucked into a vortex which leads our dear Nepsters into a different location (Either after progressing through the story just reading the title screen after pressing "new game", you'll know it's the Zerodimension) .
Immediantly afterwards you'll find Uzume Tennouboshi, a VERY important character (telling by the hype or just LOOKING AT THE GOD DAMN SCREENSHOTS OF THE GAME).
So...what actually happened? Why? Can the Nepsters go back to their home? Who is this Uzume? Why is there smoke around her in one of the pics on the storepage? Why am I asking so many questions? And can we get Neptune some god damn pudding please?

All of these questions (well, at least most of them) will be answered while playing the game!
...at least the first chapter.
Yes, you read right: First chapter!
This game offers us a total of 3 chapters which is just magnificent! Each of them plays in different locations which I will be covering briefly ([b] if you dare to read some spoilers [/b])
[spoiler] The first chapter is obviously the Zero dimension: In this one you will mainly find out stuff about Uzume and how the Nepsters are able to get back to the Hyperdimension
The second chapter covers a big scandal in the Hyperdimension: After losing a fight (which you can't win anyways), the whole Hyperdimension changed! Not only a bit, everybody seems to have forgotten who our precious goddesses are!
The third chapter is, what I like to call it, the big f***fest of f***ing your brain because this is where most of your questions are being answered! [/spoiler]

[h1] Gameplay (8.5/10) [/h1]

Remember me saying I critizised the gameplay of the previous games a lot? Well, I did aswell in MDN VII...the thing is that [b] there isn't really much to hate about it [/b].
It is like they took the best aspects of the games and put them into MDN VII while removing the stuff people hated!
Where do I start...the combat system has been kinda revamped: You can only walk in a limited, circle shaped area (MK2). Attacking while fulfilling certain conditions (combo trait) gives the reward of dealing more damage.  Even which attacks you can use is determined by the weapon your character wields. Sword A allows you to have 3 power slots, but only 1 rush and 2 standard while sword B offers 5 rush, but only 1 power and 1 standard slot + no stacking of attacks, [b] TACTIC FOLKS [/b].
Quick explaination:
Rush attacks are attacks with many hits but rather low damage, ideal for filling up the EXE gauge.
Power attacks are strong attacks which aren't good at filling up the EXE gauge but do their job when having to deal a lot of damage with normal attacks.
Standard attacks are a mixture between rush and power.
Skills aren't op anymore and EXE attacks are weaker than in the previous games, meaing they aren't an instant win if your EXE gauge is filled up. But for compansation reasons we get more skills for our characters and the socalled "formation skills". Simply put: Certain formation, same state (HDD or no HDD...that's the question), certain characters, ???, profit!
Coupling skills, lily skills...while it may seem like a small amount of things I listed, trust me: It's A LOT while playing, and I didn't even cover everything!

There are only 3 things I didn't like about MDN VII regarding gameplay:
[list]
 [*] [b]Missing GP.[/b] 
I actually enjoyed the GP system due to the fact that it made me plan when to strike: Since the GP points recharge when depleted, a full frontal attack with every character when the points are depleted was the opportunity to deal massive damage. It made me think to even attack the enemy if he has a few GP points left or to just buff myself and prepare for the later phase of a fight.
Sadly it's not in MDN VII. But well, many people didn't like it so it is reasonable to remove.
 [*] Grinding not really needed.
 I tend to grind a lot. My rule of thumb was "each chapter requires 10 levels" (previous games). Now it's just enough to gain 2-3 levels when the enemies are too difficult.
 [*]Monotonicity regarding enemies.
While expanding the dungeons to be bigger and even using a lot of different looks of the dungeons themselves, one things sadly mostly remained the same: The frequency of seeing the same enemy model with the difference of being reskined/in a different colour. It isn't bothering, it'd just be cool if they'd not look the same.
[/list]

Overall: SOLID gameplay, minor downsides

[h1] HDN-worthyness? (10/10) [/h1]

I will keep this part short: DEFINETLY.
The story just somehow [i] feels [/i] like Hyperdimension yet it doesn't! It's a welcome mix of ideas for the HDN franchise. But otherwise?
Yes, the humour is just...neppy. Neptune's being Nep again, Vert and Blanc when talking about [i] the upper part of the torso [/i], Noire's being Noire, Uzume's being a VERY interesting, creepy, funny person...Talking about the other characters would blast my review.
Play the game yourself. You'll feel like home if you know the HDN-feeling.


[h1] PC-performance (8.5/10) [/h1]

Overall the performance of the game is good. Looks like the PS4 version.

Would be great if I wouldn't have to critizise something: Game kind of has to load a bit when starting to play it (when engaging into a fight after booting the game). I don't mind it but some people might be bothered
Update 4.8.2016:
Tested the game for the frame drops today, no drops (only when "L2-ing"(skipping) fights). Highered the points this section gets.
[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Magnificent, brilliant game. It really feels like the developers took their time, money and effort to make the game better in almost every possible there is! I really tried to find things that concerned me about the game...but there aren't many. And even the things that bothered me were rather minor.

[h1] 9.4/10 [/h1]

PS: I didn't buy any DLC and I don't intend to buy any. DLCs make the game too easy (imo) and prefering my games to be challenging makes me not buy them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071435415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1644, 'last_played': 1667824886}
review:
ในที่สุดก็มาถึงวันที่ Nep Nep VII เราก็ลง PC สักทีอดใจรอมานานแสนนาน (กะจะจัด ps4 มาเล่นเลยตอนแรก) เกมนี้ค่อนข้างจะเพลินเลยทีเดียวกับ CG 3D + เสียงตัวละครอันน่ารัก เกมค่อนข้างที่จะสวยเลยทีเดียว 
*แนะนำสำหรับคนมีเวลาว่าง หรือ หาอะไรทำ เพราะตัวเกมค่อนข้างจะทำอะไรเยอะมาก
- ภาคนี้จะแบ่งเป็นเนื้อเรื่อง 3 เนื้อเรื่อง โดยจะมี Zero,Gold,Heart 
   *ตรง Gold จะมีรูททั้ง 4 ให้เราเล่นโดยมี Neptune,Noire,Blanc,Vert
      *โดยเนื้อเรื่องทั้งจะเชื่อมโยงกัน เราสามารถเล่นรูทไหนก่อนก็ได้
- CG 3D เช่นเดิม + ภาพอันสวยกว่าเดิมที่กินเครื่อง
   *แต่ในเกมค่อนข้างพอทมาดี มีให้ปรับลดหรือเพิ่มกราฟิคภาพ
     *แต่เฟรมบางการ์ดจออาจจะตกลงมา (ถึงแม้จะใหม่ๆ) (รอแก้เอง)
- กินเวลาตามสไตล์เกม JRPG
     * การเก็บเวล หาของ ดู CG เคลียอะไรต่างๆ ฯลฯ
-  ลูกเล่นเกมเป็นแนว turn-base 
     *ภาคนี้ได้เพิ่มระบบแผนที่ใหม่ที่ดูดีกว่าเดิม
       *มีระบบสำรวจเพื่อให้รับบัพสำหรับแมพที่สำรวจ
         *ระบบหาของเพื่อทำของ และ ทำแบบของสำหรับเพิ่มเข้า shop ทำให้เราซื้อของใหม่ได้
           *ระบบกิล สำหรับทำเศวสตั้งแต่ระดับ E - S RANK โดย ภารกิจต่างๆจะมีรางวัลให้
- เอาเป็นว่าเอาไป 9/10 เลย (ตัด 1 เพราะ Nep จังเล่นมุขถี่เกิน T^T)

author: {'steamid': '76561198062772366', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1779, 'last_played': 1568813383}
review:
I've played this game on the PS4 and I swear you guys this is probably the most refined installment in the Neptunia series. 

The game's completely polished and difficulty is fairly balanced, there will not be any sudden power spike like in the previous entry. As long as you don't cash in on those weapon packs the game will provide you quite a challenge especially during early to mid-phase of the game as you don't have the access to most power-ups and the lack of full roster in your party. 

Soundtracks are top-notch and while they may still have the same soundtrack from the previous games. The new boss battle tracks are great, it will surely pump up your blood during those fight.
I also really recommend checking out the Deluxe pack while you guys are at it

The story has also a more serious and darker tone compared to the other, the game knows when to lay out the joke or when it's really the time to get serious.

And with the addition of new system like Giant Battle, combination attack and part break it makes the game have a more tactical approach. 

But still it could have been more easy in the use of it's meta joke and heavy references to previous installments.

Pros
+ Overall the best game in Neptunia franchise
+ A more detailed 3D models
+ Good story
+ Great music (check out Deluxe pack)
+ Branching story during 2nd arc, not gonna spoil much
+ Zero Dimension arc has the most well-written narrative

Cons
- may have a rare case of FPS drops, but It's probably depends on your specs of course
- minor bugs, not noticeable enough.

review:

- some hits and miss on other characters 


I really recommend this game if you want to have fun and also if you are an RPG/Visual-novel fan making it immersive and following by my score 98/100% making it A++  Good job compile heart and idea factory

author: {'steamid': '76561197989829214', 'num_games_owned': 1061, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1467867847}

author: {'steamid': '76561198040760415', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1653605904}
review:
Remember when you bought that game at release on PS4 because "heck i'll be done with it when it eventually releases on PC?"... yeah I remember too...

[b]Since most people already know what they're getting into by checking out a Neptunia game, I'll just focus my review on the things that stand out from previous releases for me...[/b]

The port works quite fine, runs at constant 60fps except for minor stuttering when transitioning scenes in general in my case, not really bothersome since these transitions usually occur with a fade to black or fade to white, eg: in-game to VN mode, or back to game, or when you press the Enter dungeon button you'll notice a slight pause before the game goes to load the level.

The Soundtrack is really good, with all known BGMs from other games and really cool additions ("Encounter of Destiny" so OP).

Regarding the game, it's more Nep! So I have no objections with that, without spoiling the story too much (already beaten it a few times in PS4) I'll say it manages to strike a better balance between comedy and drama than ReBirth 2, it knows exactly when to stop taking itself seriously, that's a good thing.
Giant boss battles are entertaining, though one might say there are few of them, they come at the right moments to make them meaningful.
They also brought back CPU transformation cutscenes, when you activate HDD form, you're treated to a short cutscene of waifu's transformation into CPU, never skipping those, they're so damn cool!

Combat is a bit more streamlined, the basics are there, you have up to 5 hits per turn, but there's no more Guard Break mechanic so the Break attacks are now named "Standard" and fill a middle ground between Power attacks damage and Rush attacks EXE drive fill. Combo length is now affected by the weapon the character is holding, each weapon has a first attack of one fixed type (Rush, Power or Standard) and then it has one or more combo slots in each type of hit (eg: you can have a weapon with 1 fixed Rush slot, and following it 1 more Rush, and in parallel 2 Power and 4 Standard slots).
In addition many attacks have a "combo trait", which gives your next hit additional damage when you fulfil the combo trait condition for it.
Sort of replacing the Guard Break mechanic, you now have some monters which have breakable body parts, these are usually located and can only be attacked from a specific side of the monster (ie: back, left side, right side, etc), this gives a somewhat tactical approach to combat, since breaking parts can help by reducing one monster's defense, as well as negating the use of certain skills on some others, sadly once you start overleveling the dungeon monters by a tiny bit this is no longer really needed, but it's an interesting system to develop further in sequels (yes please give me MOAR NEP)

There are also leveling and lily rank system changes, regarding leveling, only your front row characters will get experience from fights, this can look like downer compared to previous games, rest assured though, again trying to not spoil too much, you'll hardly have a party of more than 4 characters during your first playthrough, and by the time you have a full roster, you can easily create game discs with the Racing idea chip, which allows characters to gain exp when not in the front line (gives the "Learning" ability).
Lily rank has also seen some changes, like exp, lily rank is now increased between all members of the front row once you finish a battle, as opposed to the previous front+back row pair system.
Previous lily rank increasing actions between characters still work though, such as buffing, healing one ally or allies, using items on allies, and also switching the front row character with the back row coupled one will increase lily rank between them.

Last but not least, this is the first Neptunia game I felt like being "harder" than the others, midway through the game you'll notice you are tossed into the world being underleveled for the mobs you have to fight, so it will require some grinding and good use of combo traits, skills and whatnot, it's not something that will take a huge amount of time though, it lasts long enough to make it challenging and not boring, suffice to say, if you got the DLC weapons this does not apply at all to your playthrough.

[b]TL;DR here[/b]
Wasn't expecting to write this wall of text, but I guess you can see I really DO recommend this game, it's a good step forward for the series, although it might not be trying to do a lot of new stuff, it's still refreshing enough to go back Nep'n around Hyperdimension and its companion universes :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198156314800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1497153208}
review:
虽然因为信仰我买齐了DLC，因为信仰我给了好评，但在这里我要写上差评报告：

这操作真是要多难受有多难受！！！（尤其是手柄）

接着是一些使用手柄会产生的难受问题：
SAVE选单不能通过手柄上下移动，左摇杆和十字键都不会动，右摇杆只能翻页；
装备选单只能靠鼠标操作，左右摇杆和十字键都无法移动；
装备子选单同理；
队伍位置无法更换，不管是鼠键还是手柄都没法操作；
combo选择通过手柄只能上下移动不能左右移动，要左右移动还是得靠鼠标；
以上问题通过修改手柄键位均无法解决，玩一半强行就得换成鼠键使用菜单然后再拿起手柄继续移动。
（如果有谁能有解决方法或者之后出补丁修复了操作问题那就无视这些）

其他的诸如缩水之类的问题就不再多谈了，本身作为从PS4移植的作品缩水掉帧都是在所难免的，但操作这种明明就是可以解决的问题却搞得如此难受，真希望能地雷社把这些最·基·本·的操作问题都解决了再上市，至少和RB1、2、3一样的难度不高吧？（就算RB是从PSV上移植的V2是从PS4上移植的本身都有些不同但菜单的操作总该一样吧？）

不作其他评价，我回去继续玩PS4版了

author: {'steamid': '76561198020438964', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1501116640}
review: Ahhh, console video games (or vidcons as I call them), the ultimate medium of expression, able to convey any emotion from hatred to love, loyalty to fear, all in front of your eyes. Ah, and with lovingly crafted art, music, and the ability to control the action, vidcons are the ultimate combination of the high arts. While I tend to play the stoic, I will be the first to admit that vidcons have driven me to cry, to scream and shout, to feel actual hate; such is the power of this force beyond our wildest reckoning. And here I am, before you, to tempt your tongues with the taint of such a tantalizing topic. And the Japanese, the true geniuses behind the world of video games. Pah, I throw my scorn upon such incompetents of the West who would mock the true art of the Japanese with "games" such as Baldur's Gate and Madden. Perhaps the West is not as intelligent as the East, but this is a matter for another day. Japan has given us such masterpieces as the Final Fantasy series, Star Ocean, Wild Arms, and of course, Arc the Lad. Yes, some of the finest vidcons in the world were created by the Japanese. I come to you today to ask you in all earnesty, what is your favorite vidcon? I will reveal mine after the grand debate has illustriously begun, but not before the first poster falls victim to my plot of discussion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120058773', 'num_games_owned': 1717, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1467857751}
review:
edit: typos

V2 shows very positive improvements over its previous titles. If you are looking for more of the same Nepu~Nepu experiences. Go ahead, you will feel right at home.

However, the reason I am giving V2 a Negative is not for the Gameplay, nor its Universe but based on my Preference itself. I am prepared for a massive down-votes by the fans who don't want their favourite title to get some Reds, but if you are interested to hear my reason, continue reading ...

[h1]V2 as the VN[/h1]
[ ★★★★★ ]
I love it, seriously, I have no favourite waifu(s) in this universe. They did a wonderful job by adding settings like BGM fading during characters' dialogues / monologues, and etc. It is just that the current build has some weird tiny stutters during those scenes. 

If you are the type that skip the most or whole VN part, you won't notice this. It is not a major issue, but it becomes quite an annoyance if you are on auto-mode, and listen to everything, staring at characters for the whole dialogue. It is understandable if you are skipping something, but it shouldn't be there during the auto-mode.

[h1]V2 as the JRPG[/h1]
[ ★★★☆☆ ]
About average is the closest thing I can put it. It is a grindy sandbox JRPG. You are farming to level up your stats/skills, upgrade your equipments, kill the bosses, save the world, and your friends. These can be done at your own pace, can be customized to some points. 

However, despite it being improved, imho, it is still more suitable for handheld devices, not something for consoles, or PC. 

Neptunia series have been giving the vibes of pick-up 'n play, stop/save your progress, then put it down. I would love to play this kind of games when I'm outside, especially when I have to spend hour(s) waiting for something, but not when I am at my PC.

[h1]V2 as the VN, and JRPG[/h1]
[ ★★☆☆☆ ]
I don't feel that the grindy sandbox JRPG should be used for games that focus on interactions between characters, and story telling. I am coming to V2 to play as Nepu~Nepu~, in order to see her interacting with her friends throughout the story, not to keep on grinding to see Nepu~Nepu~ getting OP, with plots as the additional stuffs.

I know that there are things that you can use to make it easy, less grindy in order to progress through the story, but imo, that is the negative for me, as it breaks the balances to the point that, the RPG parts become boring, which will turn me off from continuing the story. 

It is not something likes the "I am here for the story" difficulty that you can find in several story centric JRPG tittles. That difficulty is tuned to balance the game so that, the RPG part is still interesting, but easy so that you steadily progress through the story, while, the harder difficulty is also available.

I would love to have the option to REMOVE the RPG part while keeping the VN, and have some choices to choose that affect how the stories go, but that would be in my dream.

Some tittles may benefits more from this combination, but not for Neptunia, imho.

[h1]TL;DR[/h1]
Good VN, and more Nepu~Nepu~ experiences, but still a bad combination with grindy sandbox JRPG for PC title. Recommended getting at better discounted price if you are not the Nepu~Nepu~ Fans. If you are new to the series, you should try previous titles in the series, which is much cheaper, with similar gameplay first.

review:
CHUGGA CHUGGA CHUGGA

Altough some of the issues might be due to poor optimization as well but I don't know enough about that stuff to know for sure. I'm running a GTX 860m i7 with 16GB RAM and my gameplay is pretty choppy.

I'm still giving a positive review though because despite the choppiness I can tell this is the nep I've been waiting for and I can't wait for either a) a patch that hopefully fixes some of the choppy gameplay or b) the end of the month when I'll be able to upgrade my rig to something that should play it smoothly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141371270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 9542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1531108138}
review:
This game has by far the best handling and most engaging gameplay out of the series. It doesn't have the same tedious grindy feel that the other ones had; it's actually enjoyable to try and obtain all achievements.

As far as story and characterization go, this game is only second to the original Hyperdimension Neptunia for the PS3. 
Even then, the introduction of brand new kawaii anime grills, and intense story all while keeping the same feel and subtext as the other Neptunia games definitely makes it one of the most compelling games Compile Heart has produced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083013373', 'num_games_owned': 614, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1635695187}
review:
TLDR; Worthy addition, it's amazing.

I've played Rebirth 1 & 2, and this is a MASSIVE improvement.
+Story really interesting
+Great improvements to combat
+Humor is hilarious as always
+Very little need to grind
+Completely reworked overworld
+4 character slots, like Rebirth 2 and after
+Tons of characters
+Graphical fidelity is much better
+Great soundtrack
-Takes a while to get new weapons and armors

I was really scraping to look for something negative for this game.
Btw, the DLC is not necessary at all. As with all other Neptunia games, it just makes you super OP and breaks the game. However, if you like cute costumes and don't mind a little fun, you can fork over the extra dough. Up to you.

One other thing I'll mention is that I get frame drops sometimes, even with vsync off. This is mostly during scene transitions, such as CPU transformations. Specs below:
AMD FX-6300
MSI 970A-G43 
GTX770 256-bit 2GB 
DDR3 16GB RAM

Overall, this is a worthy addition to the franchise, and I've loved it so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004311443', 'num_games_owned': 759, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 1577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1569, 'last_played': 1671496359}
review:
So far, this has been a vastly improved game compared to the previous Re;birth titles.
More complex dungeons, Better graphics, Better combat and much more enjoyable music than before.
And let's not forget the features of Fairy Fencer being combined, which is pretty nice.

Overall waaaay more better than the previous titles. I'll make a more elaborate review if I feel like it later.

7/10
